onXQyLokT4mdI7Ac10-kPQ.review_text: Solid fun spot for post happy hour.  Bar scene is fun at the large communal table. Sat there drinking ice tea entertaining our latest startup idea with Mr Fremlin. Come with a group of 12 or so. Good times!!

A0y_jp8vxK25oIpZdK5_FQ.review_text: Went for brunch. The Marlowe burger was amazing and the perfect hangover cure! I enjoyed their bloody mary. I enjoyed the tequila mule cocktail, the ginger beer in this cocktail was the perfect touch!

uyPcgr8vjT3FNIqNS1j9Wg.review_text: The Park Tavern what  a decor the place is great the food is delicious and the drink or good.

S0Pji5ZPQwlolC7vlq1lug.review_text: Hue L., our NYF, and I (and a special guest) had our "monthly" dinner here last night.  We had 8pm reservations on a Friday night.  Our NYF and I were about 15-20 minutes late, but Hue L. (and his special guest) were already there ensuring our table wouldn't be given away (and enjoying drinks while they waited).  Since we were late, and we weren't sure what the parking situation was in the area, we decided to valet the car.  $11, in case you wanted to know.  We were seated and sat around for a while before our waiter came and got our orders for appetizers (and drinks for me and our NYF).    Drinks: I got the McLaren (Hendrick's gin, cucumber juice, lemon, ginger beer), which I actually liked - even though I am most definitely not a ginger fan.  It was light, cucumber-y, and tasty.  Appetizers: We all split the brussel sprout chips because almost every review on Yelp has raved about them.  I'm not the biggest fan of brussel sprouts, but these were actually quite tasty.  We all also each got a Deviled Egg (one without bacon for our vegetarian special guest). I think the bacon definitely added to the flavor though.  The bacon and the extra little kick from the jalapeno.  Yum!  Entree:  Hue L. ordered the scallops (caramelized sea scallops, roasted cauliflower, braised baby fennel & grapefruit).  Our NYF had the tuna (Hawaiian tombo tuna, crispy sunchokes, white anchovies, baby artichokes & salsa rustica).  Our vegetarian special guest had the soup (caramelized onion & wild mushroom soup, slow-cooked swiss chard & poached egg) and polenta (Anson Mills polenta, Seville orange & red cabbage relish).  I had the pork chops (Italian butter bean pistou, dinosaur kale, toasted garlic & chili flakes).  The biggest plate went to the smallest person (that's me).  It was huge.  I didn't expect two pieces of pork.  I managed to *almost* finish my dish.  Yay me!  Desserts: Our NYF and I shared January's Birthday cake (Chad's Jamaican rum cake) and Hue L. and his special guest shared the tcho chocolate crème brûlée.  The birthday cake actually comes with a long, skinny candle.  How festive!  And, hey, my birthday's coming up!  But, the cake was really good.  Moist, slight rum taste.  I'm not a big cake fan, but it was really, really good.  Total for four people w/ drinks ~$180 pre-tip.  Final Note:  The food was good, but not great for the price.  Also, it's WAY too loud in there.  The tiling is not conducive in muting the noise.  And yes, the smell of pot wafts in every now and then when people open/close the door.  Blech.

EaxYL3Jc7nBrak9JfJ2syA.review_text: I had dinner in there a few weeks ago with my family and it was fantastic. I find the food always consistently good here. From appetizers to the entrees. I also find that the staff is very good at suggesting what's good based on your tastes. They also have a great wine list.   I think it's a neighborhood gem!

Aa8R-yIsitmHmv6HSO9H9Q.review_text: One of my favorite places to get a burger in the city!

yshuPf-UY_YUdXrfrGUUgA.review_text: Pros: Great food Tasty cocktails  Make reservations on Open Table  Cons:  Slow service  They don't serve mimosas by the pitcher  We put in a reservation online and told them it was our friends bday-- nothing :(  Overall, great restaurant and great food... But service can be a little lacking.

SPVVkVO7O-Dfb7y1XnpVZQ.review_text: I had one of the best brunch's here by far. I'm not much of a brunch person, but post the Park Tavern experience I think I have to reconsider whether I'm a brunch person or not. First of all their regular brewed coffee is amazing and they have raw sugar cubes, the experience with the coffee was almost as good as on my couch only it got better with the french toast with the fresh berry compote (I'm drooling as I'm writing this review). Me and my friend also ordered the veal, and the polenta, both were exquisite. The staff was friendly, they didn't rush us and when we were torn with the choices their recommendations were spot on.  I have also previously had a dinner experience here, which I can't complain about either, and of course the burger is to die for which I opted out of that evening and got the muscles, which were a bit on the over salted side for my taste, but still delicious nonetheless. This restaurant is definitely a must to dine at.

p7PoKtHEQ0AeFxumvS8OMw.review_text: This a fun place to go !! Heart of north beach and they have valet which is key.Great cocktail selection. Light pour on the wine though.I was with 2 other friends and we tried alot of items on the menu. The deviled eggs a must try!! Truffle fries not so much for 20 bucks ? very clean plates well thought out on entrees. I look forward coming back. the place is going off. I would tell my friends to come check it out!!

gfyW0vuJls8ARoHmogfcmw.review_text: I Liked it a lot first time I was here, and I always love the Brussels sprouts chips, PT fries, and the Marlowe burger, but service was way off the night we went.  Our server was totally disengaged, and it was completely different from all my prior visits.    the food is always awesome, but the service just really turned everyone off that night.   Fortunately, the manager, Adrianne, graciously reached out and offered to make up for it.

a5QS6g30nM4q2XFGP6Po9g.review_text: Good service, got our food out nice and quick on a crowded Sunday brunch. Relaxing, trendy decor too, reminds me of brunch spots in NYC. I came here with 7 other girlfriends after wedding dress shopping and man we were hungry! We split the avocado toast to start and tried the corned beef hash and potato, the smoked salmon eggs benedict, and the brioche french toast. Loved all the dishes, especially the brioche french toast. The persimmons gave the dish a nice flavor. I'd recommend splitting the hash and the french toast so you get some salty and sweet. Would love to come back to try the deviled egg sandwich, sounds delicious (maybe could rival Il Cane Rosso's in the ferry building?)

attCzdQanVQf9stHFvz9YA.review_text: We really enjoyed this restaurant. Have eaten here twice. The décor is really nice with available bar seating, chef's table seating as well as the regular dining room. Service is top notch, knowledgeable and attentive. And the food is so fantastic. One item we haven't seen elsewhere on any menu are the deviled eggs. YUMMY! How can eggs taste so heavenly and light with such complex flavors? But they're here. We also shared the cheese plate and a burger, and yes it sounds so ordinary, but the flavors are so unique and complex. The chef has a very developed palate. We also had their wedge butter lettuce salad which was dressed with a light, fruity sparkling dressing. I don't know how they made it so light and so different from the typical thick, heavy iceberg wedge salad, but they did. The only issue I had was when we were waiting at the bar for our table, I asked the bartender if they had a Moscato d'Asti, and he said they didn't. But his bartending partner corrected him. They did have my favorite Moscato, but it had already been opened and was flat. I could have sent it back, but why? I'll be going back for more good food.

Wn1evjudSSeRIPc3VIT-WQ.review_text: Came here for brunch on a Sunday. Here is a short list of why I'm coming here again for brunch.  -Boozy smoothie (banana, espresso, bourbon holy f*ck so good. I would order an entire pitcher of this if they had it).  -Baguettes with goats milk butter and the most delicious jams ever. -The egg & savories dishes were all great. Perfectly poached eggs. -Stellar service.  -Did I say Boozy smoothie?

FfG-PPZCz1sB4SKZoqsZkQ.review_text: Phenomenal tastes!! To name a few, the devolved eggs, fig dish, cheeseburger with a horseradish aioli sauce and a real fav is the brussel sprout chips!!! The venue itself is beautiful, great atmosphere and the service is fantastic!!! A wonderful place to eat & share time with friends and family!!

Gmp3qq_MlGFwwh8JDshDCw.review_text: I've been hearing a lot about this place from friends, so decided to go there for dinner on a Sat night.  Overall, I give it a 4/5.  Great food and lively atmosphere (if you're looking for that).  Service so-so.  Made reservations a month in advance, as it's gotten quite popular of late.  Upon entering, you get this feeling of stepping into a huge space (for SF at least) and very energetic (read loud).  Most of the time I felt like I was yelling to my friends.  There was a lot of "what did you say?".  In any case, we were seated promptly.  Food (apps) * brussel sprout chips - probably my favorite app there.  I could see myself sitting in front of the tv scarfing these down.  although, after eating a bunch, they def. started to get salty. * beef jerky - nothing special, other than the fact that you can order beef jerky at a restaurants * watermelon, feta, olives - this dish was ok, i'd pass next time * seasonal fig dishes - if you like figs, elegantly put together and very balance in flavor * demons on horseback - very well put together bacon wrapped shrimp.  I love bacon and i love shrimp, so how can you go wrong.    Food (entrees) * Grilled pork chop - next to the roasted chicken "Poulet rouge", this was a very delicious pork chop. * Poulet rouge - striking presentation, a small whole chicken served in cast iron, upright.  look for the images  you'll see what i mean.  Very flavorful and moist, rounded out with spinach and mini potatoes.  Service - so so.  Perhaps it was a busier night than normal, perhaps it was a relatively new waitress.  We were left waiting around a lot, for water, for the check.  When I asked our waitress for a wine suggestion, she could not give her answers promptly. Granted there is a huge wine list, so I will not fully fault her.

meAeTQ08eVZiKoFUM6d5gQ.review_text: A bit pricey but they do deliver a great product and experience. The thing that stands out the most is how the management takes initiative and strives to succeed.

Jc48H-71odXg-f6tBzP_nA.review_text: Great service, very professional! Extensive creative cocktails menu. The crispy polenta cakes were so creamy with perfectly poached eggs and rich wild mushrooms. Drinks were creative, fun and tasty! The ambience/stylish and modern decor was just as good as the food and service. Very friendly, stylish and yummy!

vBA7KQP9CcXVVxJl_Db6RA.review_text: We arrived at Park Tavern at 10:15 on a Saturday night.  It was packed but we had reservations:-)   I am not a vegetarian but was eating vegetarian and not drinking for a week when we went to this restaurant.  Deviled eggs - excellent!  4 stars Compressed watermelon - just ok.  3 stars Fries - very good.  4 stars Brussels sprout chips - very buttery.. too buttery. 2-3 stars.  Twice baked potato - this was super good.  Very cheesy so beware if you don't like a lot of cheese. 4 stars Ahi entree - my husband said this was excellent. 4 stars Chocolate cream brûlée - this was a cup of chocolate goodness!  4 stars  I would like to check this place out again when I can eat more than just veggies!

2AeujVhwRo8HuFqmVDw-Rw.review_text: Good gourmet food. Docked one point for a small menu. I'm all for picking a few dishes and perfecting them, but it was a really restrictive menu and some of the items are fairly similar.  But it has a good environment, the staff was nice, the food was excellent.  Try the fries with the egg dip and the steak is excellent.

34ShbH-B_s5CTihAf9zgfQ.review_text: We had our 15th wedding anniversary dinner last night and loved nearly every morsel.  Our waitress was lovely and comped us a piece of Black Forrest cake, which wasn't our favorite. But we LOVED the deviled eggs, chicken liver mouse, brussel sprout chips and "demons on horseback." We will definitely go back again!

59AFSXUHvFf3O21WKq4kOw.review_text: I happened upon this place by accident after seeing the dishes of the people sitting outside. I sat at the bar on a Sunday afternoon for brunch. I wasn't expecting much but the food just blew me away. I have never had such good brunch food ever. The drinks are equally as impressive. I had the Boozy Smoothie and the standard Bloody Mary.  The depth of flavor of the bloody mary was very surprising. I have never tasted one like that. Again, very impressed. The garnish was so delicious that I wanted to steal a few while the bartenders weren't looking but I held back.  I had the Avocado Toast appetizer... In one word Incredible.  How the heck do they get that much flavor in a piece of toast with avocado on top??  I followed with the chicken and the egg or something like that. It came with a deviled egg purée. WOW! I couldn't get enough! I had to talk myself out of going here for dinner the next night so I would try out another place. I will definitely return.

vd-XhIMCLNYwkeE92oWqIQ.review_text: Lovely place, lovely service, lovely food. It was bustling and warm and welcoming. The food was delicious   My husband ordered the NY Steak that was served with bone marrow, several types of potatoes, a wine jus, and amazing broccolini, I stole most of it off of his plate.  I ordered the scalloped with tempura forest mushrooms and roasted peppers. It was delicious and cooked to perfection.  We enjoyed the lemon chip appetizer served with burrata and a seared ahi dish. The desserts were great, don't miss the smore that's served with buttered popcorn ice cream topped with caramel corn. Oh-my-God!

_WhiaB69i00piWEEvTqEqw.review_text: I love everything about this place. The women running the show behind Park Tavern got it right in so many ways, combining comfort food with gourmet in the most unexpected ways. I had no idea egg could be used as a side dip to truffle french fries, or done up to taste like a bomb of delicious crunch and silky smooth in a deviled concoction from the gods. Wagyu beef jerky is just the perfect muchy snack to have with your green tea infused bourbon cocktail in an old fashioned brandy snifter.  I have loved cornish game hens since my grandmother made them for me as a kid and given her passing this past February it was heart warming to see the bird perched on cast iron pan served full with roasted potatoes and spinach. When I say I love everything about this place, I'm also including the high energy bar crowd who reminded me exactly why I miss living in San Francisco so much! (also praise for amazing service (better than Gary Danko's), great wine list, and our corner booth seating was perfect for boisterous conversation and general dinnertime merriment).

PgUvUJi_zCIVIgK233KfYw.review_text: We loved it. Great vibe, delicious food (loved the chicken, served whole and roasted on a pillar similar to an angel-food cake pan), and fantastic service.  Just a wonderful evening in a charming setting.

aC-rW559lqI33SwW9TE4ig.review_text: Wow... just wow! The deviled eggs are a must! Make sure to get those because they are incredible. The demons on horseback were also very good with the smokey taste and incredible sauce. The chicken was fresh and excellent, but just a tad too salty. My hamburger was very tasty because of the tint of horseradish. Overall, every meal was impeccable and I would love to come here again!

PTF4cAh8X4C-btthtViVoQ.review_text: Yup! They're doing it right. Tavernish and wonderful.

6x77pTixX4QJi6FwFdf5zQ.review_text: Food:  5 stars Value:  4 stars Service:  4 stars Ambiance/Decor:  5 Stars  An all-around great restaurant experience for a night out.  The experience begins with a beautiful, hip, upscale decor within a restaurant situated in one of the marquis spots in SF (adjacent Washington Sq Park).  Fantastic food.  Creative- brussel sprout chips.  Decadent- Crispy lamb croquettes with sauteed sweet breads (holy crap these were good).  Hearty- braised short rib over smoked potato puree.  All EXCELLENT.  A new local favorite.

fcfdhbuXVnSj9BHRhyhXGA.review_text: We love PARK TAVERN.  We've been there so many times and it never let us down. It is always top quality. It's great for either brunch. lunch, dinner or just having a cocktail at the bar.  Hostess: Alway nice, polite and friendly. Always tries to make people happy. Very professional.  Food: Outstanding. We love the truffle fries. High quality food. Great cocktails too.  Restaurant: It could be in New York. It is so cool and chic.  There are also some tables outside.  Service: Always attentive, friendly....just perfect. They make such an effort.

M_c4N57JFf0bF7KBOyULSg.review_text: I live in the area so Park Tavern is unavoidable since it's one of the few Non-italian restaurants in North Beach. There are certain aspects I love and some that I am not a fan of:  Like: The brussel sprout chips, smoked burrata (new on the menu and to die for!), deviled egg, the Marlowe burger is a must try! Probably one of the best restaurant burgers in the city. The decor is gorgeous and detail oriented. There is not one part of the restaurant that hasn't been perfected by the owners even the restroom decor is gorgeous. The service has also always been consistently great!  Dislike:  The pricing is a little on the steeper side and I do not believe it is in line with the quality of the food. I would avoid the brunch menu as many of the dishes I had were on the greasy side. And their wines by the glass could have a better selection.

YReUDU4aBATipSWQYxLtYg.review_text: We visited Park Tavern on a Friday, Jan 13th. Overall I would say it was very good, but as the other reviewers have mentioned, it's just noisy. It has a very busy feel to it, so I would take someone on a romantic date. It would be good for fun nights out but it's so loud that you end up having to almost shout at one another. We felt slightly rushed by our server but not horribly so.  Aside from the noise and busy ambiance, the food was very excellent and fun. We had the raw steak and raw salmon for our appetizers - both very good. We had the chicken and the pork chop - both very great flavors. And then we had the cheesecake for dessert - which was just okay - tasted more like a panna cotta then a cheesecake but still very good.   Over the food was excellent - and maybe if we had a different table (we were seated right by the pathway to the kitchen) then the servers rushing around and busy feel of the restaurant would be less distracting.

PgN2-n_CNPVld9pmWBCgYA.review_text: Food could be better... much better... the highlights were the brussel sprout chips and the game hen.  Low points--the twice baked potato is really really really greasy and the chanterelle side is overly salty.  Burger and sole were OK (could have been better).  Service is excellent.  But for the price and location... I'd rather be at the other Tavern--Wayfare.

WbSkwfB6YcCUJfn5O-tIvg.review_text: Food, drink, and ambiance is all 5+ stars.  Parking is 0 stars.  -Luther Vandross jams -Smart lighting and use of space -Masculine, sexy decor -Wine by the glass (list) pleases all; cocktails/beer for others -Approachable, but true-to-SF menu  SF style restaurant with an LA, see-and-be-seen feel

y3Gb0zhTZQO1SMS8xluoxA.review_text: Thank goodness some joint has finally figured out how to actually charge a bunch of schmucks $20 for an order of fries!  Truffle fries that is.  Oh, but they have a poached egg and caviar that comes with it so it must be worth it!  My review is based on a pretty great client dinner we had there, but I am also going to disclose some pitfalls.  The truffle fries are amazing, even for $20, but the egg/caviar part is completely unnecessary.  For my entree I ordered the lobster bisque which came out luke warm at best so that completely ruined it.  I didn't send it back because I didn't want to upset the tempo of the business meal, but from a food perspective it was almost inedible.  People at the table who ordered the pork chop or steak were blown away by how good they were.  The seafood orderers seemedd just satisfied.  The table also ordered one of the giant slices of birthday cake, which was surprisingly delicious -- and I don't even like cake.  Great ambiance, pretty good service. If I'd paid for my dinner, considering the bisque situation, I'd have been pissed.  Since I didn't, I'm willing to go back and try again with another client dinner in two weeks.  I think I'll stick with the good stuff:  fries and meats.

qFnrJoJul7vU7HMZjwbK2A.review_text: Went to the friends and family tasting last night.... AMAZING!!!! Well done Anna. Particular highlights: deviled eggs, burrata, and the cornish game hen.

hw53MAYbTKfjleDVlL5w2w.review_text: Just spent an evening at the former Moose's space now called Park Tavern. What a fun night! I had many good friends who used to work at Moose's and they all would be very proud of what the new owners are achieving here at Park Tavern. The vibe is lively, the service is attentive and the menu is very tasty.  Notable items we had were:  brussels sprout chips raw, local halibut, avocado & corn appetizer deviled eggs*** so good! pork belly bites (very heavy, but sinfully good) Have yet to try an entree but hear the burgers are great.   There's a very limited dessert menu- only 2 desserts and a couple of "boozy floats". Since my husband is a teetotaler, we skipped that course. All in all... a great new place in the heart on North Beach!

c8c8HhZ-blEoEhxr6qzCsQ.review_text: Bottom line at the top: High quality and tastily-prepared food. Great fine-dining atmosphere and can accommodate larger groups. Service is ok ... but should be better given the tier of restaurant. Portions are too small for what you're paying. Would I come back? Yes... if it's on someone rich's dime.  Came here for brunch in a large group. Thoughts about particular items: Avocado toast - this was incredibly incredibly tasty. But I have to kick myself in the face every time I start to think it was worth the $10 for ONE piece of toast, half an avocado, and seasoning. Smoked Salmon Benedict. Since when is one and not two poached eggs delivered with your benedict? Never unless you are at Park Tavern. On the plus side, the smoked salmon was plentiful and tasty. No way you'd fill up on this single $17 dish Marlowe Burger - can't speak for the taste but my friend who ordered it was not too ecstatic that the burger patty did not come close to covering the surface area of the bun.  Service was friendly enough but our coffee cups sat empty for a good 45 minutes until someone finally came by to refill at the very end of our meal. Small detail, but one that shouldn't be overlooked.

reFrM4Yrn3Di13w3EThAhA.review_text: One of the best meals I have ever had.  The compressed watermelon is to die for.  The lamb stuffed squash bossoms need to be on the permanent menu.  This place is delightful.

nAkP0xS6Yg_3CQtyFpOgrA.review_text: Easily made reservations for an early Sunday evening dinner. Ambiance and decor were great- but it was almost too dark for me to read the menu, and that's not usually a problem. Also, having an open kitchen onto the dining room is fun, but we left smelling strongly of fried food- clothes went straight into the laundry basket.  Reviewing as a vegetarian in a meat-centric restaurant so our menu choices were limited to begin with. We ordered the County Line salad with avocado crostini- greens (only greens) were lovely, as we expect from one of our favorite farms. The fava bean hummus was not great- I'm a fan of fava beans, but in this puree they were a bit too earthy tasting.   Our 'second course': the twice baked potatoes came out bubbling in a mini cast iron pan and were good and very cheesy (probably too much cheese for my dining companion but I enjoyed it). Also had the smoked  Brussels sprouts hearts and kabocha squash- really  looking forward to this one as I was hoping it would be the most hearty dish we ordered, but it was so overwhelmingly salty and fake-smoky tasting that I actually sent it back. Our very kind and efficient server offered to replace it, but we weren't all that hungry at this point and declined.  So not the best food, but an enjoyable atmosphere and great service. I would return to try some of the yummy sounding cocktails and maybe get a cheese plate or something. I imagine for carnivores the menu may be more tempting- I would love to see at least one vegetarian entree done well. Our server did recommend brunch for more vegetarian choices so I'd try them then as well.

RxvLBtUi_S_imOlh7B6v4A.review_text: The decor and ambiance are absolutely wonderful. We tried the lemon chips with burrata for the appetizer - delicious and refreshing! For drinks: Double Isaac and Country Lawyer, both strong with full flavor. Dinner was fantastic as well with large portions. We ordered the mussels and steak -traditional French and New American flavors together. The only thing that took away from the experience was our waiter. He didn't do anything wrong; he just performed his duties only. For such a nice restaurant, decor, food, we expected more. We would definitely go again, though.

hQ2PUPDC2dHhnKmWY6ThiQ.review_text: Order the black chicken, it's great if not consistent. I've had it served too dry before or without potatoes, but it's generally the best thing on the menu.  Biggest gripe: The. servers. do. not. get. off. your. nuts. Every 30 seconds they're filling your water, wiping your table, replacing your silverware, checking in on you, etc. It's hard to maintain a conversation when all of a sudden there's an arm jutting in your face trying to pour water into a cup that's still 3/4s full. It wasn't "good service", they were just trying to rush us.   Probably be a while before we go there again.

ENnRIehafm7kXQlyJeYfMw.review_text: My friend took us here when we were visiting San Francisco this weekend.  The food was phenomenal.  Get their brussel sprout chips, if they are available.  They were out of them the night we went, but I had them at their sister restaurant once.  This time we ordered the Gnocchi to share.  The gnocchi was crispy on the outside and soft in the middle...perfect!  The gnocchi was surrounded by by a truffled cream sauce and porcini mushrooms.  Not too over whelming at all.  For main dishes we got the Marlowe burger, the wood-fired sole, and the hen.  The hen takes some time to cook so put your order in if you know you want it.  It looks overwhelming when it first comes out, but it is delicious and moist.  The meat is so tender so it's very easy to cut the meat off the bone.  The staff pours au jus over the hen, which helps keep the hen warm and moist.  The stuffing is like the gnocchi, crispy on the outside and yummy goodness on the inside.  My dining patrons loved their dishes as well.  The staff was very friendly and the restaurant atmosphere was really fun.  The bar looked very happening and you can choose to have dinner there too.

6WTvPcqc1j5BgOYqBctaJg.review_text: This new "hot spot" will burn out within the year. Noise level is intolerable and the food was mediocre. Excellent deviled eggs could not make up for poor charcuterie, cold hamburger, tasteless roast chicken, appetizer-sized scallop entree, and generally immediately-forgettable cuisine. If they find the right new chef, they might be able to save the considerable investment. The bar is busy with those who will disappear to the next happening place in a few months, leaving Park Tavern to the unfortunate tourist looking for good food in North Beach. Very, very disappointing place that can't compete in San Francisco.

pHwlLUKTfB2kzBPRV0N4Ng.review_text: The food is here is very good. I really like the ambiance inside and the service is prompt. The only negative thing I can say is the price here is pretty high. Not sure if it's worth the quality of food that they serve.

6NpP6p_h8ueGRbtQ2qBd-w.review_text: My friend and I had a very lackluster dining experience here.  I got the feeling this was 'the' place at one time, but it wasn't when we were here.  My $29 fish entree just wasn't good ~ fish was nothing special, greens were super bitter (and I love greens), it was oily, and the dish my friend had was super heavy and cheesy.  Execution just didn't work.

rYsmFRRjPi4HvqUCdbZBEw.review_text: I have attended this amazing establishment several times and was never disappointed. It IS crowded, and all that (like most other places in North Beach), but the food is phenomenal: I will drive down here from Mountain View for the fries alone... On a more serious note: what makes the food great here is not just the fresh ingredients but the meticulous detail that goes into every dish; The above mentioned fries have the standard fancy restaurant truffle oil and some greens, BUT they also come with three dipping sauces: something truffle oil based (yummy), egg yolk (yummy-yummy), black caviar (foaming at the mouth yummy), this great attention to detail and thoughtful preparation extends to all other items on the menu I have tried. If you are in the area and the wait time is less then 30 minutes you simply owe it to yourself to try this place out. Period... oh, and whatever you do, don't forget to order the fries ;)

xp9UEkFyz7h7Ii1XVzU4tA.review_text: I wish this place was around when I lived in North Beach.  The food is amazing, all the way from the deviled eggs and demons on horseback (shrimp!) starters through the chicken fried sweetbreads and steamed mussels.  Definitely get the twice baked potato and brussel sproud sides, and follow it up with the chocolate creme brulee.  Everything here is excellent followed by some true moments of brilliance.  If they keep it up they're going to earn their first Michelin Star in a few years.

eU3wlg6SSNtiLDxifJgGEQ.review_text: Stopped by here on on a Friday afternoon as Park Tavern recently started a "Three Martini" three course lunch  from 12:00-2:30.  Love the concept but just stayed for some snacks at the bar which were delish.  Deviled eggs and bacon wrapped prawns can each be ordered individually which is definitely a plus in my book as a gal who just wanted some munchies.  Eggs are usually not my forte but I could have eaten 10.  Fortunately (but unfortunately) no bread is served before 5:30 so I had some of the bar's $7 beef jerky to fill up.  It was excellent. I will be back with more of an appetite and the hankering for three day time cocktails.  Oh, yes, and I must check out dinner which I heard was quite a scene.  Day time was empty inside but I did make friends with the only patrons (3) at the bar.  Note- I was very happy to see many Roses on the wine list, reminded me of St. Barth's

Cm-MYn9PcmurbePF-HBc5w.review_text: Great food, atmosphere, and location.   This is an ideal brunch spot. I had the crispy polenta cakes with sautéed wild mushrooms, poached eggs, wild arugula, truffle salsa verde & shaved parmesan with a Mexican Mule (Reposado tequila, lime and ginger beer) and highly recommend it all. There were six in our party and all the plates were thoroughly enjoyed. I'm not sure this place knows how to make a bad dish!

Q8NwQRZF9RyexwdItF1vXg.review_text: Some things a Black, Southern woman doesn't do.  One of them is say that anybody cooks something better than her grandmother.  So, you must keep what I'm about to tell you a secret:  Park Tavern makes the best deviled eggs I have ever tasted.--hands down.  Do you understand that Black women across the south are rolling over in their graves right now!! Forgive me! I just can't tell a lie--those eggs are that daggone good!  Everything is good here.  I don't have time to go down the list like I'm a professional reviewer, but everytime I've eaten here, everything has been exceptionally delicious.  It's loud so don't come here looking for a romantic evening for two.  It's trendy and delicious. You want a good time, good service, and exceptional meal--Go.  It's that simple.

ia9WOAZ6eXMbNgr4wvmJ1g.review_text: This place is not up to the hype at all. The food is a bit heavy for me and pretty average. There are just too many fried items on the menu, and the dishes overall just read very heavy. It's sort of like the place isn't sure if it's a pub or a fine dining establishment.  I had a pork chop that was pretty good, but it was sitting on a very dense pile of sausage hash. I asked to sub that out for something like a vegetable, and they said no. Really? Are you kidding me? I can't trade a side of hash for a different side that is on the menu? Are all the dishes pre-made? That cost them a star. For me, if i want to switch a side out, for that price, you do it.   Also, service was pretty damn slow.

ymX_IzyoQZD3E5e9nEShbw.review_text: I've been here twice in the last couple months and I can confidently say that this place is going to be a top recommendation for me.  The design of the dining room is inviting, comfortable, and not too loud...big for me as I approach middle age.   Anyway, I'm not sure the owners want this effect but it's the kind of place you just want to take your time eating and enjoy the food, the company, and the surroundings.  The restaurant is right on Washington Square so really there isn't a bad table in the house.  A window seat gives you a great view of the park.  Further back into the dining room, it is comfortable and cozy.    The service has been excellent both times I've been there.  The servers know the menu well and are happy to help you make your selection.  I haven't had to flag them down for more water, or more coffee, or delays between courses.  Just the right amount of attention, and excellent follow up.    The food is just friggin' delicious.  I've had the pancakes with bacon, and the hamburger.  All the details are done per your request, and the quality of the food is among the best I've had in San Francisco.  But try it yourself.  I'd be very surprised if you came away disappointed.

7Aoc10uCOU9utZ0HV6gABA.review_text: Technically, the food was three stars, but the value (quality/quantity/taste of food to money spent) makes me bring it down to two.  We had the deviled eggs.  Maybe we expected too much after all the rave reviews, but our table found them overly salty.  The egg flavor got lost among the bells and whistles of jalapeno, bacon, and chives.  Good, as any deviled egg will be, but not amazing.  We also shared the smoked burrata and heirloom tomato appetizer.  It was delicious, but the portion was tiny!  Our table of four had to share three tiny tomato slices, draped with prosciutto and burrata, and two pieces of dry toast.  I'm no glutton, but three tiny tomato slices seemed a bit meager.  For entrees, the seafood special was good - scallops, bay scallops w/ crumb top, calamari, and octopus.  Again, not better than anywhere else, but good.  The whole roasted chicken was good, but pretty much equivalent to any other roasted chicken.  The spinach at the base was disgustingly greasy, just swimming in chicken grease which really is not as good as you'd think.  The halibut was a little sad.  A diminutive portion of fish arrived on a big, long white plate with some legumes scattered about.  It did not inspire excitement and tasted just okay.  The pork chop, on the other hand, was thick, juicy and tender.  The only dish, I felt, that lived up to what we expected of the restaurant.  We departed not hungry, but a little disappointed in the food.  Also, be warned - this place is a definite scene.  Not everyone is going to enjoy and/or feel comfortable in this type of scene.  Most people will figure out whether they want to stay or go as soon as they get there.  On the plus side, the servers are very attentive and warm.

vUTzUxY5KBTMm3QQrZaLaw.review_text: Absolutely superb dining experience.  The ambiance here is glorious - beautiful tiling on the floors, tall ceilings, dark wood tables, and the front "atrium" dining space is perfect for Sunday brunch.   I've been here for brunch and dinner, and both are delicious.  Why do I keep going back?  Because of the *feel* of the place, and because of the BURGER.  I am a bit of a burger afficionado, and PT's tops my charts.  Seriously, it's my #1.  The deviled eggs are amazing as well - incredible combination of textures.  Get some wine, make friends with your service, and settle in for a great dining experience.  I love love love this place!

euJ-K8kFTgfIAE83tMknJA.review_text: Came for a company party.  Great appetizers & drinks.  My steak was overcooked though. super bummed.....  I'd like to come back and check out their brunch.

eXHX_bz9Hf4MCApEuWzWLA.review_text: Went here a few weeks ago with a group of girls and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly!  We shared the Kampachi and the Salmon from the raw starters list -- excellent! And elegantly presented.  One of the event planners who did Park Tavern's opening gala had hooked us up and so they surprised us with little glasses of champagne as well as an order of the deviled eggs. What a nice surprise! I never would have ordered the deviled eggs myself but they were EXCELLENT. And I love that they were cut horizontally instead of vertically :-)  For my main course I had the "Grilled sea scallops, roasted cauliflower, vadouvan, golden raisins & almond" -- the scallops were cooked to perfection and the combination of flavors was scrumptious.  Would definitely recommend this place!

Jpq1pHiNSYg0zC1XW4Pcvg.review_text: Park Tavern, I like you. A lot.  I like you a lot more for your bites and appetizers than your entrees, but that's still saying a lot.   Brussel sprout chips: Flaky, crispy, salted goodness with just the right amount of charring. Lemon chips: Thin and crispy, with a bit of citrus and tang, and good with the burrata cheese, but just as good without.  Foie gras terrine: I have to taste this one more time before foie gras gets  banned! Here's the thing, my allergies were acting up pretty bad and my nose was clogged, but i could STILL taste the  goodness. I can only imagine what it would taste like if my taste buds were at full capacity. Smoked kumquats were also yummy as well. Twice baked potato: Dripping with yummy butter and creamy, with big bites of potato skin. Fish dish: Can't remember what fish, but tender and moist, with a very nice crispy skin. Could have used more salt. Would pass for the next time though. Marlowe burger: This was a bit of a disappointment and I can't understand the hype. True, the patty was juicy, but I didn't taste anything unique.  Also, I had one small clump of what looked like iceberg lettuce (maybe about an 1.25 inches in diameter placed exactly in the middle of my bun, along with the caramelized onions dead center and the aoili, so there was a pretty uneven distribution. Bites all around the edges only got me meat, bun, and bits of bacon (okay, the bacon was perfectly cooked, so I'll give you that. bacon chips!).  Anyhow, pearl's burgers are much better to me.  Oh, but the french fries were really good. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with just the right amount of salt.  Pork chop: Omg. Looks like a freaking steak. Moist and flavorful, even with a clogged nose.  Great char on the outside too.  My friend (who actually ordered the dish) thought the pork belly was wonderful. Imagine foodgasm face.  Good attentive service as well, and I would definitely return, especially since I still want to check out the truffle fries and the homemade jerky.

Q-rcjUuCurPsFxe5OcHVmw.review_text: We just about walked by this place, as a causal glance at 10:52am on Sunday and we thought that any place that empty was empty for a reason.  Then I realized they didn't open till 11....  Doh.   Six of us and without reservations were able to get in and sit in the bar area without any issue, which was good as the place filled up fast.  Very attractive bar and dining floor, and for casual dining, the bar's long dual-sided table is excellent for conversations and a breezy in/out trip.  Service was friendly but really, really slow.  Slow to initially greet once we sat down, slow to get us menus, slow to get a drink order, slow to deliver said drinks, slow to come back and take the food order, slow to - well, you get the point.  Friendly, but slow.  The mixed blessing in that was that while we were waiting to order, many other people around us got food so we were able to see different selections.  Every plate I saw looked perfect - great presentation, fresh looking, and wonderful aromas.  By the time we finished, there wasn't a speck of food on anyone's plate.  Delicious.  I have no idea how I missed this place for so many years, but that is a mistake I won't be making again.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: I lived in North Beach for 5 years and the space was always occupied by terrible restaurants until Park Tavern came along. Thank goodess! The location and space is amazing and shouldn't be occupied by lame-ass reataurants, esp in North Beach  I really enjoyed my dinner here.   Highlights: - Lemon Chips with Burrata: Heaven. Truly. Light, slightly tart, and amazing with the creamy burrata - Deviled Eggs: i'm not a fan of deviled eggs but these were SO delicious! I wanted 5 more...! - Shirmp wrapped in bacon: i had this and the soup for dinner instead of an entree. It was yummy  Lobster Crab Bisque: tasty but really really salty. They should really take down the salt a few levels. Otherwise, a tasty dish - Dessert: Honestly, i don't remember what i had for dessert but it was good...just not very memorable  The restaurant was quite a scene. Be sure to dress for a night out!

QxOSTKLh9JL9xxfrj92N7Q.review_text: Great Sunday brunch.  Started with the avocado toast and a delicious bloody mary.  Perfect location, friendly staff, and the kitchen was accommodating to special requests.

vSlB0FqZRy7oFXx-TDG_5w.review_text: Great food, ambiance, and bar.  Love this place!

kQ5UnbhMFH7bFpL4Z7eiBA.review_text: Went here this past weekend with my girlfriend. We had the concierge at our hotel make us a reservation. We arrived about 45 minutes early and asked if we could be seated. The hostess bumped us up but while looking for a spot at the bar I spotted 2 seats near the kitchen line that I thought were the bar. Turns out they were dining seats, and one of the staff kindly offered them up if we were interested. Excellent service. I got the bar steak and she got a burger. Both were quite delicious. The truffle fries that came with the burger were excellent. The bar steak was a fillet, but came out pre cut into slices which I was not a huge fan of. The meat was a bit tough for what I would expect of a fillet, but still delicious. I saw many people order the cast iron skillet chicken, and wish I would have tried it since its their specialty. Definitely would go back and recommend it to anyone. The service was top notch, the atmosphere was great and the food was quite delicious.

GuJmNhHTNAj6AwyyfIXtQQ.review_text: Cristo offered the best wait service I have ever experienced! The recommendations he gave from everything from food to drinks were spectacular. He was very attentive to my party and made the night an overall success. I would highly recommend Park Tavern for good food, drinks and service if Cristo is working with you!

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: I was really looking forward to trying this place and finally had an excuse and opportunity to.    The set up is really nice and the large windows in front make it very inviting with an awesome view of Washington Square.   For appetizers, we got the Deviled Eggs, the Venison Carpaccio, and the PT fries Of the three I really liked the Deviled Eggs and PT fries.  Can't go wrong with a runny boiled egg you pour into the fries covered in truffle oil.  The Venison was good, but didn't stand out, and the the inclusion of Beef Tartare and Marrow made it confusing.    For the Entrees we split the Scallops, Duck and CAB  NY Steak.  The Scallops were really flavorful and perfectly cooked, however the entree was light, will leave you hungry. The duck and steak were good portions but both suffered from a lack of distinct duck or steak flavors.  In other words, the meat was a little bland.  The sides prepared with the dishes were good.  The steak came with a bone marrow, that was also confusing.  I'm not sure how they prepared it but it was dry and flaky, like they deep fried the marrow, and the placed it back in the bone. The potatoes on the dish were delicious.   Dessert also lacked a punch.  Although the Carrot Cake was good it wasn't outstanding.  And the S'mores wasn't too impressive, other than the ice cream portion.    The drinks were okay, nothing spectacular but good flavors.    Don't get me wrong Park Tavern is a good restaurant.  It has some very stand out dishes but also some just okay ones.

U_iL8kQ_GhxInnK1-1D96w.review_text: Ok other than not being able to get a table on my anniversary, it was great in all respects.  Food we had Brussel sprouts and they were too salty  so changed out for a tomato caprice type tart which was excellent. Split a burger next which we loved and the split a pork chop which had excellent flavor cooked right and we really liked the potato side. Drinks were great and service was tops.

Syt_iQqW_c9T2_lrvsddqQ.review_text: Yikes! Health code rating 86 out of 100? That's not good.   Anyhoo, I digress. Park Tavern....food comes in at about a 6 out of 10, service closer to 9...here's my story and I'm sticking to it:  Brussel sprout chips are delicious, but there must be a pound of butter in each bowl...everything's better with butter, sure....  My dining partner and I both had steaks, which were pretty good...she got hers with fries, I had the entree version which came with some other things....fries were way better than those extra bits and bobs, so stick with the fries as a side. Not the most tender steaks in the world but tasty enough.  I had a carafe of rose that was quite nice, the partner had a couple of fancy shmancy cocktails which she seemed to enjoy....  Desserts were a miss, one a very very dry cake, the other a shortbread with strawberry rhubarb, the fruit was tasty, but again the shortbread was super dry...  A note on the private room, where I attended an event not long ago - it has comfortable furnishings and is pleasant enough, but is more of a loft type space so the noise from the very noisy resto below will creep up into your event....the service was great, which seems a constant, but another very annoying thing about this room is that the stairs leading up to it are used by staff coming and going to the next level up....I don't know what they're doing up there, but the seemingly constant foot traffic was very intrusive and noticeable.   Still, there's a lot to like about Park Tavern - the Washington Square location, complete with outdoor seating, the communal table and bar seating which I assume is for walk ins, the decor (nice and sort of private club-like), the crowd - very San Francisco, as it has become an institution for a certain set in a short time. I'd go back, but not in a hurry.

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: After checking out the line at Mama's on a Sunday morning around 11AM, we decided to head over to Park Tavern instead. We were able to snag a couple seats at the bar and were helped by the bartender.  My bf ordered an espresso and the pan-fried corn beef hash. I ordered the warm open-faced deviled egg sandwich. After several refills of water (hydration was key), our orders arrived. The corn beef hash was pretty good, but I think I won with my open-faced sandwich. The bread did seemed a little TOO toasted, though and the edges were slightly burnt, making it difficult to cut into.  This place was busy the entire time we were there and a small wait started to form at the entryway. On our way towards the restaurant, I caught a glimpse of the avocado toast -- looked so good, I think I'll try replicating it myself unless I can get myself back here again!  Everything coming out of the kitchen looked delicious and the ambiance was clean and classy. Definitely a solid place to visit when out for brunch!

HDofmxUbwB2ap0rfVxS4dg.review_text: My friend Rupert paid his quarterly visit to San Francisco and it seemed totally fitting to dine alongside Washington Square Park on an almost balmy Spring evening.  Order the deviled eggs as soon as you're seated as they are delicious. I loved the very smoky bacon on top and believe the cayenne pepper and wafer-thin sliver of jalapeño takes this egg dish to another planet.  The Brussel sprout chips were very tasty as were the deep fried artichoke hearts served with garlic aioli.   I really savored the hamburger with that amazing horseradish aioli on the side. Wow. And the French fries were done to crispy perfection.  I especially enjoyed the peanut butter ice cream that was part of the foundation to our shared banana split. That was scrumptious!  My next guest shall be my lovely wife.

8eQhqyA5UePkD_EP6WSR8w.review_text: Love the location, the ambiance, and the service staff!  I was here last night with 3 of my girl friends to try some of the signature items that were posted on yelp.  We each had the deviled eggs (delish! Who woulda thought to place bacon on top!) then we went to the 'demons on horseback'  prawns (five stars), the twice baked potatoes were great, the squash salad (glad I tried it but wouldn't order it again), brussel sprout chips (LOVE!) and burratta with tomatoes (refreshing and delicious).  Moving on to desert, my friend already had her eye on the fernet milkshake from the online menu, but our server made a recommendation for the coffee ice cream with toffee and a roasted fig.... so good!  it was light, flavorful and satisfying. I will also give the service staff five stars for their patience with us because we didn't order any entrees this evening yet he never rushed us through the meal and he made excellent recommendations throughout the meal.  I highly recommend coming here although it is best to make a reservation as the place is always packed.   I will be back!!

zH2SvkifEIWT9it4ZR_g6w.review_text: Amazing. The atmosphere is great, the service was impeccable, and the food was delicious. I had the Creamy Cauliflower Bisque,  Grilled Pork Chop with sauteed baby turnips and caramelized apples...and omg...it was delish.

vIP4jEa2U4QAgQv9ULOXtg.review_text: To be fair...it seemed like a very off day today when we attended brunch, but $60/pp later no excuse!  Waited an hour before our food arrived, they brought us one of their featured toast's as an apology (could have given us free drinks rather than pushing more product), but unfortunately when the food finally arrived it was less than average. Not sure what happened in the kitchen today but I could have made myself a better meal and it wouldn't have cost $60.   I will say they were apologetic, but I honestly do NOT get the hype of this place!   Next Sunday Brunch at my house! I guarantee it will be better, and I won't charge my guests $60 a piece!  so disappointed!

8i98mywMaub5wpdAH573Sg.review_text: this place is by the same owners of Marlowe, but it bigger and much more classy. As everyone has mentioned you have the have the  deviled eggs, they are sooo good. I tried the seared tuna and the taste was really great

LYu1i818sRwZIf8Atany4Q.review_text: Great service and amazing brunch. We had the French toast, fruit plate, and hash. Everything was perfect!

ieVhVi_242uED09ILrL63w.review_text: Wow is this a great place. The food, cocktails, decor and service are all top notch and I'm thrilled to have this fantastic addition to North Beach.   As a North Beach local who knows much about the history of the place, I'm particularly impressed with the subtle yet classy nods Park Tavern gave to previous owners and restauranteur-legends Ed and Mary Etta Moose. A well placed photo of Ed next to the bar and namesake drinks on the menu. Even the nod to history is worthy of 5 stars.   Bravo, and you can expect to see me on a bar stool there often!

KFV9jDa1Lb36nZ5MGcrVcQ.review_text: We hit up Park Tavern for a somewhat last minute Sunday night dinner.  Unfortunately there were no tables for at least two hours, but we were able to grab seats at the communal table.  We had a great spread of some of their menu staples, like the PT fries, pickled vegetables, duck liver mousse, and steak tartare, as well as all of the more seasonal "last chance" items (the deconstructed BLT, the figs and cheese, etc).  Our server did a great job staggering all of the items, so were not too overwhelmed.  The food was both thoughtful and tasty.  The presentation was also top notch.  On the note of presentation, the space is very hip, almost as if the restaurant was airlifted out of NYC.  In fact, much of the clientele looked and were acting as if they were from NYC (and I don't mean that in the good way).  Very odd, compared to many of the other more low key SF outings I had that weekend.  I guess this place must be very "in" right now.

VCKV_fEm-nsuaJUrk_Ja2Q.review_text: One of my standby restaurants when in San Francisco. I'm not sure I've ever said this about another restaurant, but I think brunch here actually exceeds dinner.   I guess toasts are already becoming passe, but the toasts here (particularly the one with dungeness crab) are tasty little morsels. Both the sweet and savory brunch options excel: I particularly like the oatmeal-raisin pancakes and the warm, open-faced deviled egg sandwich.   Dinner options are well-executed and tasty. The NY steak and Colorado lamb are very good. I like the pork chop a ton, but think I prefer the one at Foreign Cinema. All in all, a great and predictable food experience that could use a dash more creativity.   A couple last notes: I love the space. It somehow manages to feel fashionable and timeless all at once, though the bar area can get loud and crowded. Service is always reliably polite and competent.

H2xQ1WAfb5FkFXW-ESc6AA.review_text: Called in for reservation around 6pm on Sat evening and as expected they didn't have table until 9:30pm. We passed by and gave it another shot. Turned out they can seat us outside and we took it. They have heater of course and blankets but proved to be inadequate later in the evening.  On to the food..  Brussel sprouts chips: good flavor and crisps but too salty. Lemon chips and burrata: zesty chips but nothing special otherwise. Burrata, as expected, is creamy.. We slather it on the bread as well. Cold roasted cauliflower: interesting take, good flavor but I'd rather have them warm..  Bar Steak : cooked right, amazing french fries but the butter wine sauce didn't go that well with the steak NY Steak: I finished everything on the place, except the bone. Each was tasty on its own but better eaten together.. yumm..  Roasted sea bass: my party really like the fish but not the sides, too salty.  Unfortunately, the heater was too far up and it got really chilly later so we decided to get desserts elsewhere indoor. Just a warning if you decide to sit outside on a chilly evening.

9fe41Vmw245Eho1PghHHKw.review_text: Quite a bit bigger than it's sister restaurant Marlowe, Park Tavern is just as good.  Excellent Service.  What we ordered:  Great cocktail menu - I had the Aquatic Park, twice Smoked Deviled Eggs - 4 stars Brussel Chips - 5 stars Clam Strips - 4 stars Crispy Panissa - 5 stars Sweet Baby Lettuces - 4 stars  Was an excellent dinner with a close friend. I'm definitely going back. I think my parents would love this place too.  Valet parking!

RzHct658biBtz7oCt95c6A.review_text: This review is for going to Eden Lounge, the pop-up bar upstairs, for cocktails. Turns out the website calendar is not accurate, leaving one sad birthday girl. Don't plan to have a birthday or other gathering there on a date based on the website schedule: parktavernsf.com/eden-lo… I chose a night where it was unreserved (the website indicated being open to the public at 7:00, i.e. no private events scheduled) for my upcoming birthday celebration, sent out invites, got an estimated headcount (about 15), then called today just in case it was possible to make a table reservation. I was told the lounge was reserved for a rehearsal dinner, and I told them they should update their calendar. I'm guessing they will have some disappointed people showing up on Saturday. I need to go re-plan my birthday and notify all of my guests now. Let's see if the Hancock Room is free...

GMSA1ne5rilzaTi3fAYl9Q.review_text: One of the most irrational and unsympathetic management team I've ever met. Not looking to get into details or contexts but do yourself a favor and never ever ever asked to talk to the hostess or the manager!!! They are the worst!!!

5Jdhv7DTe94ODUoH81RFzg.review_text: What an awesome place to hang out, drink, eat and have a good time!  My 2 girlfriends and I went there on a Friday night.  We left our cars with the valet which is $12 flat, cash only, great option! Way better than tired yourself trying to find parking!  It was packed but we found places to seat by the bar and we were so amazed by how great the service and food is!  JACK the Bartender is really the best and all the other bartenders are so nice and friendly too, they are there to make sure you have a good time!  I had the Maryettas Bubbles to start and it was good, not too sweet! We also had a bootle of a house champagne which was so good, can't go wrong with bubbles right?! To eat we just had appetizers that were to die for!!!! We shared:  - PT Fries - I had no idea how wonderful french fries dipped in a soft boiled egg with caviar could taste - You must trie this dish! - Brussels sprouts Chips - how can they make it taste so delicious and crispy?! Even who don't like brussels sprout would eat this! - Smoked deviled eggs - really yummy and the pepper inside the egg gives it the perfect kick! I didn't eat the bacon that comes on top of the egg but my friends said that it was so good!  And after those 3 dishes we got kind full so we jumped straight to desert, we tried the October's Birthday Cake, it was good but the appetizers wowed me more!!! Overall was such an awesome experience! I can't wait to go back there and have the Pt Fries again and try some more of their food!!!

8Z9ugoA4MGwiJVh-CB8bhQ.review_text: Amongst the sea of the typical and traditional Italian options, Park Tavern sticks out like a sore thumb. We stopped by for brunch the other day after making our reservations through Open Table and while doing so we'd requested window seating.  Lo and behold, upon arriving we were lead to a window table just like we had asked - surely an indicator of fantastic, detail oriented service.   The restaurant was decked out with Christmas decorations adding some festivity to the ambiance. We sat next to a very large, plush black and white houndstooth wreath. Very chic. The patrons, sophisticated, older.   When we lived next door to Marlowe on Townsend, my husband would grab a Marlowe burger for lunch quite frequently so he skipped the burger this time and opted for something new, the hash. I had the poached eggs and crispy polenta cakes which was exactly texture and flavors I was wanting; earthy, velvety with a crunch and the bitterness from the small bed of arugula and mushrooms. We also had the Breton butter cake which was reminiscent of a Kouign Amann minus the sweet, glazed top. The buttercake, I'd probably skip next time.   Service was quick and no-fussed, just how I like it.

aaXANaiPk9xzMEqo3t5l_g.review_text: Deviled eggs were delish, the burger was very nice too (both of these left me with bacon overload!).  What stood out most was their excellent service. Our server was amazing and replaced my wife's order twice (kinda their fault) and didn't even charge us for it.  The corkage is reasonable ($20) and they decanted our wine (what turned out to be a great barbaresco).  Overall great value and a nice dinner spot.

MO-fTZwzQn8J7XHYTCQ8qw.review_text: Good service, great food for apps and brunch--have yet to go back for dinner.

xqhZ42G1rWtGWJN36xFdgA.review_text: I now think they have one of the best burgers in SF! I love this place!

UOTU64MzzEOFw7AXeGjCaQ.review_text: Love Park Tavern and I order the roasted chicken the minute I sit down. My fav is the stuffing...literally thanksgiving on a plate, but for summer they decide to NOT do stuffing. I want my stuffing back!! Service was exceptional, as always. Special shout out to the new hire from Boulder! He's great!

QStcNe7SBrEc6X61oanhHA.review_text: I wrote Park Tavern an e-mail about my experience. I received a prompt response by the owner. She then personally contacted me and my grandma and rectified the situation. I am very pleased with Anna's attention to customer service, and her willingness to 'right' things. I firmly believe what I experience is a fluke, and I will definitely go back again.

Sv0s48ksQtRl4gBGNtv36g.review_text: I went there on Sunday and the service was HORRIBLE. It took a while to get our orders in and when they were it took FOREVER.  The couple eating next to our group had a full meal and left.  It took so long that our server came back and asked if we wanted a dessert menu.  We were appalled.  We told her we didn't get our food yet and of course our food was served to us instantly so it was obviously just sitting in the kitchen.  My skillet wasn't hot, the burgers were ok, everything was just horrible. One of our orders were incorrect as well and they cooked up a new burger and it was out in 5 minutes which shows that their cooks don't take THAT long.  The food was ok and nothing spectacular.  If it was then maybe it would've been worth the wait.  We had two servers "help" us and afterward they never came back and I think a supervisor assisted us and she wasn't very apologetic about what happened and she seemed annoyed that each person paid with separate cards/cash even though we asked for separate checks.     We had already lost our appetites so I don't even know if the food was good or not but I will not be returning to find out.  PS My friend ordered an Americano which took a bit to be served but it was $6.00! WHAT/  Never again.

w4GMOGkIApWBsrcliW4Bbg.review_text: We had  our annual company dinner in the upstairs room and the service was warm , professional and very accomodating to our needs.  Everything went amazingly well, since it is not easy to serve 50 people.  The evening started with the deviled eggs which are amazing as reviewers have said, as well as a shrimp and also a steak tartare appetizers!   Our dinner was served on long tables family style with our  first course being he burrata and lemon chips, the PT Fries  and the  baby lettuce salad with an amazing mix of, grapes, fennel, radish, avocado and the dressing had just the right touch of tarragon.   All were amazing and disappeared quickly  The main dishes were the red snapper, chicken and sliced New York steak ribeye and the sides were brussels sprouts and creamy, cheesy,  twice baked potatoes.   We have some in are party who were vegetarian and they served a casserole for them. All of these including the special vegetarian entree  were wonderful.  Dessert was a scrumptious pumpkin cake with cream cheese frosting that is now a new favorite of mine.

LoRQeclsYws6ysbjHG4bUw.review_text: I am sooo glad Park Tavern came to our hood.  First off, I was expecting some serious delays, even though we made a reservation.  The restaurant was still relatively new (back in March) and it was Saint Patrick's Day, so there was A LOT going on (not to mention the Bachelor - yes, the reality TV bachelor - was there with what's her face)..  Our large party was seated promptly and we were greeted with glasses of champagne from our super friendly, knowledgeable, and timely waiter.  I had noted on Open Table that it was my dad's birthday, so they brought this out for us!  The appetizers and salads were amazing, as were the entrees.  As for the space, I LOVE the modern tavern feel and the openness of the restaurant.  We loved it so much that we're going back with a group of 8 for a post-graduation celebration.  So excited!  Definiitely make a reservation and go for brunch too - the menu looks delish!

JwLcwpZoHsOisva8CdLp3Q.review_text: Do you want your life changed? Get the PT FRIES! They are the best fries I have ever had. In my life. Wonderfully crispy with truffle, a soft boiled egg, and caviar. I never knew such flavors could exist together in complete perfection.  We found PT Tavern by referring to the Top 100 SF Bay Area restaurants list. We have been to several others on that list, but this was by far the most delicious.  The crispy bone marrow on the venison carpaccio melted in my mouth. The red snapper was cooked flawlessly with delicious Italian butter beans with bacon.   I wish my stomach was double in size.

Fv_uIp1ywVilg8tNtiW9UQ.review_text: Tasty food and good service!  After putting my name down at a pizzeria for a 1.5 hours wait (with the car at a 2-hour parking) a woman standing by with her kids suggested we go to Park Tavern, which has more seating, so we took her advice!  Service was good. We sat down at the bar area, and someone cleaned the table right away, someone else got us our menu and water. The waitress, Aura, and all the other people were friendly, helpful, attentive, and fast. We had our waitress but I there were about 5 people filling the water, serving food, getting drinks, taking plates, etc.  Even though service was fast, we weren't rushed at all, and I like how they took care of us.  I ordered the Poulet Rouge, which is game hen standing on top of spinach and peewee potatoes. Sauce was good, meat was juicy, but the spinach was salty. If you eat the chicken with the spinach I guess the salt is balanced out. I was happy with my dish! $28  Dad ordered the scallop. We laughed at his plate, because he had 3 little scallops with some veggies decorating the plate. Fancy-Schmancy! My dad likes a hearty meal and more bang for your buck, but he defended his dish. The scallop did taste very good, and the salt was more balanced than mine. Dad approves. $29  Mum ordered the bar steak, which came with fries. Steak was good, but she did not like the red wine sauce. Too bitter for her taste. The fries were good, but she was upset the sauce was soaked into the fries. Might have been better for her if the sauce was on the side, or the fries on a different plate. $27  The coffee was good. Did not need sugar or cream. It went well with the July Birthday Cake, and it was fun blowing out the candle, even though none of our birthdays is in July. The lemon poppy cake wasn't really standout, but the apricot on top made it a treat! $8 and $9  Afterwards, it was funny to think how we got to Park Tavern. We originally came to Little Italy, to eat at Original Joe's, but we passed on it, because we thought it was too expensive and 20 minutes too long a wait, not knowing all the pizza places had even longer waits and all the other restaurants were just as expensive. So we ended at Park Tavern, which is more pricier than Original Joe's. The food and service though was worth it. And it's nice to treat your family to good food once in a while. Especially if Dad is picking up the tab!  Overall, Park Tavern was a good place to eat, and I would definitely suggest it as a place to take visiting family and friends.

YsmpZbsJAWRT0jZOzhJeLw.review_text: Hmm, maybe I didn't order the right thing. I went with two deviled eggs and the shrimp toast. The shrimp toast had way too much mayonnaise in it, basically masking the taste of the shrimp. The deviled eggs were good but over-hyped on Yelp. The service was great and it's certainly a cool ambiance but I'm not sure this worth the high prices.

Y1ds7XK1G8not8LvR_V8rg.review_text: I was pleasantly surprised to secure reservations for two on such short notice. I was expecting a line around the block? This was the best brunch that I've eaten in a long time. The polenta cake with truffled shrooms and poached egg was amazing!!! The Confit Chicken was a plate of amazing textures with shards of crispy chicken skin. YES YES YES. It was clear that happy people work here. I love to see that. This will be my first dinner destination next time I visit SF. The space felt warm, unfussy, and classy... the holiday decorations compliment it well.

MlHVyZCeyb0PgagwSLKSIg.review_text: Went here on a recommendations from a friend we were meeting. This place is very high class spot in North Beach area. The customer base is of those who probably have a company expense card.   We order the Sea Bass dish with mash potatoes and veggies. When it arrived at the table our eyes were larger than the cube of fish on our plates! The mash potatoes were literally a little squeeze from a pastry bag and spread out in a tear drop on the plate to hold the veggies which consisted of celery and a few chopped olives on top.   Food quality, flavor, presentation and service was the reason for the 3 stars. I might have given them 4, but when I walk out of a place after spending over $60.00 for one person to dine with a glass of wine and tip and I'm still hungry, there is no reason to ever return.   It had all the qualities I look for in dining out but I didn't order a sampler plate for that price.  There are BY FAR way to many other fabulous choices in the North Beach area to spend that kind of money and walk away feeling satisfied you got your $$$ worth.

w-4nQ-PHW_U8CCR0S1jT_w.review_text: Somewhere between 3 and 4 to be precise... The service is great and the vibe is fun and a bit old school NY. The food is tasty but has a tendency to be hard hitting heavy food start to finish. And pricey. $17 truffle fries anyone? Out of morbid curiosity we tried them but the heaviness of the fries, the buttery black cod, the swimming pool of lobster bisque, even the kanpachi sashimi with shiso and garlic (how do you make sashimi heavy?!) put us all in a bit of a cholesterol funk.  The biggest downer? Not the resident, late night mouse - it's kinda cute - it was the chocolate creme brûlée. I swear they microwaved it. The brûlée top was super chewy. Pass.

v9zSroLwwwhEFhAHoJI47Q.review_text: AMAZING restaurant!! LOVED the food, decor, management and service! Well done! Can't wait to go back!

5X9-5vDT03_RhSD6irDtiQ.review_text: My wife and I came here for a Sunday brunch.  We'd made a reservation and were seated immediately.  In short, the place was fantastic.  We started with the almond and cherry coffee cake, which was amazing (that was our appeitzer).  My wife had the brioche french toast, which is great.  They had made a mistake with my order (cast-iron baked eggs with jamon serrano and spinach, but with no cheese) so we got to course the meal.  The eggs were great, though a bit too much spinach.  The highlight was our "dessert", which was the avocado toast - simple but delicious.  We're both keen to come back for dinner soon.

ItuJ3KfxtoPUVW1XNtk-9A.review_text: Reservations is a must. Don't walk in here like I did and learn the hard way. We ended up standing around waiting for a space to open up at the bar for 45 mins. It wasn't fun. The place was packed and you really have to snatch any seat that opens up.  Anyway, thankfully the food was worth the wait. Marlowe burger ($14), you really can't beat that burger. It was simple but it's simply the best. We also had the brussels sprout chips ($7) and the deviled eggs ($2 ea). The brussels sprout chips were ok. The first few bites were great but then it got really salty. I would not order that again. The eggs however were really good. We also had the poulet rouge ($26), presentation was awesome. The meat was tender and juicy, however, it was kind of bland. The veggies at the bottom of the plate was flavorful but the chicken was not. For dessert, we had the panna cotta ($7). It was good but not spectacular.   Street parking sucks in that area. Luckily they have valet.

6yo4zYRxLAAEDk-eF3xcOw.review_text: Park Tavern never disappoints! Their brunch menu is fabulous. I always seem to come back to the polenta and the coconut fritters. You need a reservation on the weekends, it's busy. All in all a great brunch spot. I need to try the dinner menu!

d-5gWThyELEJZdFKUx5Pzg.review_text: I'm going back for the chicken...  I mean the Petit Poulet Rouge...  Enough said right? If chicken is that good to deem a return, there's nothing more to say. But why? Now I would say it's the best damn chicken I've ever eaten, but I'm going to save you the hyperbole (that often exists when people talk about food) and note it's not actually chicken... it's game hen. Yeah same deal, but there is an advantage of using a young chicken that lends itself to being tender and juicy. That being said (and I'll go ahead use the word "best"), it is the best piece of roasted poultry I've had in the city. The fire roasted and perfectly seasoned skin would raise suspicion that the meat could be dry. Not so! As I attacked the wings and legs the meat was, excuse the KFC reference, finger lickin' good! Then as you slice into the breast meat and see the juice seep out you already know it's a winner. It was. Go get it. Stop reading all this hype. I should also mention that its standing at your attention when served to your table! You'll see. Go get it. Damn, I guess I did not save you the hyperbole...  As for everything else, it was above average if not very good. Park Tavern could be just another cookie cutter, urban socialite, new American cuisine with a signature bar program resto that has flooded the restaurant scene. So many of these types of places are just another face in the crowd. The element that hits is the food. And obviously that's the element that brings an establishment up to the high echelon of restaurants that will ensure its longevity. Soon enough it will be mentioned in the same breath as NOPA, Marlowe (its sister restaurant), Zuni Cafe, etc.  And one last piece, Park Tavern's poultry blows the following out of the water: Zuni Cafe's Roasted Chicken on Warm Bread Salad that has a one hour prep time from ordering and NOPA's Rotisserie Herbed Chicken.   Damn, I really suck at controlling my excitement for food. Yay hyperbole!!!

59XIGyX0A2-2i4BhydlhSw.review_text: Very poor service and sub par food. Went there for a late lunch on Friday afternoon. We waited 15 minutes for our waiter after being seated. After receiving our meal the waiter never returned to check on us. When my daughter joined us (about 15 minutes after getting our meal) still no sign of our waiter. After she sat with us for 20 minutes she went to the hostess and asked for our waiter. Another waiter showed up and finally took her order. We didn't see our original waiter until he gave me the check. I won't be going back.

nos7eU-naFk32w15RwvDRA.review_text: Can't go wrong with Park Tavern. Great for date and groups. Drinks at the bar or dinner/brunch. Burger & Brussels are AMAZING.

HsLAZW5kBgaZxwtbveJbXg.review_text: Went to Park Tavern last night to celebrate a new job offer for me and a legal name change for my recently wed friend! We arrived early, 5:30, and easily scored a seat at the bar. I've shown up later a few times and have been forced to give up on getting in at all. Reservations are a must if you aren't okay with squeezing in at the bar or communal table.   We had a bottle of champagne to celebrate, good rec from the bartender on one of the more reasonably priced bottles (Laurent Perrier). We each had one deviled egg, wow. The little crunch of bacon on top was amazing. We then shared the lemon chips with burrata. Flavor. Explosion. The lemon was sliced extremely thin and then fried to a crisp, and served with a very light burrata. It went so well with the champagne, I could have eaten just those all night.   We then shared the gnocchi, which was loaded with wild mushrooms and just the right amount of truffle. Finally, just to be extra gluttenous, we shared the pork chop. This was so delicious, but after all the other food the meat combined with the parmesan risotto was a bit rich for me. I brought it home to feed my boyfriend and he more than appreciated it.   This place is a true gem amid the touristy Italian spots that dominate North Beach. I will definitely be back for more indulgence soon. I've got my eye on the cocktail list!

2pTCaGCg9vfspnPCVXue8Q.review_text: This review is for brunch.  I am not a huge traditional breakfast fan, so the brunch menu at Park Tavern appeals to me a lot.  The execution of the creative dishes was excellent.  I ordered the smoked fish cake.  It was so good, I could have eaten another plate.  My table also ordered the polenta cakes, which came with outrageously good mushrooms.  There was also some hash, which was good, but not as good as the other two dishes.  The bloody Mary comes with bacon.  Enough said.  I cannot wait to go back.

__05rytNjsye9MBhqB0DMA.review_text: I celebrated my birthday here with friends. We were seated at a round table which was perfect for our table of 5.  A bit noisy, but it was ok.  We shared the deviled eggs, brussel sprout chips, bacon wrapped prawns, and the venison tartare. All were excellent, but the deviled eggs and bacon wrapped prawns stood out.  It was the bacon on both dishes that made it over the top!  My entree was the pork chop while my partners the lamb.  Both were excellent, but the pork chop more so. It was seasoned and cooked perfectly medium. Not dry as I was concerned, as I wanted it med-rare, but my honey advised not to.  For dessert we shared the birthday cake and apple crisp.  The birthday cake was only for my birthday. It was ok.  But the apple crisp cheddar was Devine. So darn delicious. Sweet, salty, and fruity.  This is the dessert for all dessert lovers!  Services was excellent!  Thank you park tavern for making my birthday memorable!

K0zrsXqu55JPwT4dnvNUDg.review_text: I'm going back for the ambience and location as well as the drinks....and food.  The Poulet Rouge does not disappoint as it is indeed tender and so juicy with that iron cask holding the thing together.  That is one piece of impressive equipment to roast a game hen in.  The only gripe i have about the overall experience is that they love salted everything.  I left with a very dry taste in my mouth and it can only be attributed with salt.  Everything was drenched in salt, but not to the point of disgust, but a little over enough to notice "my, this is kinda salty"  Appetizers -Lemon chips with burrata - simple, and yet refreshingly indulging -Foie Gras Terrine with caramelized kumquats - excellent, but whenever is anything with foie gras not?
