Ovq47AEMbN7VKI-2HQE0-g.review_text: Food was terrific, service was attentive and atmosphere was awesome. I just wish they did not try so hard to turn tables.

bA6sFAZTIc5ddwpnB_WJUw.review_text: Tossup between four and five stars but they're new and oversalt the crap out of their food so I'll give them four.  Gorgoues location.  Inside is epic and outside is perfect if you have a dog or kid or noisy monster.  It's only been open a few weeks and I've had half the menu.  Let me tell you, it's all delicious.  Perhaps the best so far is the pork chop (sorry, Jewish ancestors).  It's a double thick, moist, smoky tender lump of deliciousness.  Seriously, one of the best pork chops in my life.  Other random stuff is inventive, inspired,and tasty, without breaking the basic idea that it's all comfort food.  The heirloom baby carrot salad, the most giiry thing on the menu, was pickled and salted and delicious.  On the other side of the coin, the caviar style fried oysters were like five po' boys without the roll, days later I'm still fantasizing over that.  The service?  It's what I call "your hand been shook" service.  Back when Bill Clinton was President people met him and they all said, when Bill Clinton shakes your hand, your hand has been shook.  That's what I think about Park Tavern.  When you eat there and you get service, youv'e been served.  These people are professional career waiters, with that perfect combination of skills, weird semi-snarky cockiness and teasing, loving concern over you and your food, and just plain interesting personalities that makes for an experience you come home and to to sleep with.   I can't say enough good things, it's like an hour and a half experience with a personal food guy and you leave smiling all the way home.  The main reason for four stars instead of five is they need a little more work to polish it up, and way too much salt and butter.  Nevertheless this has the potential to join the pantheon of great SF restaurants.  I'll definitely return for the second half of the menu.

TpHdE9o8Hc6x2PfVsbb-Bg.review_text: Dinner out with the girls.  Wait staff were wonderful, all starters were amzingly good. My grilled Scallops were undercooked for my taste, but maybe just right with those who go for sushi scallops.  Finally, there was one desert that was inedible, the apple crisp.  I am not sure what the problem was, salty, burnt, just off?  The attention to service during the dinner was great.  I'd like to try it again.

m6p5knAyIS79s6WNbeIdGw.review_text: Oh Park Tavern I want to love you and have been waiting patiently for you to open in my hood, but after my meal last night you have simply left me sad and confused. I arrived on time for my reservation and was told to wait in the bar. Fifteen minutes later my party was seated. Our waitress greeted us and was a little off from the start. She gave two of the three people at the table water and walked away. She then returned to announce that bread and pork fat butter would arrive soon with great enthusiasm. The bread and butter shortly arrived and I was less than impressed with the fancy hawaiian bread and butter that tasted simply like butter. We ordered a bottle of wine and our food. The pork bites arrived first. What the hell is this restaurant doing serving fancy pork rinds?!? I was so confused when they were placed on the table. These are the pork bites I have been reading about?!?! On a better note the deviled eggs came next, the highlight of my meal. I wish we ordered more than one per person for the table, because these are keepers. For my entree I ordered the famous Marlowe burger. A burger I have enjoyed many times at Marlowe, a burger I only ate half of at Park Tavern. The burger was simply OK, nothing like the Marlowe burger and nothing to write home about. We also ordered the twice baked potato side to share for the table, my first bite was amazing, my second was just OK and the third just sucked.  I know Park Tavern just opened, so I will give you a second chance. Please don't let me down again.

RdGgH2C655oklnPT3oZJ0A.review_text: Read about this place on 7x7 and decided to come try for dinner.  Had an early 5:30 reservation for dinner, but there was a party going on at the bar so we didn't feel too lonely being early birds.  Loved the ambiance and atmosphere.  Friendly attentive staff.  They had a great selection of cocktails so I started the evening with Mary Etta's Bubbles which had framboise and lemon twist in it.  Very flavorful....my kind of drink!    For starters, we had their famous Smoked Deviled Eggs which came with bacon, chives, and pickled jalapeños.  You can order as many as you want as they sell them by the piece.  I loved the smoky taste of the bacon with the egg.  I could have probably eaten another.  Went well with the Acme bread that you get.  We also tried their famous Demons on Horseback which are lardo-wrapped smoked prawns with some remoulade and cucumbers.  It had a nice kick to it and the prawns were cooked perfectly that it was fresh and juicy.  YUM!    After the cocktail, I wanted a glass of wine with my dinner.  I was happy to see they had grenache so I ordered that.  It's not very often that the wine glass list consists of various regional wines.    For dinner, I had the Roasted Sea Bass which came with fennel and baby artichokes.  My husband had the C.A.B. NY Steak which came with braised Kobe beef and marrow-stuffed bone with potatoes and broccolini.  We both enjoyed our dishes that we left nothing behind.  After all the great food we had, we decided to try their dessert as well.  The only thing the stood out for me was the Tcho Chocolate Creme Brûlée.   All I have to say is, what a great ending to a lovely meal!

WBiBUFlN4BNp_VRbtQwSOQ.review_text: Love this place. Have been many times, always tasty. This is another place I tend to get the same few things. The fries are simply amazing, I tell people about them all the time, served with truffle oil and a soft boiled egg with caviar. Really like their mussels, chicken... it's all very good. Solid cocktails as well. Plus, they have beef jerky on the menu; Beef Jerky! Can't go wrong.

wzzmDZgDLsPd4eC5JvSrMw.review_text: Came here for late night dinner (get a reservation way in advance because no one wants to have dinner at 9 right?)  I got to try a few of the dishes  BRUSSELS SPROUT CHIPS - Not that great.  A bit burned SMOKED DEVILED EGGS- Yum! PAN-SEARED SALMON- Yum, would recommend APPLE CHEDDAR CRISP- This was amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Best part of the meal.  I have dreams about this crisp. OCTOBER'S BIRTHDAY CAKE - Meh   Would go again, but mostly just for the crisp.

FHlDpclqvcfmvMjOE3fquA.review_text: Wow. Hats off to the chef of this place AND the designer.  Not only is it a GORGEOUS space but the food is orgasmic.    I've been here twice, first time was for a casual dinner in the bar.  The brussel sprouts made me want to join the Park Tavern church (if there was one) . They were DELICIOUS.  The place was packed! Good lookin crowd too  This morning I went for breakfast.  I had crispy polenta cakes with poached eggs, arugula and mushrooms.  WOW. No salt and pepper needed.  Every bite was amazing.    I absolutely love this place.  Great service. Amazing food. Beautiful interior, down to the last detail (no skimping) AND the prices are totally reasonable.    We have a winner!

l3QBCnhvkTTw5OudQ4Oj3A.review_text: Love the atmosphere, the waiters and waitresses are amazing and friendly, lovw how they incorporate what you need. Besides that, I love the lamb tongue especially as brunch, it is so over the top, one thing that I might use less is the mustard seed asides from that, the green and everything is braised wonderfully, the brussel sprout chips is a go, I also love Paloma which is the cocktail.

SgMuZsZtBhBD1Hnp9AMk2Q.review_text: A delightful setting for my birthday meal with two long-time friends.  The deviled eggs are certainly the hit, and I'm glad I ordered two. The steak crudo and pork belly bites are serviceable but hardly standouts. The clam chowder is quite unique, and I'm still - to this day - unsure whether I would select this soup again. By the time the pork chop and cheeseburger arrived, I wasn't as hungry and thought they were almost unnecessary for our meal.  The decor is bold and bright, giving the sense of old-time glamour and spaciousness. The draft beer selection is above average. I left in good spirits, and my bike ride home to the Panhandle was super easy on this unusually warm night back in late September.

VSINPig75DiGswnie1xxYA.review_text: We ate here last night and it was perfection  We arrived about 8:30 pm with no reservations and the place was packed.  The hostess offered us the "chef's table" which we ended up loving and would even ask to sit there next time (it's not for everyone though as you do sit on stools with no backs, but we enjoyed the quieter area and watching them cook)  We had a carafe of the Gruner Veltliner and it was delicious.  Our server was very knowledgeable about wine choices  We had the deviled eggs, the halibut with corn and sea beans, this incredible bowl of Manila clam chowder, and the Park Tavern Waldorf salad (the only neg of the evening due to its skimpiness).  By this time we were too full for any entrees.  We did notice the hamburger and the fried oysters were the most ordered items that evening.  We managed to fit in the huckleberry cheesecake parfait and loved it  We can't wait to go back.

e6QRXwwzhebaLVX0JEztpg.review_text: Fantastic food in a nice ambience.  The bar tender was particularly friendly and had great mixology skills, though sadly their scotch collection leaves something to be desired.  Really I want to give it five stars, but it's lacking something to push it to the top 10% for me (that's my bar for 5 stars).

fcnaLf9n35xD9mQjJ773ug.review_text: Good food, great cocktails, good service, good crowd, nice ambiance.   Me likey

qFM0dQCk93zJ2yXO6T5naA.review_text: This place is amazing and has wonderful staff. The food is great and cocktails are delicious. My friends and I got there before our reservations and though there wasn't any table available, the hostess Adrian did her best to accommodate us. She checked on us to make sure we were okay and when a table became available she informed us right away. Though I live in LA, I will make sure to come visit Park Tavern soon and I recommend this restaurant/bar to everyone visiting the beautiful city of San Francisco.

1nZNB49u4Y43w00LvxaAAA.review_text: After the symphony Saturday night, I took my boyfriend for a birthday dinner at Park Tavern. The staff seem intent on making the place feel more casual and friendly than its pricing, location, and clientele -- much appreciated. We were given a cushy corner booth, which was perfect.   As for the food: They were out of deviled eggs. (Our reservation was for 10:30p, so running out of something was not unreasonable.) We ended up with this: homemade jerky (as expected) brussels sprouts chips (they were simply the fried leaves of sprouts) warm chicory salad (salty!) tombo tuna (good! sorta salty) apple crisp (super salty -- how? why?) with black tea ice cream (superb!) McKinley cocktails (no. do not order.) glasses of a malbec and a torrontes (both great)  Overwhelmingly, this meal was salty. The salad was delicious at first, but not finish-able. Indeed, I kept retreating to the jerky as a palate cleanser (jerky is salty, too). The tuna was really nicely prepared and, had the preceding dish not been so salted, I probably would not have found the fish so. It was nicely seared, in good portion, and nicely seasoned (salt notwithstanding). We were both excited for the fruitiness of the crisp when it arrived, but the crumble was incredibly salty as well! (I generally like the trend of salting sweets, but this was excessive.)   I remarked that the whole meal had the feel of having been over-tasted by the same person during prep. I have made some horrendously salty soups when I've been the only taster, getting more and more used to the salt and feeling as if the dish could stand just a pinch more. (The black tea ice cream was lovely, though.) Yet, I have hope for reform!, since the food is potentially delicious. If they'd remove like half the salt.  The cocktail we had, from a "program" much lauded in reviews, was also disappointing in that the McKinleys we both had were veeeeeeeeerrrrrrrrrrry sweet.   On the upside, our waiter was great. We were the last in his section, but we didn't feel rushed, we never waited for something we wanted, and he was helpful.

P4PbJNzChmVv2gOKwRysvA.review_text: I went to Park Tavern for dinner - the place was hopping for a Sunday night.  The crowd was generally dressy and a mix of young and old.  The decor and space are very nicely done - they are definitely going after the "upscale" atmosphere.  Unfortunately, I found the food very average and very overpriced.   (I had the salmon as my entree.  The brussel sprout chips weren't bad... how can anything deep-fried not be amazing?!)     Service was okay - not terrible, but not impressive.  Our waiter was spotty in checking in on our table.  Overall, an average (3-star) experience, but relative to price, I would rate Park Tavern a 2-star.

ZsHEFDMcT4dMBGL4PAndiQ.review_text: Great atmosphere and very cool space!  I am so sad to say it because we wanted so badly to love it, but the food wasn't great and execution was poor.

sXLAy83l7EwdZjsYFbaq0A.review_text: Did you know Brussels Sprouts is the new black? Which can only mean Brussels Sprouts Chips are the new pink or new Zima or whatever, right?  Did you also know that surprising your SO with dinner reservations here, will get you... : )  During a really crappy day at work on a random Tuesday, I get a text asking me if I can get off work early and take off to SF (from Sac) for dinner. Didn't have to ask me twice! Suddenly the clouds parted. I figured the Oldman wanted to stalk Tyler Florence again but, I hadn't heard of any new TF spots opening recently. So, I bit my tongue and held my breath while my inner child voice kept yelling at me to ask where we were going. As we walked into this restaurant, my first thought was "Oldman IS stalking Tyler". Park Tavern reminds me a lot of TF's Wayfare Tavern - it's rustic hunting lodge (complete with animal head wall mounted trophies) meets Posh Spice's dining room. Okay, I say that because we were dressed really casually and eventually seated next to the Real Housewives of sur-reality TV.  Oldman made a reservation (the only time he was able to get was for 9pm), but we had to wait a little bit for our table. So, we waited at the bar which was packed with most patrons choosing to enjoy their meal at the bar... a good option for those ill-prepared. And, a nice opportunity to strike up random conversations with strangers toting expensive goods  - got a great tip on a very nice looking iPad case (Mulholland Brothers... there, now I won't forget).  We were very pleased with the booth Oldman requested; it was in perfect view of the kitchen action. I LOVE watching beautiful food being prepared. Between the kitchen action, the wonderful menu, and the bright shiny objects adorning the Real Housewives, I had a hard time deciding what I wanted to order.  Oldman was set on the burger, after a friend's high recommendation. I wanted to try a little of everything!   Our wonderful meal that night:  Deviled egg with bacon, jalapeno, and chives - excellent (I sopped up whatever lovely sauce was sitting under the egg with their warm delicious bread). Brussels sprout chips - Oh my! Absolutely amazing (the housewives and I ended up discussing how we could possibly re-create that dish at home... we were thinking the chips had to have been flashed fried). Pork Chop served with baby turnips, carmelized apple, AND even more pork... pork belly. Who does that!? I think every restaurant should! "Marlowe" burger, sans the caramelized onions, with bacon, cheddar, and really nice horseradish aioli and fries.  Standout of the meal had to be the Brussels sprout chips and pork chop. Unfortunately, the friend that recommended this place was a little too slow to text me back with another rec to order their homemade beef jerky! We'll just have to make another visit to try more of their menu.  After we finished our meal we were stuffed and in a hurry to get back on the road but, we struck up a convo with the housewives - Oldman just had to know whose birthday they were celebrating, and I just had to know what dessert they were sharing... and, actually ended up fighting over. Turns out it was a "Boozy Arnold Palmer Float" (Black tea ice cream, whole lemon gelato, and St.Germain)... are you kidding me! Arnold Palmer is my absolute favorite beverage, and they have made a dessert out of it!?  If it weren't for the booziness factor, I would have knocked one of them over and ran off with it!  Two thumbs up for PT, and Oldman!

90SNGo8Wk59Vcpb_lnpjKw.review_text: Came for Sunday brunch. Great food, super decor but NOISY! Whew! Service also outstanding. Excellent place.

G1_wi1KDU7a3YowdNUEkuQ.review_text: Went here the other night to celebrate a friends birthday and big were we happy! Everything was so good. I have never had deviled eggs before and now I want more...bacon and jalapeños, how could you go wrong?! And the PT fries, so good! They come with caviar, which I passed on, but was told it was good. I had the steak frites. Flavor was amazing. And it was an actual portion size, not something that your paying money for and looking at your plate and thinking where the heck is the rest of my meat! The birthday boy had the Demons on Horseback and said that it was so good and the hint of bacon was perfect! If you have a birthday and let them know you get a piece of complimentary birthday which was chocolate and red velvet cakes layered. You can also order a piece of the cake even if its not your birthday! I cannot wait to come back here in the future!!

I6cK4z3AlDe2GJRWRtfhcQ.review_text: I love Park Tavern. The ONLY bad thing about it, is that it's soooo busy that you can never get a table.  I have eaten here twice and my boyfriend and I are obsessed.  Modern, fun, large space. They have a dining room and a bar area with a communal eating table.  The deviled eggs are like little bites of heaven.  The brussels sprout chips are so light and delicate. The wild arugula salad is perfectly dressed. The Steamed mussels were awesome with their light, fresh, sauce. The Marlowe burger was impressive, well cooked, I think the horseradish aioli threw me off a little, but it was still delicious. **FAVORITE is the Petit 'Poulet Rouge'  or roasted chicken**  Get a table way in advance!

OjzwEyl7DSgjLxUcJeex6w.review_text: The fries, cocktails, and service were excellent, but everything else was unfortunately incredibly oversalted, from the deviled eggs to the seafood stew to the lamb. This place had so much potential, if only they had gone easier on the salt.

9ZdOmO3di8kTWjjnOvQdiA.review_text: Quaintly appropriate for a couple of successful, career oriented, single SF girls to catch up over a perfect carafe of Syrah, some burgers and deviled eggs.  Our bartender, a shame we did not catch his name, made our experience delightful.  I waited a year to come here and it definitely did not disappoint.  Definitely in my top 3 of favorites in SF.

rVs5Ttf3TcjX952G289c9w.review_text: Came here for a work dinner and was given a prix fix menu (with customized menus). The first course included brussel sprouts (YUM!) and deviled eggs (equally YUMMY! I think this place began my kick for deviled eggs and egg sandwiches haha!) Had seared scallops as an entrée, which was melt in my mouth happy. Dessert though was a bit meh, they had a "birthday" cake and it tasted a bit frozen. They also had a chocolate creme brulee-esque dish, and it was good, but very, very indulgent.  Service was impeccable and they have an extensive drinks list (cocktails and wine). Make a reservation if you want to come and eat here!

xB1BE_xUJL-P5I1B0TCTvA.review_text: The appetizers and dessert were better than the entrees. We loved the PT Fries and Braised Lamb Tongue.  We also ordered the Colorado lamb and bar steak which were ok. The strawberry shortcake was absolutely delicious!  Drinks took a while to show up but the bar was pretty busy.  Atmosphere was pretty cool but noises (if you were expecting an intimate dinner).

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Birthdays are such momentous occasions, reflections on life automatically come with it. Park Tavern is the perfect place for special events.    We came here during the holidays so the handsome dining room felt extra festive. With fantastic service from our waiter and good timing of dishes from the kitchen, we were able to relax and savor every moment.  The brussel sprout chips and deviled eggs with bacon & pickled jalapenos are house favorites for a reason: just right blend of texture and seasonings, these will disappear faster than you can say "feed me!" My grass fed ribeye was a generous serving, done medium rare as requested, with tender baby carrots and buttery mashed potatoes. Your dining experience would be remiss if you skipped on the signature PT fries, these potato sticks are so posh, you would need a pedigree in eating them. Truffle, soft boiled egg and caviar as your accompaniments, the best thing to do is to dip the crunchy fries into the soft boiled egg and eat away. Oh. My. GOD. (wait, was that really $14?!?)   I was at my favorite speakeasy before heading here so I wasn't impressed with the cocktails even though they were 17 cocktails deep on the menu. The Maclaren with Hendrick's gin, cucumber, lemon and ginger beer was refreshing, but also overpriced at $13.  Nevertheless, I left with a the warm and fuzzies here. It's a meal that won't soon be forgotten.

zlhPRjxJW_ktOVpEEpj--A.review_text: Never had anything but amazing food here. Some favorites: -Any of the toasts at brunch -The deviled eggs, obvs. -The lemon chips with burrata -Brussels sprouts chips -And THE BEST are the fries with truffle, soft boiled egg and caviar  Always a great go-to spot

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: Ahh, the old Moose's space has finally been resurrected with respect!  The space is grand and very well-done, and still warm and cozy.  It's fun people-watching with an eclectic crowd both young and older.  The food is hearty, interesting and delicious.  I think the menu doesn't do the dishes justice actually.  The flavors and combinations are more drool-worthy than they read on paper.  Also, great cocktails...  Only complaint is the cheese plate.  Three cheeses that you have to order together... None of them that interesting to me, and two of the three are definitely not loved by all (a washed rind and a blue).  C'mon.....  More interesting cheese and a la carte, please!!

nsvDZDx5hW6jH-QJfnf4-A.review_text: Had dinner here last night. Wow! This place is hoppin' on a Wednesday night!   The one negative of our evening was the long wait we experienced before we were seated. This was most likely due to the fact that this is a newer restaurant, and there is a shortage of this type of fare in the North Beach Area. It was just full to the brim with people! We arrived exactly on time for our reservation, but our table wasn't ready for about 20 minutes. I was about to get upset when, out of nowhere, a glass of champagne appeared for my troubles. We're back on track!  Shortly after, we were taken to our seats and our server gave us a rundown of the menu and the specials. We couldn't hear her though - it's fairly loud in there - definitely buzzing.  We ordered:  Demons on horseback - believe the hype, yummy Scallops - very nice Steak and fries - very nice Twice baked potato - The top layer was great, but the bottom was burned. Fail.  Caramelized onion and mushroom soup - interesting flavor, but prob wouldn't order on a regular basis.  Oh, and I've had the Marlowe burger at Marlowe, and it's nothing short of fantastic!  It's a great atmosphere in there (especially with the beautiful Christmas tree they have up right now), and the food is pretty solid overall with interesting twists. Definitely worth trying :)

TFoTZwzwNPpCs3OCwmY4_w.review_text: Was great the first time I came when it opened 2 years ago.  Still Solid as usual but not the same excitement anymore.  This is my second time here and the Brussels sprout chips are getting old.  Maclaren still great.  No specials this time around so I got the steak.  Service was good but they do book up quickly around dinner, so we settled on a 5:30 appt and was done around 7.    Still a great place, but the excitement from the first visit is somewhat diminished.

zXhT26IL0N3ZQHgU60w_2g.review_text: Update: I have been back to Park Tavern multiple times since that first time, and boy do they have all of the kinks worked out. Their brunch is now one of my favorites in the city, and that's really saying something. Dinner is excellent too. I was particularly impressed at one brunch, when there were 10 of us there for my friend's birthday...the restaurant was running late for some reason, and we ended up getting seated about 45 minutes later than our reservation. Not only did they apologize profusely, but sent over 1 of each pastry and 1 of each toast for the table to make up for it!

OYEIR3PBVuRmtU67f0yWeQ.review_text: Our waiter took 30 minutes before he came back to take our order.  The deviled eggs were so-so. The chicken was super veiny and had little flavor. The foie gras was good, and so was the bread.   Probably wouldn't come back to dine. Plus, a guy inside had his dog in the booth next to us. That was a first.   Overrated.

O8RYLkWNmZYr2HgKWsmwiQ.review_text: This place serves one HELL of a burger!  So good that we endured a chilly evening and sat outside just to sink our teeth into a juicy, mouthwatering, medium rare, delicious, heavenly work of art.  Eric B, you missed out!  Me, my wife and several friends walked in sans reservation hoping to snag a table inside. The dining room (as expected) was completely full, but they did have one small table free outside. The only thing is that this particular table was not under one of the heat lamps. We were hungry and our options were limited. Plus the fact that two of our friends had been to Park Tavern before and were raving about the burger.  Must try the frickin' burger!  The minute we sat down, the service was exceptional. Our server always made it a point to checkin on us and made sure we our water glasses were filled and was quick to the draw on our cocktail and wine orders.   Try the brussels chips!

cvNHL2TIus0dKSZOlGwC8Q.review_text: This is a place where you can come to indulge in decadent brunch food and mimosas after partying hard the night before :p.  My group of friends was STARVING and after we told the waitress that, the food came out wicked fast.  Service was excellent and friendly.  Parking kinda sucks, but it always does in that area.  Worth a revisit.

-M4ZqHZDsA9vOt7UscVRpQ.review_text: Hands down, this is some good people watching.   On top of that, the food was pretty yummy too.  Our group came in with the idea of having the pork belly...to our dismay the pork belly was not on the menu. SAD PANDA.  However the other food was still great.  We had the chicken fried cipollini onions, the burrata and the Brussels sprout chips.  Yum, yum and super yum.  My favorite was the Brussels sprout chips. they were crispy and had a good flavor and were fun to eat.  The cocktails were also good--i had the McLaren which was ginger beer, Hendricks Gin, cucumber and lemon. normally i am not a cucumber fan, but the drink was tasty and refreshing.    For my main i had the chicken, and by the chicken i mean A CHICKEN.  It was a whole chicken, and it was GOOD.  the potatoes were well cooked and the chicken was amazing. Since I couldn't eat it all in one sitting, i brought it home and even the leftovers were good.  My dinner companions had the scallops, the steak and the pork chop.  All three were tasty.  Last but not least we had the birthday cake dessert...in honor of my bday, and it was a nice carrot cake.  It was good, but in terms of carrot cake, I have definitely had better.  But the place was fun, and we had a great time. I'd definitely go back.

dzyJofzgMoguyhBlvKV0Hg.review_text: I am rarely disappointed but was deeply upset with dinner here.   It was disappointing from start to finish...I still can't believe it. We reserved dinner to celebrate my boyfriend's 31st birthday -  party of 4 at 9pm which was the only availability they had two weeks in advance. I attempted to update the reservation to include one more person but the hostess said there was no flexibility.  I was very upset to see vacant tables that could have fit 5.  However, the most upsetting part of the night was the fact that our waiter provided poor service - slow and unaccommodating. When we asked for bread, he said they ran out but I then asked the busboy for bread - he seemed to have made it happen. Hmm.   Half the entrees on the menu were "sold out" - I ordered a steak but was told later that they ran out. They also ran out of scallops and pork chops....oh, and carrots! I was extremely upset to have resorted to having mussels for dinner. Mussels were mediocre.   To top it off, what was the point of sharing the birthday occasion via open table and confirming with our hostess if our waiter and the restaurant did not even wish my boyfriend a happy birthday?   Overall, this place is overrated. I will never recommend it to anyone.  Luckily, we went out for a second dinner somewhere else and then made it up to my boyfriend by going to NOPA SF the next day.

E1oXdYvxl-d-4kraoQ6MeQ.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
E1oXdYvxl-d-4kraoQ6MeQ.review_text: Absolutely NOT SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS, and only barely for vege-quarians.    I'm only giving it two stars for dinner - but I'll give one more star, as it's a great place to go for drinks (if you can get a seat!)  I really want to love this place; we live in the neighborhood and walk by it all the time.  It's cozy (if a teeny bit dark), with lots of black tiling and dark wood.  There are cozy booths around the perimeter and a great bar to sit at.  Went there last night for 'date night' with hubby.   As with another reviewer, I was unimpressed with the 2 Hawaiian rolls we were given (with dishes whisked away practically as soon as our hands had left them - no refills as with other places).  The butter has pork fat in it, and so we were given an additional one for me without the fat.  If you want to be complete vegetarian the menu is severely lacking - the veggie on the table next to me ended up with the tiny appetizer of heirloom baby carrots as her main course.  I opted for the steamed mussels & fennel sausage, leeks, crème fraiche, white wine with two WAFER THIN slices of grilled bread - and picked out the sausage on to hubby's plate.  Tasty but disappointing as there were several mussels that were closed up, and therefore not fit to eat, but still served to me.  On the upside if you are a meatatarian the mini chicken "Poulet Rouge, Bloomsdale spinach & Peewee potatoes" looked impressive and husband said it was delicious!  We shared a tasty fig and apple crisp for dessert - the apple peel was a little tough but it was yummy.  Wait service was friendly - very prompt, even if they were a bit rushed on a Thursday.  However it is LOUD in there, date night was a fairly shouted affair.

ExzygSweOCT5ovvpGCWBzA.review_text: one of my top 5 favorite spots in sf. make sure to get the brussel sprouts to start so yummy and the pork chop or the filet are both to die for !!!!!!!!

sRVGewx--HgwwlKwAfCO9Q.review_text: There's a lot to like about Park Tavern, which is the kind of place that feels like it's been there forever, even though it hasn't.  First of all, it's HUGE, with a scrubbed tile floor and open kitchen, reminiscent of Old New York (at least in my memory of Old New York).  It has a lively, bustling atmosphere, with a noise level that might be too much for some, but I found energizing.  The crowd also feels very "established", as in moneyed, but in that casual San Francisco way.   Cocktails are delicious and range from the classic to the inventive.  I enjoyed the Country Lawyer, a bourbon cocktail with a dash of chocolate bitters as a subtle surprise.  We shared numerous appetizers, with my favorite being the Deviled Eggs, the Lemon Chips with Burrata, and the Uni.  I was disappointed with the Brussels Sprouts Chips, which were not as crisp as I would have liked.  Without even knowing that it's the same restaurant team behind Marlowe, I said "They have these at Marlowe and they are much better".  My dinner was good - seared black cod. Next time I would get the Poulet Rouge, which comes standing upright (like beer can chicken).  Unfortunately, my friend's halibut was not good and we sent it back, but luckily there was plenty for her to eat from our dishes.  They were very professional about it and offered another dish, and didn't charge us for it.  The desserts were just ok - we had the Chcolate Creme Brulee and another one I can't quite remember.   Next time I am getting the Fernet with a Ginger Back!   The service was very polished and friendly, so I would feel comfortable taking anyone there, from a rowdy group of guys to my in-laws.     All in all, a solid experience, and a place where everyone all around us seemed to be having a good time.

gg6AKPxKPuweLmMNX4Z_aw.review_text: I was skeptical because the menu seemed a bit boring, but Park Tavern wowed me in the execution, taste, and presentation.  We ordered most of the apps (deviled eggs and PT fries are standouts), everyone's entrees were excellent (although my personal fave was the stuffing side), of course we ordered everything on the dessert menu.  Cause that's how we do it.

xipyrIBO-r1j6PLJ7sIduA.review_text: Very underwhelmed.  A lot of these dishes were safe and solid.  Really didn't see any innovation in the food but I feel that there's unfortunate expectation that comes with hype.  Decor was fantastic.  Upon asking the waitress/host what she would categorize the atmosphere she responded, "Urban."  I think she saw my disgusted face because Urban Decor is more City-like loft space with grit.  This place has exposed wooden beams, kitchen tiles, arches.  My pretentious response, "this is not Urban.." she responded, "well, call it what you wish, but it's a Tavern so I suppose a Tavern."  She hated me.  Honey - it's Rustic Vintage.  Enough of that and on to the food: - Deviled Eggs - Great!  But one was enough - Crispy Lemon Chips - With burata on top!  Was good, but burata is always good. - Fried Sunchokes - Too close to the sun, because they tasted BURNT and chard  - Framage Blanc Constini - Like an hor dourves from a wedding... or company party - Brussels Sprouts Chips - Not that great.. too much chip, not enough Brussels  -Salad - This came with fried chicken skin which didn't work.  Salad with the blue cheese was great, but the innovative part fell through with how unavoidably salty the skin was  -Halibut - This was amazing and really brought up the stars.  Fish was cooked perfectly, the sauce was yummy, I loved it.  --Birthday Cake - Dare I say it?  boxed cake?  No... but I didn't think it was special at all. None of the desserts were exciting and I felt like you could find them at a friend's picnic.  My Level 5 Vegan friend had them create a special menu for her.  To my delight her dishes were off the menu and off the hook.   I ordered the Twin Peaks drink which tasted similar.. almost... to an Old Fashioned drink with bourbon, but it came out in a strange color and in an awkward martini glass.  We asked for a second round and asked the bartender to put the drink in an Old Fashioned glass.. it just felt better. I'm sure you would agree.  You don't drink bourbon out of a martini glass.  This review is pretentious, but so was the venue so I thought it was appropriate.

tNCgPlfJIHmCrPn0nIEfNA.review_text: Ever have a really great meal experience and SWEAR that you'd immediately write that Yelp review...yet it gets pushed off until tomorrow? I'm overdue on submitting other reviews, though this one couldn't wait.   I'm sure you're wondering why 5 stars? Was the meal perfect, you ask? No...and stop looking for perfect, by the way. A wise person once said that perfect is the enemy of good, and last night's meal at Park Tavern was GOOD, heck, it was GREAT.   As much as I wanted to dine here, I've been relatively passive about coming to this place, and it has everything to do with making time to get out my 'hood and do the North Beach thing. My passivity came in the form of lazy attempts at getting seated after having a few cocktails at Tony Niks, only to wander down to Park Tavern and ask for a table...on a Friday night. I know, I know, a man can dream right? I was often too hungry for the 45 minute wait and often settled for a slice of Golden Boy Pizza instead. The half-assed attempts continued, off-and-on, for a good TWO YEARS - whenever I was in the neighborhood, and through it all, the Park Tavern hosts ALWAYS had a good and funny nature about the absurdity of some dude waltzing into their joint on a Friday or Saturday night expecting a table for 3 or 4 without reservations, with a wait under 60 minutes. (OK, I never expected a wait under and hour, but the answer is always "no" unless you ask.) In a town with restaurants and foodies who sometimes take themselves too seriously, hats off to the Park Tavern hosts for always being professional, happy, and funny.   Soooooo...I broke down and actually made a reservation. Me and my companion got a nice table, and man, I really loved the energy in this place! It was the right kind of "loud" where it was a good background buzz, yet we were able to carry on our conversation with straining our voices. Jeff, our waiter, was very attentive and knew the right times to check-in on us. Anyways, I highly recommend the Demons on Horseback (only a poet can describe this app) and Devil Eggs!! Patrick (one of the managers), hooked us up with the Twice Baked Potato, which is something else I encourage everyone to try. I confessed to Jeff and Patrick my 2 year journey and they used the Twice Baked Potato as their way of saying "welcome...and please come back". I shall come back, dear sirs!  My entree was the pork chop - cooked medium - served on a bed of "brussel hash" mixed with some sort of savory sausage. Very hard to disagree with all this pork goodness!! With a meal so good, I am going to sleep like a king tonight. Oh yeah, my lesson has been learned and I will actually PLAN to come back to Park Tavern and make reservations in advance. It was worth the 2 year wait. Thank you!!

lFpXbU6R5XM5I_xdrZBuLw.review_text: Went here for brunch on a Saturday with my boyfriend.  Nice ambience.  Try to sit outside or near the windows.  The cocktails are delish!  Great service.  Amazing food. All in all, a very nice upscale brunch.

XlF_Od3qOngwITJAX4g2ZA.review_text: We went here for our anniversary dinner last night and really had a lovely time. Everything was top notch, the service, the food, the atmosphere. I was quite impressed.  French fries were perfectly cooked with black truffle aioli and a soft boiled egg with a little bit of caviar in it. Decadent and really nice. The venison carpaccio was lovely. Very light and flavorful without being gamey or too much.  Hubby had a nice roast duck ("mine is better though," he said, which isn't far off) and my NY strip steak was perfect. The accompanying super cripsy smashed potato was interesting and really flavorful.  It's not inexpensive (entrees are $25-30) but the entire meal including a small carafe of good wine was around $200. Not bad for an excellent special occasion meal.

r2WBpBtNBFo6llgS3EgJHw.review_text: Had a wonderful dinner here the other night with my Mom, Grandma, Sister and Aunt.  The cocktail menu was divine, our service was spectacular and I am still dreaming about those brussels sprout chips! I will definitely be dining here in the future!

wr2XZf5RNZO5sjEUVJqb_Q.review_text: Brussel sprout chips are SOOOOO good! Had my doubts about them until I tried them. And the deviled eggs were seriously amazing...mind blowing! Lamb tongue was delicious and tender, and the crab was good with a crisp taste of apple slivers to refresh the pallet :) loved this place and would absolutely come again!!!!!

v-3nlJpwckQMKL53S_XV4g.review_text: This is literally as good as it gets! I came here with 10 people for a brunch on Mother's Day and I've literally never had better service nor food nor drinks (well maybe this helped me think positively about the first two). Drinks are delicious and they have an amazing mix from healthy feeling to downright glutinous. The service is impeccable - I never had to wait for a refill or to order a new drink or side, the food was presented at a perfect pace to allow us to relax and enjoy but not get impatient, and THE FOOD! I'll definitely be coming back.

3SZCT6klYdI81TQrOJOcHA.review_text: this place was pretty exciting.   great decor, service and food. the food are something you would expect and they deliver it. personally i enjoy more inventive and adventurous dishes but after a long day at work and school, this was a real treat!  demon on a horse: it was okay, the dish doesn't live up to its intriguing name.. it's just prawns with somes sauce.  dungeness & lobster bisque: very good, very good bisque..  all the ingredients were fresh and nicely served in good portion.  brussel spouts chips: the same ole Marlowe's greatest chips!! amazing.  pork chop: a lot of people recommended this dish and it was great! tender, nicely seasoned and good portion  tombo tuna: i thought this dish was great.. perfectly cooked fish is hard to beat.   overall, i had a very pleasant experience.

4d5LsGLmdmaiJ3BYkgVGkg.review_text: One word: pork. If they have pork tenderloin on the menu, order that. If they have the pork chop, order that. If they have both, flip a coin. Pair with deviled eggs, brussels sprouts, and something fried. You'll leave stuffed and happy.  If they have neither (or you can't have pork), get the burger, maybe the chicken. If you don't eat meat, what are you doing here?

-V9Qeec-C6d7yLeRMFb13w.review_text: There was a two hour wait at Mama's across the street, and I was on a time crunch, so I went across the street at the advice of another Yelp user who did the same thing instead of waiting at Mama's. I got sat immediately, and a delicious meal of French toast with blueberry compote, and a Shirley Temple. The bartender was friendly, and I was in and out of there as quickly as I needed so I could explore the rest of the city for the first time. A great price as well!

aiOhrFg0jE0oNpZAg28HcQ.review_text: Great food, great service, and of course great cocktails! A great experience, their Devilled Eggs are a must!

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: I really wanted to like this place since its only a 15 minute walk from my place.  The restaurant is set up nicely.  The food was just ok.  This place is always busy.  Its tough to get a reservation during normal eating times.  Usually only 5 and 9 are available.  If you have eaten at wayfare tavern you have therefore eaten here.  I thought their other restaurant Marlowe was better.

kZwX0_1UZuVN5oOht7E_5g.review_text: I've been wanting to go to Marlowe, but haven't been able to make a reservation at a good time, so we finally decided to try Park Tavern.  The location is great and the decor inside is nice.  We started with cocktails and some really good appetizers: my wife had a side of the braised mushrooms and I had the onion and mushroom soup.  The soup was awesome - different than a traditional onion soup (more savory, I think) and something I would definitely order again.  The mushrooms were also good, although a bit salty.  Our entrees were fine, but didn't live up to the soup.  My wife had the scallops, which came with beans, kale and pork belly.  Too much salt on the pork belly she said, and a bit too much kale.  I had the NY steak, which came with brussels sprouts, onions, carrots and a nice sauce.  I really liked the veggies, but the meat was only OK.  Overall, a very nice meal and I'm sure we'll come back if we are in the area.

aBgTKRRj8uUMycpcrcGlxQ.review_text: This place is good for any meal:  brunch, lunch, or dinner.  Even Kanye has been here.    There is nothing else to say, except awesome.

0UFyiSX-EyrZAlPMcTfIew.review_text: I really like this restaurant. The ambiance and the food are very nice. I had the carrot soup and garden salad and sea bass. All were delicious as although I loved the salad even though it was a starter. It was very busy even on a Monday night. Reservations are a must! The location by Washington Square Park is very pretty and valet is convenient.

nmt15twJ_mWvC5brJpswPw.review_text: I love going bar hopping to the little dives in North Beach, but when I'm in the mood to have an upscale, grown-up experience this is the place I come. It reminds me of the bistros I used to frequent in downtown Manhattan - great food, sophisticated decor, attentive service, dim lighting. Frankly, it's civilized and so is the crowd. I wish I could say that about more places in San Francisco, but there you have it.  The bar area is a favorite of mine - it's got plenty of seats as well as some additional communal tables if you just want to pop in and grab a snack and a drink with a few friends. The brussel sprout chips are to-die for along with the rest of the appetizers.

uWXt5FqSke99_Y18vKsX5g.review_text: Fantastic brunch!  The deviled eggs, avocado toast and bloody mary are not to be missed!

2MRvsXI9KlBaSP7XnwZYHQ.review_text: Great vibe, great location, great food.   The new team have done an amazing job in getting this up and running without a hitch. I have no doubt that this will be favorite for those in the neighorhood, but also somewhere to travel to.  Can't wait to return.

qnebn1RX0eZGDWCsSUlJxA.review_text: Went here for brunch. Nothing you couldn't do at home in under 30 min but nothing tasted bad. So pretty meh.

yT_QCcnq-QGipWWuzIpvtw.review_text: There's nothing i can really say that hasn't been said already. They have an excellent menu . It's not too big, and what they do, they do well.  The smoked devil eggs is genius - the tartar is every meat lovers dream with crispy bone marrow. The entree's are well thought out.  My only complaint is that there scallops is a little confused. But everything else was delicious. Interior was warm. Service was exceptional.

8ozxJndeMSqObxZc4xDsbg.review_text: I'm a fan of any place that plays John Legend, and especially if they play P.D.A!  I came here for my birthday, and it was a really great experience.  We were seated promptly, and we had a nice table right next to the window.  I think this place is filled with a lot of work dinners on weekdays, work dinners more than dates.    We ordered two carafes on wine, red and white.  Our server was very attentive, offered a lot of suggestions.  We started with the deviled eggs, a must have!    And then I had the Wild California halibut for dinner.  It comes with smoked sweet corn & potato "risotto," snap peas, pea tendrils & toybox tomatoes.  It was delicious.  I definitely will be coming back.

KVwChHJKaBkK7vLwEqlr_g.review_text: Just finished a delicious brunch!  Deviled eggs, banana coconut fritters, avocado toast and fromage toast, shared with a friend.  Everything was delicious, and the deviled eggs are the best ice ever had.  I can't wait to come back!

Kya3J8eLTiE4Bv3dGnyxSw.review_text: Food mediocre. Our server was very slow. Salmon was undercooked. Restrooms dirty. Very odd rotating service. Scallops overdone and salty. The salad overdressed. They need a new chef. Such a great location to have such tourist grade C- food and experience.

Qv84DxksfsNxZID5G08q9Q.review_text: Hands down one of the best brunch menus in sf. They finally added the smoked deviled eggs to the brunch menu! Yippee! If you haven't blessed yourself with these guys yet, hurry up! I don't even like deviled eggs, and am all about these bad boys! Bacon, pickled jalapeño and chives makes these stand out.  Now they just need to add the Brussels sprout chips to the brunch menu.  My boyfriend and I then shared an order of the avocado toast and an order of the Oregon bay shrimp toast. Both were delicious and absolutely perfect. I highly recommend the toasts!  We then got the crispy polenta cakes with mushrooms, poached eggs, arugula, truffle salsa verde and Parmesan. Great vegetarian dish!  We then finished with the banana coconut fritters with a vanilla strawberry discs and a chocolate coffee rum sauce.   Make sure you sample their coffees. We got the stumptown French press and the hair bender espresso latte. Both were a great caffeine fix.  As always the staff was on point. Friendly and efficient. Just make sure you make a reservation because they are understandably packed for brunch!

D1DtY25nPkLfWq8dlJE91Q.review_text: Excellent Service! $12 valet a bit pricy but i don't mind paying for convenience. Cash only valet.  Must tries:  1) brussell sprouts chips (tasty and not too salty) 2) deviled eggs (amazing flavor) 3) marlowe burger w fries (juicy burger, perfect fries but prefer w ketchup not the aoli)  Yummmmmmmmm  The halibut was basic. Good but not outstanding.   Park Tavern is great but I think I still prefer Marlowe.

POmyqedLjt06Gfajf1of5Q.review_text: So had to try this place with all the hype it has. Made reservations several weeks in advance for Saturday night. When we arrived we seated very promptly. Just like most SF restaurants tables are right next to one another so you feel very intimate with the other patrons of the restaurant. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and provided some good insight for a firs timer. We started with of course the deviled eggs....I thought they were good- not sure if they are top 100 good- but oh well something different. We also had the venison carpaccio since it was so different. I thought this dish was very tasty and we enjoyed it quite a bit.  Also had the brussel sprout chips which were difficult to stop eating. I had the Poulet Noir which was amazing! they let you know up-front this will take 30 minutes to cook but totally worth it. Love the stuffing and the sauce, everything about it is delicious. It is very filling though so I recommend splitting it or taking it home. We also had the cheesecake which was deconstructed and not sweet at all, so more like a cheese plate desert. Overall it was a great meal. It was a tad loud in the restaurant due to the crowds at the bar, so I wouldn't say its a romantic spot- but fun for a night out.

zhfbSV1eFNHcPS4BbYftTQ.review_text: Ate here like 8 months ago, but am finally writing a review. We came on a weekend and wanted to have a nice lunch here, but to our surprise they were still serving brunch at 1pm. We decided to go with it and got a nice table outside and enjoyed the view. Service was extremely slow. I mean the slowest I have ever had while dining. It took like 15-20 mins to get us iced teas! All and all, I think we were there for a little over two hours for a burger and a salad. Kind of ridiculous. I heard nothing but good things about this place too so I was totally shocked by the poor service. We sat for like 35 mins after our meal waiting for the check. Plus, my salad was just okay and nothing I could've made at home. The burger my husband had was good though. I'd like to try the place again. I'll just make sure I have nothing going on that day.

4LSF_BgZdsNTWr-nqHBeow.review_text: Walked in sat at the counter, and started with the venison carpaccio and pickled sardine toast.  Both, good size portions and very tasty.  Next were the truffle, caviar PT fries (i'm not a fry man, but daaamn these are sooo gooood!), and braised lamb tongue (best tongue i've tasted :-)  Finally, wood-oven roasted beets, amazing burst of flavor!  Can't wait to come for brunch, lunch, and another xxx times for dinner!

RM82ZQ0SsZL3hrbhmEbk5Q.review_text: VERDICT: Food was not good, Drinks were expensive  QUALIFIER: We came in a group of 10, so we made a reservation, but they could only offer a party size 8+ a fixed menu for $65 each!. There were selections for each of the 3-courses, but they weren't that good.  FOOD: The shared food/chip appetizers were too salty, sour, and bland. The entrees were alright. The deserts weren't good. Lemon chips, Brussels sprout chips, carrot salad, pumpkin soup, roasted chicken, sea bass, birthday cake, and creme brule.   SERVICES: Waitress forgot to take my drink order.

oHlvnAcVIUQYOE_3o_BoHg.review_text: My partner and I had a delicious dinner to ring in the new year on 01/02. I am gluten free and had no problems whatsoever having my order altered to suit my needs. I appreciated their cocktail selection. We loved the fresh cheese and persimmon appetizer. The pole beans were garlic-heavy and delightful. I got the sole and was licking my plate. My partner's pork chop rivaled the sole. For dessert we went with the Almond Joy and some coffee, which was just enough food to feel full and spent. The view of the park is nice also. Service was sufficient. The seating was a bit tight for my taste (though luckily I was with a sexy man, so getting close wasn't as much of an issue). I would recommend a dinner out at Park Tavern!

rXpOU3bQ4bMQLhxNoJ--BA.review_text: Six words aptly describes Park Tavern:  good cocktails, good service, bad food.  The Country Lawyer (a bourbon based cocktail) was excellent.  My waitress was prompt, attentive, and engaging.  If only the food wasn't disappointing I could have regaled you all with tales of the latest great North Beach restaurant.  Sadly, the arugula salad that tasted like a lemon bomb, the oily beef tartar, and the uninspired and bland tuna prevent me from doing so.     Park Tavern is definitely a scene, a place to see and be seen.  Check it out . . . just make sure to grab a bite to eat someplace else beforehand.

T1rP9rqslOh_72KI0IW7rQ.review_text: Probably my favorite brunch place in SF, and it's right across from Washington Square Park so you can lie in the grass and food coma afterwards. Or go to one of the many coffee shops and stores nearby!   Grapefruit Brûlée ($7): totally unexpected! I thought it would be grapefruit creme brûlée, but they were 4 slices of warm grapefruit with a crispy caramel glaze. Yummy!   Banana Coconut Fritters ($9): these were good, but really heavy and there were a lot. If you plan on getting a big entree, make sure you have more than just 1 person to share these with!  Oatmeal Walnut Raisin Pancakes ($12): these usually come in a set of 3, but we only wanted one pancake and they let us! Unfortunately we couldn't just order one French toast. This pancake was super soft, moist, and delicious.   Three Nut Butters ($9): this appetizer is also heavy. It comes with 4 big pieces of thick bread and pecan, walnut, almond butter, and honey. So yeah you can probably imagine how heavy that is. But all the butters were really good!  Crispy Polenta Cakes ($17): these weren't as good as I thought they would be. I am a huge polenta fan and this came with a lot of things I like - poached eggs, arugula, and mushrooms. It was a very light, clean dish, but just not as flavorful as I'd hoped and I was just expecting the savory creaminess of liquid polenta.  Smoked Salmon Benedict ($17): this is my favorite item so far! I am also on this crazy sushi craze phase, but the salmon is really great and the poached eggs, capers, horseradish sauce, etc make it taste fantastic. It's a light dish, and I hate wasabi but I don't taste the horseradish at all.   Warm Open-Faced Deviled Egg Sandwich ($14): this one is pretty heavy. The portions are big and has bacon, a chicken breast, eggs, cheese melted on top, and fries on the side. A bit much for me for brunch, but it's great if you're starving or are skipping appetizers! The fries are fantastic.  PT Bloody Mary ($11): I am a huge Bloody Mary fan and this one is fantastic! Great peppery kick (I love black pepper), topped with some beef jerky and some other pickled veggie I don't remember.

5OXpy-tfB7HjMChaJlqubw.review_text: Food was great. Atmosphere was great. Waiter was great.  The three stars is solely for the host. We had a reservation for 9:30pm, arrived early, and was told we would be seated right on time. While it was only 9:40ish when we were seated, I guess my face was not doing a great job of hiding my frustration. The host came over, offered to screw over a table who "checked in first" because they seemed "much happier" than we did. He offered us a round of champagne when we were seated, but the attitude the entire time was not appreciated. I understand that things run late and you can't help it if people are taking longer than expected, but there is no need to be rude.   Luckily our waiter was fantastic so that initial experience didn't ruin our whole night.

2h1B3IUp1TejELkxfffEkg.review_text: I've been going to Park Tavern since they opened 3-4 years ago. I thought the food was good then but have been very surprised to see that the menu hasn't changed a bit in 4 years.  It's shocking that the management & chef haven't introduced new menu items, maybe the chef is banned from making changes there. The menu is so boring, same old deviled eggs, brussel sprout chips, dry pork chop, shaved carrot salad. It's very boring american fare.  For this reason, I'll only go there for a drink and then head to dinner elsewhere in North Beach. The restaurant is beautiful, bar area is cool if you can get a seat. Bartenders are nice as well. But the food is lame.

7RvB7zqL4aFaHO-ZU7i0JQ.review_text: You MUST get the Roasted Brussels Sprouts. These were fabulous. I will come back just to eat those! I also enjoyed the upscale tavern ambience.

7vabYzrr4ukNDAkOvXl_Hg.review_text: We ate lunch here a few weeks back sitting outside in the sunshine, it was very pleasant. The food was quite good, I had the burger which was cooked nicely.   The service was kind of slow but I suppose that is the downside of sitting outside.   The only nasty bit about this meal was the surprise I got a week or so later when I checked by amex and saw a charge a lot higher than what it should have been. The charge should have been for $35 dollars plus tip. I tipped an appropriate amount but they added a much larger tip, $19. I called to let them know, they took my details and were pleasant but never got back to me. After 3/4 days I decided I would just dispute the charge with Amex. Amex was quick to respond and refunded the money. I have still not heard back from the restaurant.   Overall it is a pity as it was quite nice but I would be apprehensive about going back or I would only pay in cash.

pme7GsuU86rKc78DMoyBIQ.review_text: If you look for high-quality and delish food served in a chic & trendy restaurant  in North Beach (unlike many cheesy so-called italian! restaurants around! ) then Park Tavern is your thing. So many good things to say about the dinner: burger, steak, fish and brussel sprout chips are the most noteworthy ones and i stick to every time i visit Park Tavern. Also communal table and the bar is another great alternative if you're just in the mood for a drink and light bite. Brunch is excellent not only because of the food but also the convenient of being able to make reservations (take a look at the next corner: Mama's and sigh inside for those poor waiting in line for hourS just to eat a waffle!).

PEU1ayT7WFqHS4wJ-_BqNQ.review_text: Pearl took me here for my birthday.  Beautiful ambience, interesting and tasty food, warm service...in my favorite part of town.

qmZJQtRNl4-g7-2T6AD1vA.review_text: Grab a seat at the bar or the communal. Bartenders got the service to the T:-) Ordered the burger and  the whole chichen both were solid.  Great selection of wine. Dont understand the hype with the Brussel sprout chips...they were just meh.. If you're looking for excellent service and solid food def give it a try.

RBZ_kMjowV0t6_nv2UKaDQ.review_text: I forgive Park Tavern for the five pounds they probably made me gain for serving deliciously captivating food that I couldn't help but gobble up as quickly as they put it down. The food is truly that good. I was going into the evening hoping to spare my waistline a calorie overload, but once I looked at the menu, I knew I'd be throwing those goals out the window.   This restaurant has a charming, cozy and trendy vibe wrapped into one. Each table is within pretty close proximity of each other but it's so vibrant inside, you don't really pay attention to the table next to you. We began the feast with brussell sprout chips, burrata cheese with lemon basil chips and deviled eggs. I wasn't quite sure what to expect with the burssel sprout chips and my taste buds were pleased with the choice after just one bite. These are the leaves of the sprous basked in olive oil and baked to perfection. They are cirspy, salty and just plain delicious. The deviled eggs are just a perfect little taste and you can order them individually. I'm not typically a deviled egg fan but these were delicious.   For the entree, I was told they are known for their poulet rouge (rotisserie chicken) so I had to order it. Yes, this chicken actually came out completely whole on the rotisserie skewer and sitting on a bed of potatoes and spinach. It was the most phenomenal presentation I've seen in awhile and the table next to us even made a comment! This is not your ordinary chicken either. No, they do something to this chicken to make it moist with flavor that's spicy and sweet all together. It almost tasted like a gourmet buffalo wing sauce. The spinach complimented the chicken. I didn't really eat the potatoes but mostly because my tummy was already begging me to stop consuming food! However, you can't end the night with chicken, so we shared a piece of birthday cake. Yes, they have birthday cake on the menu and each month has a different flavor. This month (March), they are featuring strawberry birthday cake. It's a heavenly combination of fluffy cake, creamy frosting and fresh strawberry mixed inside. It was a perfectly sweet way to end the meal and I can't wait until I get to visit this foodie's paradise again.

h0fNBxo0qFtrxX59PIzv1g.review_text: A lovely Anniversary dinner choice...kudo's to the hubster. My hubby is always scanning the Sunday paper or reading articles online about the newest places to eat local and in NYC (for our treks to the big apple). So this year since we couldn't be in New York for our Anniversary he'd been wanting to go to the Park Tavern. So he surprised me with making the reservations 3 weeks in advance (Go dude!). It was pouring rain when we arrived for our Friday night 7:30 reservation, but no worries with $11 valet. We were seated in a small corner seat. Our waiter got our drink orders out to us right away, and we ordered some starters while trying to decide what to order. We heard the deep fried bussel sprouts and deviled eggs were really good, the deviled eggs come with a small slab of bacon and a slice of jalapeno. WoW! Spicy, fatty and rich. The  deep fried brussel sprouts were crisp and airy and melted in your mouth (a tad salty) but delicious.  We decided for an appetizer we'd share the truffle fries with caviar and a soft boiled egg? (I know, talk about cholesterol overkill...hey it was our anniversary). Never waited more than 10 or 15 minutes between each dish. We both decided to throw caution to the wind after all the other starters and go for the Fillet Mignon with twice baked potato. It came with a wine sauce and it was pretty much "I've died and gone to heaven..." delicious. Whoa.....but alas....silly me ate too many fries, and other things and couldn't finish my dinner. So I took my dinner home in a box. Which I got to enjoy for lunch at work the next day (and was equally as good). That Steak which we both ordered medium rare, was perfect. and the sauce was rich and the crunchy twice baked potato.....oh and they gave us strawberry cake and after dinner drinks for free since it was our anniversary. What a perfect evening! (one small thing on a rainy day, their tile floor is uber slippery) I hope we get to go back here sometime soon for dinner, I really enjoyed my evening and food...oh and my fabulous company! Score for the hubster!

4YIgqJiqqZKPIdoPz2Zv6w.review_text: Great find in North Beach when your not looking for the typical Italian fare- menu is constantly updated and the place is always busy.  Great service and great food.

qqKddLtLxbPnTf6c7yqS3g.review_text: Not a fan of the food as its overly salty and at times heavy/rich (the exception being the devil eggs). Lounge for drinks is great.

6v6A28oaoACvLAZX4cDsSg.review_text: Only came here because it was related to Marlowe.  I arrived about 15 minutes before the friend I was meeting and decided to wait at the bar.  Bar service = fabulous.  A woman seated beside me ordered a drink that the bartender *thought* he knew how to make, once served - he stood and waited for her review... she stated that it was 'alright' but that she was used to a couple other particulars, he took the drink and re-made it to her specifications (even crushing the ice to match her description) and handed it back to her.  Having been a bartender previously - I felt this was pretty impressive, considering that the bar was full.  The drink selection alone was impressive - and wines were also varied.  The food was simply excellent.  I tend to shy away from the new age 'deviled egg' that has less egg and more deviled - but the waitress convinced me to give them a try - and I am ultra happy that she did.  They were delectable.  We shared the scallops (entree) as an appetizer, which they properly split for us - I had the twice baked potato and a salad for dinner, my friend had the marlowe burger - sub truffle fries.  With regard to price, I'm not sure what some people expect - it's SF and you're either a foodie or not.  If you want $5 toast don't come to a restaurant of this stature.  The end.  Everything was simply awesome.  I will be going back many times to come.  Happy to have a version of Marlowe even closer to my apartment, and a larger more upscale rendition of one of my favorite restaurants to boot.

3m4ogO-C9nBVxHdWD09OnQ.review_text: What a disappointment.  Coming from the San Francisco Symphony's show, I was starving; and when I'm starving, I'm not picky.  We started off with the trout dip appetizer that came with their own chips which was only so so.  I'd rather have some unhealthy onion dip with kettle chips.  We also got the deviled eggs which are supposedly a "have to get"  item.  It was pretty good, but I don't understand what all the hype is about.  It comes with a piece of bacon on top that is just WAY too salty and it overpowers the egg completely.  I didn't really mind that these were only average dishes because I was so hungry.  Then, I ordered their black cod.  When the fish came, it looked shriveled like an old grandma's toe.  It tasted even worse.  It wasn't fresh at all; it was almost as if they let it sit in the corner of the kitchen floor for days!  And plus, they charged us up the hoo-hah for it! We sent it back immediately and instead of receiving a new menu to decide what I wanted, the waiter just said, "What do you want to order now?" pressuring me to make a last minute decision.  My dad piped in and said I'll take a burger.  Luckily I didn't have to wait long for it-- keep in mind that I was famished.  It was a just an average burger: nothing special and somewhat under seasoned.  After we all finished our entrees, I figured that maybe they could redeem themselves with dessert.  Nope.  However, I've complained enough, and you can probably figure out what I'm going to say.  I'll spare you, Park Tavern, from my rage.  Never again.

zD1XC9Ns0drDXBHEO7EY1A.review_text: The ambiance and the surrounding area around park tavern is worth going for (washington park). I prefer going there for brunch dinner was very small portions and not enough food. I tried the deviled eggs and the poulet vert. The poulet vert takes a while to come out but it was amazing.   Parking is impossible to find you have to uber/lyt/taxi to the place. North beach in general is very hard to find parking. Make sure you have reservations before you arrive especially if it's on a friday or saturday or you will be waiting for hours at end.

fMUBsXKl8GYHTj5cqAbvBQ.review_text: We love Marlowe so were really excited to hear that Park Tavern was opening in North Beach!  We went on Friday night and really enjoyed the experience there.    Favorites:  Fried green tomato appetizer, mussels entree, polenta with nectarines cooked in a personal cast iron skillet drizzled with balsamic vinegar (sounds a little strange but it was WONDERFUL...I couldn't get enough of this!).  I like the fact that there are so many appetizer and small plate options to share.  They have a limited number of entrees but a good variety.  The service was great and they are very in tune with customer feedback.  We look forward to going back!  Oh - and they valet  - which is critical since it's ridiculously hard to find parking in North Beach otherwise.

aF6yuQL-00l8UpaEPGyPMQ.review_text: I first dined here when they were first opening, so while the service still had some kinks to work out, the food, drinks, and atmoshere won me over.  I will definitely be back to enjoy a sit down dinner, but it may also become my 'go-to' spot for happy hour drinks with friends.

AyJcTC6ZKWNbiBJAaepSVw.review_text: Maybe it's just me, but Park was ehh. Came here on a Friday for lunch. I decided I was going to get the ahi tuna with veggies. And I ordered a glass of wine with my lunch. The waitress was very helpful in choosing a wine that would complement my ahi tuna. I love that. If you are a waitress or waiter in the city, you need to know this. It's the basics. When I received the ahi tuna, I could immediately see that it had been overcooked. Usually ahi is this nice pink and this was almost pink-brown. Not a good look for ahi tuna. Also, whatever they had grilled the veggies with tasted like burned rubber. It was just not good. I ate it solely because I was starved. I was disappointed to say the very least. Other than the atmosphere and the location of the place, I would pass on this place. I am inclined to try it again, just not the ahi.

L68WWP1sAbWRnbop1Maj0A.review_text: Park Tavern is a pretty good restaurant with fabulous restaurant prices.    My husband and I ate here with friends on a visit to San Francisco.  The place was packed in the bar area, so I was pleasantly surprised that the tables weren't too close together.    Cocktails were good (I had the Washington Square - yummy!).  For starters, we shared the brussel sprout chips (meh) and the smoked deviled eggs (yum!).  For my main course, I had the "Marlowe" burger (which I was told is one of their signature dishes).  It was good, but nothing to write home about (I guess I had to know what a $15 hamburger tastes like and now I know it tastes exactly like a $6 hamburger).  My husband had the cab steak, which was also good but average good.  Overall, I had a good meal at Park Tavern, but would probably try someplace else next time I'm in SF.

vbO4ZppKRL4cYeq_ud8PPQ.review_text: The lemon chips and burrata appetizer was quite tasty. The salmon was great, but the quality of meat used for the ribeye steak wasn't quite up to par.

VbE1LgUcOPxkeWZ8eS6OVA.review_text: My man and I went to Park Tavern to have a special night together. We picked this place (more like I) because it was talked about I think in San Francisco Magazine. The restaurant is REALLY BIG, it looks small from the outside! We made a reservation and were seated right away (it is best to make a reservation for this place!). Our waiter was nice but I think he could have been a little bit more friendly, I had noticed more friendlier staff waiting other tables.   The food was very good. We ordered the Saikou salmon, baby beets, creme fraiche & dill and the Brussels sprout chips the share, both amazing! Then I had the Grilled pork chop , sauteed baby turnips, carmelized apple, Nueske's bacon & mustard jus and my man had the Hawaiian tombo tuna, crispy sunchokes, white anchovies, baby artichokes & salsa rustica, he liked it, but liked my pork a little bit better ;) For dessert we had the  apple & red wine-caramel crisp, is was SO GOOD!  I don't remember what cocktails we ordered but I do remember what I had was VERY GOOD!  For sure this is a place to bee seen but what I also liked about it there were all walks of life as well, it was not all posh people, their were families and older couples. After your done with dinner I highly suggest you take a walk (thats if your wearing okay walking shoes) to Coit Tower to walk off your dinner, on a clear night the view is so beautiful!

EDqapHpalzHTd-wWvAb86g.review_text: Park tavern is a great brunch and dinner spot. I've been here multiple times and, for the most part, it is tasty!   For brunch: I would definitely try the french toast. It has the perfect level of sweets where it isn't overkill but just the right amount to be so dang good. The polenta cakes are really good as well but rather small in size. I would avoid the marlowe burger - it's good but definitely not the best item that Park Tavern offers.   For dinner: The truffle fries are godly. Though, it's hard to go wrong with anything with truffles and caviar. I really liked the half chicken. The presentation is great and the chicken is really tender. For appetizers, I didn't like the waygu beef jerky at all. I do recommend trying the brussel sprout chips. It's just like kale chips but tastier if you like brussel sprouts.  Overall, Park Tavern is a great spot. The decorations are great and it always seems like a popular place to be. I definitely recommend making reservations in advance to avoid waiting for a table. Though, there is a community table that is first come, first serve if you are in a rush!

kqwUyLvanNc7-lfFQ8Jcnw.review_text: We recently had our wedding reception in the Eden Room (32 guests) and we can't speak more highly of our experience. The food was incredible, the service was even better. There was always someone there to take care of our requests happily and without hesitation. Montana, the private events director, was very helpful and took care of everything on the day of the event just as we had discussed.   My mom is vegan, so we requested a special entree for her (we were eating family style). Not only did they give her a special entree, but every other dish that they could modify for her, they did. They really went above and beyond to take care of us.  The nice thing about the Park Tavern menu is that it is accessible to a lot of people with different tastes. It balances familiar comfort food with interesting and innovative combinations so that there's something for everyone and people can explore without feeling out of place. We heard positive feedback on the food from everyone in our group!

TgWzmmndaT3Py9FQOmwEHA.review_text: Fantastic drinks, fantastic service, fantastic food. Great place for any meal with friends, or for a romantic outing. It is pricey, but it's just that kind of place. I would feel comfortable sending most people here knowing they would have a good experience.

azCk2YXSFr-lKgBtA3CWIA.review_text: Worst brunch place ever. The food was good. I had the burger and it was okay (not like nopa or anything) and the rack of bacon which was amazing. But it was after that made me dislike this place.  I woke up with a massive headache and felt awfully sick. Park Tavern was the only thing I ate that day and i felt like i was hit with a massive dose of MSG. I doubt that Park Tavern uses such a thing but there was definitely something that was wrong with my food that made me feel so awful.

507_pX2ycKUjd2ol_-lPsA.review_text: Horrible brunch, way overpriced. Dutch baby was like a flat pancake, but half the size of a normal pancake. they don't have normal breakfast/brunch options, or even a wide array, and their prices are ridiculous for the small amount of food they give you, mind you, food that doesn't even taste that good. their orange juice is also horrible it tastes like (five dollars for a small small glass) sunny d, coming to a five star rating restaurant and getting weird sunny d orange juice is perhaps the most depressing of all.   on the other hand, the manager saw our sheer disappointment and paid for the drinks and sides at least.

M19NwFwAXKRZzt8koF11hQ.review_text: (See pics) Review #1220. Maybe it's a people watching place, but it's not a food place for brunch.  The feta flat bread was mediocre. Veal schnitzel and cast iron baked eggs were just so so and were on the greasy side.  The space was classic and tables were quite packed together. Surprisingly the place did get busy as we were finishing up the lunch.  Definitely people were more dressed up even on a weekend here but I can't be sure if it earns a return visit.

z9gKizPz6yVB_yArqMsI0g.review_text: Wow!  What a beautiful job they did making this place look lovely!  Very inviting and nice people!  The food is delicious!  Everything that I tried I loved!  My favorite...fried green tomatoes, fig W/deep fried polenta & the scallop W/grapefruit.  Oh & they make beef jerky that is wonderful!  Great service!  Welcome to North Beach!!!!!

1A-geB-PQr1uveSFOS7Feg.review_text: My husband and I stopped in here for drinks months ago, and just recently stopped in again to try out brunch.    We really liked the decor/feel of the place - reminded us of a place we loved in New York City.  The service was very good, and fast - we couldn't believe how fast our food came out.  Even better than fast - the food was delicious :)  My husband ordered the burger, and I wasn't especially hungry, so I opted for the avocado toast.  The burger was very tasty - the smoky/char taste was very much appreciated!  We also loved the avocado toast - the olive oil that was used was very smooth and yummy - and the chili powder added a nice flare.    We've decided to try it again for brunch - I think next time I'll go for the crispy polenta cakes, which I would have gotten (in addition to the avocado toast :)) had I been more hungy at the time.   We also would like to pop in for dinner sometime.    Overall, great food, great service - a fun place for a date with your significant other or dinner/brunch with a group of friends/family.

MsbIFptSdbUIBng23wFhbw.review_text: Great place for both brunch and dinner.  Great service and the bartenders are really service and quality oriented.  Make reservations and go.

MBvS-51TsumtBTnjIoNtfw.review_text: A little over priced, fun fancy brunch spot and really good bloody marys! Sometimes the wait is pretty long at popular brunch hours too

ftKchftJyka8ixQqBma3Qw.review_text: The food: ordered a variety of items off the menu; all very very tasty. All around a solid meal of "traditional american" items. One of the best pork chops and deviled eggs I've had. Also, really good cocktails.   The ambiance: awesome location right on the Washington Square. Got lucky with the parking, but could see it being a challenge; however, it is in the heart of North Beach so that is to be accepted.
