-8iSGr1pvfvUmuC1oNOQjg.review_text: Gave me food poisoning.  Too much oil was my first thought.  Ate the oily deviled egg first, which was yummy (but oily).  Then had the Portuguese seafood stew.  It was basically just drowned in oil.  Way too much.  At first I thought I had a headache and no appetite to finish it just because of the oil.  But I was still feeling the effects the next two days, so I think it was more than just oil overdose, I think there was something wrong with the seafood.  My friend got a couple sides for her dinner, thinking to be healthier - and she had the same experience - just drowned in oil.  She had the twice baked potato dish and the brussel sprouts.  She felt sick for two days after as well.  So that's the food.  The wait staff was nice, but a little pushy.  I felt like our waiter twisted our arm to get the deviled eggs.  And for being an upscale place, I was surprised that they had metal chairs that you'd find in an outdoor festival or something for their dining room chairs.

sq5gBXaG8GcHGAd5LUGwXw.review_text: I adore this restaurant and staff! The food is spot on. Lemon chips and burrata was a perfect nosh at the bar while we waited for our table,(we arrived early). Service by Carlos, Armando and the GM Peter was friendly and attentive. I might have to log some extra hours at the gym but totally worth it.

df8OiJq0pcaj7qyD6zB_yA.review_text: Park Tavern has great atmosphere and great bar area, the service is great the food can be great at times but mostly average! I have got the SMOKED DEVILED EGGS,  BRUSSELS SPROUT CHIPS, CRISPY LEMON CHIPS & the bone marrow all of which are great. what is a let down in this place is main dishes, Marlowe burger is good but it is not the best burger in the city! for main dish I also have had POULET NOIR which is different but not amazing. and the ROASTED DUCK BREAST which is average! desert changes so most of the time is ok but I have had the best cheese cake here so get it if it is on the menu. For brunch I highly recommend the veal schnitzel if they serve it that day...

DKmUukETiMVidu548TE-zw.review_text: Park Tavern has a fantastic location of overlooking Washington Square and a large and spacious interior. I have a feeling that chances of it being fully booked is a little slimmer than some of the other trendy but smaller venues with like 10 tables.   The menu has an array of interesting looking dishes. Although most tables around us were munching on squash blossoms, we opted in for the lemon chips with hummus dip.  So glad we went for that! The thinly sliced chips combined the crispiness of a potato chip with the lovely fragrance of a lemon. Refreshing and tasty!  The famous deviled eggs did not disappoint. Nice kick from the jalapeno bits inside and the bacon on top gave it a nice texture and additional flavor.  My entree, the red snapper, itself was okay.  I really was hoping black cod would still be on the menu, but it wasn't.  The bed of cabbage and leeks the fish sat on was incredibly flavorful.  That alone I can eat again and again.   One of us had the halibut which came on a nice bed of corn risotto.  The corn risotto was so smokey and sweet, again, made the fish itself pale by comparison.  Another friend got the Marlowe burger. I am not a burger eater so I didn't try but she said it was worth the hype as well, being very moist.   Some unknown birdie must have informed the restaurant that it's one of our birthdays.  Wasn't the intention of our dinner get-together, but one of us does have a birthday coming up next week.  The restaurant generously sent us a slice of chocolate cake for dessert. And when I say generously, I mean, the cake was large! It was delicious, but the four of us didn't finish it!  I would absolutely come back again. It seems to be the type of restaurant that has something for everyone, but still serves food innovative and tasty enough for the easily-bored, hard-to-please foodies.

FLe7g1pF5rHiuVX6CmYqog.review_text: Very innovative take on domestic cuisine.  Service was excellent. Food was very good, though the black cod tasted fishy. The halibut was awesome. Will try again in hopes to raise rating.

6is5wv1dK9jO8qqN4cFciQ.review_text: heard this was the new spot to go now and it's true!  I'm a fan of this place for sure.  I can't wait to come back to the North Bay and try more food.  The place was super busy, but we managed to get bar seating within 5 minutes.  You can be put on the bar list if you don't have a reservation or there's a communal table in the bar area which is first come first serve.  It's modern decor with dark wood, but not a stuffy place at all.  More relaxed, but vibrant vibe.  People were super friendly and bartender makes fabulous cocktails.   Met a guy who goes there frequently and had me order the bartender's special cocktail since I love bourbon.  It's not on the menu so you would have to ask for it.   It was real good, not sweet which is right up my alley.  Also tried the McKinley (a whiskey cocktail) and that was good as well, but I like the bartender's special better.   For food, we had small bites. deviled eggs with bacon, pickled jalepeño, and chives.  So good.  Full of flavor and just right.   kampachi (raw fish) with kaffir, grapefruit and finger lime.  This is good, but not the greatest crudo dish I've had.  Very light. fried oyster "caesar".  Who doesn't love fried oysters!  Came with a side a caeser salad and dipping sauce.  Def. would nosh on these again.  Next time I come, I'd like to try the apps and entrees.    We finished off with espresso and a some grappa, which came from a fellow gentlemen we met sitting nearby.  Never heard of it, but was super strong and good surprisingly.    great place, must go to

kZJWAY828P8QZTqVYzhTCg.review_text: Park Tavern's usual suspects: * Housewives of San Francisco: Botox Edition * group of used-to-be sorority girls...one so drunk, she fell off her chair with a *thud* while waiters scramble to pick her up & her frenemies die of embarrassment * dressed-up couples (how cute!) * then there's underdressed me who didn't do her research & had no idea how fancypants this place is. Oopps, to the diners sitting in my vicinity, please excuse the messy ponytail & jeans (pricey, yes, but jeans nonetheless *wink*)  My lemon-themed appetizer (fried lemon chips w/ burrata & some kind of herb) & dessert (an airy lemon cheesecake topped with huckleberries & smoked salt) were phenomenal.   $20 PT fries include a side of egg yolk & caviar. So frou frou it hurts. At least it was dee-lish.   Demons on horseback was shocking as my surf tasted more like turf; shrimp isn't supposed to taste purely of lard(on.)  Deviled eggs were not the absolute best I've ever had but the jalepeno & generous crisp bacon gave it a smokey, spicy kick.   And finally, my salad (an appetizer I chose to have as an entree as the above mentioned grub was filling enough) was unexpectedly divine. I didn't think I'd be okay with chicories but when it's warm & wilted like that, I'd gladly eat that bitter mess forever. And the poached egg mixed with bread & bagna cauda(anchovies, garlic & olive oil)... Let's just say the chef knows what he's doing.   Attention to decorating details (rivets in the leather, a tree at the entrance, the rustic wheel as a lighting apparatus), an enthusiastic waiter, food that makes me feel the $85 per person bill was worth every penny...five fancypants stars.

4j-QYhLTp_mnxis6Z1pTGQ.review_text: After reading about Park Tavern and having loved Moose's and saw it decline, it was so nice to see this space back to such a high caliber restaurant once more.  We had the carrot pesto salad, peppers as a side and the amazingly moist chicken that is cooked on a Staub cast iron pan with greens and potatoes beneath it.  AMAZING! On a Sunday evening the place was packed.  And for good reason.   Keep up the great work!

ukaKLTHWKENfaW04UQ2tow.review_text: This place is like a new favorite now! I had such a nice meal with good company and great service!. The chicken (poulet noir) was really special. The deviled eggs were great, tasty little appetizers The Brussels sprout chips were crispy and nice but maybe a nit too salty. The apple Cheddar crisp was a good ending to it all.  I think the service here is what really impressed me, everything just came and went at the perfect time and friendliness was as good as the professionalism!

VUk3lcb1RzT5QrM6sXtfyw.review_text: My husband, father, stepmother and I enjoyed a terrific dining experience at Park Tavern last Saturday. Right away, all four of us just loved the ambiance and decor. The bar area was very lively and busy. We had a reservation and they seated us right away, although we were about 15 minutes early. We started with some cocktails, I enjoyed a Moscow Mule, my current favorite. Here though, they were a tad heavy with the lime juice and bitters - it was too tart compared to the ones I usually enjoy at other establishments.  My Dad and StepMom enjoyed some sauvignon blanc which they both said was very good.  Dad is serious about wine, and he remarked that their selections were impressive.  We next had the brussels sprout chips - soooo good. I'd had them at Marlowe and they were just as yummy here. I also had the pea soup, it was a summer style soup served at room temperature. It was a tad runny, but had excellent fresh pea flavor. Hubby had the prawns in lardo (sounds gross, I know, but it isn't what you might think) - they were heaven. Best prawns either of us had ever experienced. Dad enjoyed the anchovies and we all loved the fresh bread. I had the halibut on a potato and corn "risotto" and it was one of the best preparations of any fish dish I've had. Portions were perfect.  Hubby and StepMom had the black cod, they loved it. Dad had the Ahi, and also enjoyed it. We finished by sharing the peach cobbler and the dark chocolate creme brûlée...they were very good, cobbler was a tad bland, but it did allow for the flavor of the peaches to dominate, rather than the toppings, I guess.  Husband had a nice espresso and Dad and StepMom had dessert wines - all three were happy with their selections. The people watching was fabulous - a see and be seen sort of vibe.  Lots of very young women wearing clothing that left nothing to the imagination and/or shoes that were two sizes too tall and trying to gracefully navigate their way to their table or the restroom, and plenty of men admiring their efforts.  I think our only constructive criticism would be that every time our plates came out from the kitchen, they were delivered to the wrong person at the table and that the wait between appetizers and main course was every bit of a half hour, maybe more. That's a little too long, but we made the best of it with all that people watching. I would go back, for sure, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.

PABIXXEx_6ykhF7I6_Fu-A.review_text: Came here for a big birthday celebration and was not disappointed. The restaurant had a great vibe, great food, and great service, so its my new favorite at the moment. I can still remember the fun times I had when this was the old Moose's back in the day, but that electric energy of the crowd still exists at the present day Park Tavern.   Our group tried pretty much every starter on the menu plus the special Spicy Steak Tartare! The highlights were the fried brussels, steak tartare, hamachi crudo, demons on horseback, deviled eggs, and fried oyster cesar - all outstanding.    For our mains the standouts were the pork chop, ahi tuna, and burger. The only item that was really below par was the lobster and crab bisque. It was so salty it verged on bitter and this is coming from a gal who likes her sodium. After a taste I thought my hands were going to swell up to the size of baseball mitts!  As for everything else - they had a very comprehensive wine list and a few cool beers, like the red rice Japanese ale. The service was on point and very efficient.   The evening capper of the Birthday cake was excellent. What better way to celebrate than having the restaurant offer cake?!? Love it and can't wait to come back!

WtuU7K11HEF-rbJK5NFxoQ.review_text: We went here for a work dinner last night and WOW! I was more than impressed, I have never been here and heard bits and pieces, but I left very happy! Since there was a big group of us, they did it kind of tapas style which was great because we got to try a ton of things!  Starters:  -Deviled Eggs, bacon pickled jalapeno & chives -Amazing!!! One of my favorites -Warm house smoked nuts with Blis vanilla maple -Delicious, I wish I could snack on these all the time -Brussel sprout chips -Also amazing! -PT French fries, parmesan, truffle & black pepper -To die for  So all the starters we pretty much amazing. I could have had an entire meal of them.  First Course:  -Tuna conserva, grilled country bread & arugula -Very tasty -Lemon & petit pea tendrils, burrata -I love burrata, the lemon chip was an interesting addition -Market vegetable crudite, green goddess dip -Nothing amazing, but good snack  Second Course:  -"Poulet Rouge" with lemon thyme jus -This was tasty -Seared local albacore with salsa rustica -Not overly impressed -Butter braised spinach with roasted pewee potatoes -Delicious -Brown butter parmesan roasted Brussels sprouts hearts -One of my favorites as well  -Twice baked potatoe, creme fraiche, cheddar  & scallions -These were one of my other favorite things  Dessert:  -Chocolate Pudding -To die for!!!!  So ya it was an amazing dinner and I highly recommend it!!!!

Tx_5UQHUziZgQc6VKO0oqA.review_text: I love Marlowe and their new American comfort food. When they opened up their super-sized Park Tavern in Washington Square, I knew it was going to be awesome.  You can fit probably 10 Marlowes in the old Moose's space. My party scored a table on a Friday night at 9pm.  I really liked the dark wood decor and open kitchen.  The bar was packed and lively. They had a handful of interesting cocktails, so I started off with a Washington Square with hangar vodka. Later on I also had a Golden Gate, made with shochu. I forget what else they were mixed with, but both drinks were inventive and tasty. They're definitely going to bring in a lot of thirsty bar hoppers with their cocktail program.  We went all out with the appetizers and shared pork rinds, fried oysters, fried pork belly, beef jerky, and brussell sprout chips. All the fried stuff was amazing, especially the oysters. I'm not a fan of brussell sprouts, but I enjoyed the crispiness. We also shared a bunch of side dishes, including the polenta, potatoes, and peppers.  For my entree I had the lamb chops and merguez sausage. The lamb was medium rare and perfectly cooked for my taste. The sausage was a flavorful bonus, but I thought the greens with the dish were way too salty. I finished off the meal with an awesome Fernet ice cream shake. It sounds funky, but I recommend it if you like Fernet.  The service was excellent and cheerful. You can tell they were all excited with the opening. I look forward to visiting them again soon.

4ThTn2pECPA6zoWiqkJSGw.review_text: This is my new favorite restaurant in SF. It has a great menu and wonderful service - the perfect combo. The menu is solid and delicious every time. The service is impeccable.   Dinner is amazing and brunch is too. Go here. You will return again and again.

Hj_GF8MnikDy4BQzf0B8Dg.review_text: Came back with my girlfriends this time.  It was easy to get reservations and a seat at the bar for drinks.    I recommended we share a bunch of diff dishes so we can try more and I think it worked out well from my experience last time.   Duck Liver Mousse - good Brussel Sprout Chips - always a hit Crispy lemon chips, fava bean hummus & sorrel - not the same w/ hummus, disappointed "Demons on horseback" smoked lardo-wrapped prawns, scallion remoulade & celery leaf  - unexpectedly good PT fries, truffle oil & parmesan, truffle aïoli, soft boiled egg & Osetra caviar - highly recommend if you like fried, delicious, richness.   Roasted brussels sprout hearts, parmesan, sage & chili - standard Grilled pork chop, wood fire-roasted yellow peaches, creamy polenta, Nueske's bacon & mustard jus - not a huge pork chop fan so it was ok.   "Marlowe" burger, caramelized onion, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aïoli & fries - disappointing, not as good as I remember and all the write ups.  Our waiter was really nice to switch out the fries w/ PT fries.    We ordered way too much food.  We also shared a dessert but I was so stuffed I couldn't even take a bite - unheard of!  All in all everything was good, including service but I don't need to come back for awhile.

pvi_baolWn7mrtcb9rWAEw.review_text: A fantastic selection of meat and seafood... and if you fancy, just share a bunch of appetizers and eat tapas style.  I especially loved the Devil on Horseback (prawns with lardo), lemon chips (fried lemon slices! Strangely delicious) and two applications of brussel sprouts.  Their wine selection kicks ass and we progressed from light (Pinot) to bold (Zins) reds. The cocktail selection was pretty sensational also.  Come eat outside on a sunny afternoon/ early evening... it is well worth it.

jqWQN0GIjG1165G--R0JLw.review_text: Given that this is the 3rd, possibly 4th place I've been to in this location, you might surmise the site is cursed but you'd surmise wrongly.  "Moose's" was special and had a good, long run.  "Frankie & Johnny's" followed with great food but a tired, out of favor concept.  Now we're back in "Moose's" territory with a better menu, better food, stellar service, and that undefinable X-factor that makes all the women look  beautiful and all the men look rich.      Having done some early reconnaissance, I knew that it'd be no meal at all unless I sprung for the Deviled Eggs ($2 each, topped with bacon and jalapenos) and the "Brussels Sprout Chips" ($7).  Holy crap, those two things plus a couple glasses of that Rose Prosecco ($12 each) and I was sated on the umami flavors:  salty, spicy, fatty, and rich.    Went on to sample a "Tuna Conserva" ($8) which tasted luscious atop grilled, sliced baguette.    The way to dine here and still stash away a little dough is to opt for one of the richest, butteriest, best burgers around.  At $14, in this locale, it's a steal.  My dining companions ordered all sorts of other stuff but I was too consumed with the glorious riches before me so who knows what they were eating.    I walked outside to find a gaggle of tourists still standing there on the northeast side of Washington Square Park, with cameras aimed at Coit Tower, all lit up in Giants Orange.  Park Tavern is a beautiful place from which to begin your evening.

fGufoIb1xuK1pXNysJA-pA.review_text: First Visit for dinner:  Steak... Not so much.  Scallops... Not so much.  Pork belly appetizer... Bad!    One year later...Second Visit for brunch:  Duck hash... Rad.  Polenta Benedict... Wow.  Bloody Mary... Needs more booze, but spicy.

Qe1KBAFr6ddntrZZMgmzkQ.review_text: Well what can I say about Park Tavern? We really wanted to love this place...and we did like it but definitely did not love it. We had been sitting on a gift card for dinner there for sometime and we finally decided to head over on a Wednesday, figured middle of the week shouldn't be too busy right? WRONG! Earliest reservation 9pm! Oh well we took it.   When we got there I was a little surprised how very busy and loud it was! Why the 4 stars? Because the food was very good, the famous brussels sprout chips were a unique experience, braised short ribs were cooked perfectly, and my wife said her pork chops was a win too! However I really can't get over how loud the restaurant was ...maybe just an extra busy night? Wednesday?    If we came back it would probably be more for a cocktail or brunch, yeah the food was good but wouldn't be our first choice for a romantic dinner.

y7oeeuOub0p-ih5Olbct2A.review_text: One sunny afternoon (a couple weeks ago), my friend and I were walking through North Beach trying to decide on a place to have lunch. It was between Tony's and Park Tavern. I am so glad we went to Park Tavern - I have had Tony's many times (no bad reviews).  We decided to sit outside, which was great! The sun shines right on the outside tables.   I had the Marlowe Burger which was awesome. The sauce that comes with the burger is (in my opinion) the best part (I am big fan of house-made sauces). I also had the grapefruit brulee. Im not a big fan of sweets but this is a must try...  AND how could I forget the Michelada! VERY different! The pickled jalapeno definitely gives it a kick!

1tObli6sTFk4iyAN9A84rA.review_text: Got lucky and scored a reservation for 7PM last Saturday night, by calling in at 11pm the night before! We drove and used the $11 valet which is super convenient for the heart of North Beach.  We started with the deviled eggs and NY steak crudo. The eggs were just OK, with all the hype I was expecting a bit more...but they were almost too pickled like they had been sitting in juice for a long time. The steak crudo on the otherhand was fabulous. Slices cut about 1/4 inch thick, lightly covered with a lemon sauce, arugula pieces, and breadcrumbs. All the flavors complimented each other perfectly and the only downfall was that is wasn't twice the size to make me twice as happy!  For entrees we ordered the poulet rouge - tender, large, and living up to it's reputation; the pork chop - cooked perfectly, worked with all the sides it came with, yumm; and the tombo tuna - this was our least favorite, not much flavor, small. We also ordered a side of polenta - the richness of the dish contrasted perfectly with the pickled cabbage on top. One of the better polentas I've had!  For drinks I had the Mckinley to start. At $13 I expected more, it was nothing special. The Au Bon Climat Chardonnay was amazingly buttery and delicious, went perfectly with the fabulous meal!  We a port to end the night and were sad they didn't remember to bring out the birthday cake since we had stated with our reservation it was a birthday dinner. Oh well, we were satisfied enough with the overall experience that I will happily go back - as long as someone else is picking up this bill because this place aint cheap!

VlVx6clfF7iZfO_idvuMfA.review_text: My husband LOVED the burger at Marlowe, so when we heard about this place opening, he made reservations ASAP.   We were a few minutes early for our reservation, so we ordered drinks at the bar, but were seated by the time we got them. Nice.   Service wasn't great, but it was only their second day, so it can totally be forgiven. Our server was very pleasant, just not very attentive.   We each a had a DELICIOUS deviled egg. I was impressed they could get so many textures and flavors in such a small item.   Neither of us had ever had fried green tomatoes, so we had to try them. They weren't overly greasy, (which is always my fear with fried food.) It was a perfect amount to share, and we both enjoyed them.   My hubby had the burger and fries, which was just as good as we remembered from Marlowe.   I had the mussels, which were awesome. The broth had great flavor, and i loved the bits of leek and sausage.   We shared the "birthday" cake for dessert, (it was even going to be my birthday soon.) It was light and moist, and a perfect finish to a great meal.   I really liked that many of their dishes are smaller, that way I get to try more items.   Good drinks, good food, beautiful space, and service that is sure to improve.

r_etoXEmNJNoySf7yoO1KA.review_text: In Chronicle's top 100 so made reservations to take visiting friends out to dinner.  Our meal was a big disappointment.  The salad was over dressed, the pork chop was a lump of fat and gristle not to mention way over salted.  The tuna had no seasoning and had zero taste.  We ordered the creamcicle for dessert and it was five pieces or orange with a dollop of whipped cream.  We had to wait almost 30 minutes until I finally got our waiter's attention to bring us coffee which tasted like tea. Dinner was a $300 mistake

AgSPAk3wLf6GES4GbL0nFQ.review_text: This place has slowly deteriorated since it opened.  This place used to have the best lobster bisque.  Sadly disappointed it went from bowl to cup to a crappy shooter using a different recipe.    Sadly, I don't really have much a desire to return.

77l5m0MDjLGuIrItA9D-9A.review_text: Way overrated.  I barely Yelp, but I felt I had to deter others from choosing this place over all the great restaurants in SF.  Biggest problem....no vegetarian plates on the menu.  Not one.  I had to put together a veggie plate by choosing sides off the other plates.  Was given a scoop of greens, cauliflower and mashed potatoes, all of which were inedible.  So much butter and salt, disgusting.  I left ravenous and irritated.  Note I was with a party of 6, and 2 others (both ordered the halibut) could not eat their plates either.  Lots of uneaten food was cleared.  Service was mediocre.  Place was loud.  This is definitely a spot for unsuspecting tourists or those who are merely attempting to "keep up with the Jonses."

tJ3MBzLNDLmjSx8pBjqeDQ.review_text: I finally hit up this spot after hearing about it from everybody. I was expecting just another new restaurant but the food here is just superb. I really can't say enough about the food at Park Tavern. The NY Steak crudo is delish as is the coconut cake.   The ambiance is amazing. The use of wood is exquisite and adds to the overall warmth of the place. The excellent use of the lighting just completes the overall environment.   The staff is friendly and brought out the courses in a timely manner. The cocktails were good and the wine selection is superb. I thought the restaurant experience matched the hype.  However, I made the mistake of using the valet service. It took forever for the valet to acknowledge me and took even longer to get my car back afterwards. I know he hates his job but no need to give attitude to the customers. They don't even have to be nice or smile.  A casual grunt and eye contact would suffice.  But that dude today - he definitely needs to learn how to work with his customers better. I can't believe this guy is allowed to park cars for a living. I highly doubt he knew what he was doing.  In conclusion, I love this restaurant. I would've given it 5 stars but my experience with the valet sucked.

ZJcC16SoUvb89p_hBj_YoQ.review_text: LOVE this place!  Great experience through and through. The only reservation we could get was at 9:15 (they are always packed), but we got there early (parking spot right out front... how lucky is that?!) and had a couple cocktails.  We were seated right at 9:15 at a cute 4-top in the middle of the restaurant. The restaurant has this hip new york feel to it, which I love. The server was super friendly and informative. We started with the Steak Crudo and Brussel Sprout Chips. The Steak was good... but it didn't blow my mind. The Brussel Sprout chips, however, we're out of this world.  I had the steamed mussels with fennel sausage and leeks, and it was incredible.  The sausage and leeks were minced very finely into the butter sauce, which tasted ohhhh soo good when I spooned it into the mussell. They served it with a crusty crostini, which I used to soak up the remainder of the sauce. Everyone else got the "Marlowe Burger", which was good.. but I wouldn't go that route at Park Tavern personally. Go to Marlowe for it! Park Tavern has much more variety than Marlowe, so I recommend trying something different on the menu. Will absolutely be back!

P73_DQhYI6Oe5X3PZ1PBOg.review_text: We chose Park Tavern as a special night out for my sweet baboo's birthday on a Monday evening. And special it was! The service and food were outstanding. We were seated at a sweet little corner booth, near the kitchen. Fun to watch the food coming out of the kitchen.  We ordered the delicious Butter Lettuce Wedge, tantalizing Brussels Sprouts chips, exquisite Poulet Noir, and drool-inducing Marlowe Burger.   At the end of the meal, the server brought 2 small scoops of ice cream with a birthday candle. Classy.   A very special place.  .

WKGBFuyUrK5lFVODxPzjcg.review_text: I knew Park Tavern sounded familiar- the lightbulb didn't go off until I saw "Marlowe burger" on the menu. Jennifer Puccio, executive chef, does both places, and I'll be damned if I forget how incredible that burger at Marlowe is.  I came here on a Sunday brunch around 1pm. Shockingly, there were reservations open and some of the tables were free as well.   FOOD: Banana coconut fritters with a tart raspberry jam were incredible. Not greasy whatsoever, this confection (clearly not calorie-free) was the perfect beginning to a brunch. I ordered the Marlowe burger after much debate between going savory or sweet (there's a smattering of carb-winking items stuffed with sweetness on the menu). The burger is large and comes with fries. I suggest you order it medium, as the medium-well was almost too done. My dining partner ordered the eggs with spinach. Portions were large.   ATMOSPHERE: The cavernous square shape allows booths to be placed within a square to the left of the bar and then free tables within that central square. It's very NYC restaurant. Decor is pulled straight out of the Restoration Hardware catalog-- many pieces I've seen in the showroom were in the dining room at Park Tavern. Y'all can't fool me! It's got a cosmopolitan yet French  countryside vibe- full of creams and dark chocolates. There IS outdoor seating, not much, but it's available. And because you're in North Beach, expect to see the shellacked faces and overpriced brows of Marina females, with heels and gloss, sitting not three feet from you. You get used to it if you're here long enough.  SERVICE: They're quick but I feel that three servers confuses the matter of tipping.   PRICES: It's not super cheap. But you know this going in.

hFCUoOVs1rA4FX9Vps9fsg.review_text: Park Tavern has the BEST french fries. I think they might be my favorite fries in all of SF. The Crispy Lemon Chips are great too. They throw a little black sea salt on the burrata cheese so each bite has good flavor and just a slight tang. With all this heavy savory appetizers, it's nice to have a little green on the table. I love the snap peas in the Sweet Baby Lettuces salad. You can taste the dijon in the vinaigrette and it's refreshing - especially if you're planning on having the steak! Unfortunately, the steak wasn't as exciting as the rest of the meal. Far too smoky for my taste. Not sure if there was some extra worcestershire sauce in the meat or au jus but i preferred the Red Snapper. Healthier, yet still outdone by the classics AND sides. I often roast brussel sprouts at home and still wanted to eat the entire dish at the restaurant. The twice baked potato surprised me in that it came in a scalloped potato plating. It was great, probably due to all the room that created for creme fraiche, butter and cheddar cheese. For dessert, i enjoyed the August Birthday Cake which could have been made for me! It was the lightest coconut flavored cake with lemon curd and plenty of whipped cream. I only stopped at 1.5 slices because we ran out of dessert at the table.. I'll absolutely be back for brunch.

rVHSNa7tzfz4L0J4YqyjvQ.review_text: I've been to Park Tavern several time for brunch, and I'm going to keep going back. First, they take reservations, which means I know I won't be waiting in a two hour line after driving up to the city ... hugely valuable! Second, it's a great location right in front of Washington Square; they have tables out front and a full wall of windowed seating so that you can enjoy a little sunshine while you dine. That's how brunch should be eaten.  The drinks are totally on point. Let's face it, if you're not drinking at brunch, then you're doing it wrong ... that's just having breakfast late. They have a John Daly, which is a boozy iced tea that I can (and do) drink 3-4 of. Guess how good that makes me feel? Totally sets me up for Sunday funday.  Finally, the food is very good. I've had the Smoked Salmon Benedict; perfectly poached eggs (not easy to do and most places leave the white a little runny, which I hate) on top of a thin layer of smoked salmon, red onions, cream cheese, and toast. Damn good. The Crispy Polenta cakes are a close second. If you love umami, this bad boy has mushrooms, truffle oil and arugula! Finally, don't forget to grab an Avocado Toast as a starter. It's simple, but very tasty. My mouth is watering as I write this!  So, Park Tavern ... a total winner for brunch!

sOMhmdxxRPbolQ2hmFZJqw.review_text: I was so surprised to find such a upscale, trendy and cool place like this in my hood. Great crowd, great food, great ambiance, and you're still in North Beach. I would totally recommend it both for a dinner with friends, and for a date.

RK4DvUvFeNhmjpRYRSZLVQ.review_text: The food is pretty good, and service is ok, maybe a bit on the slow side. A couple of outside tables have a view of Washington Square, but you are right on the sidewalk.  I had Brussels sprouts chips, PT fries, and scallops - everything was tasty, but their portions are quite small, so the price doesn't seem right.  I recommend to visit this place at least once, but I wasn't impressed enough to go there again.

VaK27H1hooye5Jw-xC9uYA.review_text: Went here Friday night and got a table for 2 with no wait even though the place was packed - Score!  Ambience:   Very noisy, maybe not the place for large groups.  Food:   Deviled Eggs - You can only taste the bacon, no deviled egg flavor.  Oyster Caesar Salad - Very Good! Oysters perfectly crunchy on the outside and creamy on the inside. Fun idea too.  Bread/Butter - We were talked up on the butter/pork fat - I did  not care for it. Hard to describe, not creamy just bacon fatty, but not salty.  Burger - Total disappointment. Fries and horseradish aioli were good. But there was very little beef, and no beef flavor. Lots of bacon.  Clam Chowder - Soo good. No potatoes or starch, just creamy, salty with very fresh tasting clams. Highly recommend.   Service:  Our server Rachel was awesome! Very helpful recommendations, very attentive, made our visit great.

EK1pUs9x0wr36LqGVqgEqA.review_text: Excellent food.   Friendly service.  Wonderful experience.

cEdyAEZMNkTG37SxseT6rQ.review_text: Great food, wonderful service, cool ambiance. The duck liver was fabulous, the pork shop juicy and the deviled eggs were creative. The wine was paired well. The waiter was attentive, laid back, knew the menu and paid us great attention. Problem? ...he literally forgot about us the second the restaurant became crowded (yes I eat at 5:30pm - restaurant became crowded at 7:15). From the moment we ordered coffee, it took 35-40 minutes to receive our bill. (Why I knocked off 2 stars). I love a long dinner with friends, but we had already been sitting for 1.5+ hours before "he forgot" about us. Besides that it was a nice experience. I really did love the food.

O9iVmgS_hPtNd887LDBctw.review_text: This has been my favorite New American restaurant the past couple of years, only perhaps recently surpassed by Wayfare Tavern (like as of yesterday).  As such, I feel compelled to write a long over-due review to sing Park Tavern's virtues, and I know many others will join me in the chorus.  The owners who expanded upon what they started at Marlowe really got everything right, except maybe situating this New American mecca all the way out in North Beach.  The decor here is casual but classically elegant: rustic wood beams, brown leather banquettes, and white tile flooring.  As for the food, never a disappointment.  My favorite appetizers are the demons on horseback (lardo-wrapped smoked prawns, remoulade & cucumber) and the famous smoked deviled eggs (bacon, pickled jalapeño & chive). Standout entrees have been the grilled pork chop (brussels sprouts, new potatoes & morcilla sausage, pickled onions & mustard jus) and NY steak (braised kobe beef & marrow-stuffed bone, crispy potatoes, smoked cipollini onions, broccolini & red wine jus).    Cocktails here are done very well, with a balance of the classics vs. some creative new inflections on the old styles as well.    Service is always polished and professional, they run a tight shop.  Highly recommend Park Tavern, it's worth the journey to NB.

fepLYIihV-Z1lD7l1Z9GLg.review_text: Sometimes the best things aren't always obvious. You have to be patient and open minded to let things reveal themselves. My experience here came in waves of not good, ok, great, and amazing. I just love when that happens! Love it love it love it!   I pulled up to see the thing I love most - Valet! For $12 you can dress to thrill and wear sky scraper heels to dinner because the door is less than 20 steps away. That always makes me very happy!   The space is nice. The last time I was here was when it was Moose's. We were upstairs in the tiny private area after my friend was married at the church across the way.   Our meal consisted of things that were great and things that were not so great:  Skip the deviled eggs and demon on horseback appetizers. The Halibut entree was really nice. I loved the balance of the rich hearty broth with fresh peas and pea tendrils. The sear on the fish was a wonderful contrast.   The vertical poultry reminds me of beer can chicken. Any home chef familiar with Williams Sonoma has vertical roaster in their cabinet *wink*. I am not a fan of brining poultry because often times it winds up being too salty so I employ other methods. This baby was was tender and flavorful despite being salty for me. The rustic bread stuffing that served as a catch all for the poultry drippings was delicious. I especially liked how they didn't over use truffles because those can ruin it for me. I can see why people love this entree. I would easily recommend it.   Dessert. Banana Split. YES!! The house made ice cream was good - not as rich as I like, but perfect after that heavy meal. The carmelized bananas turned what we consider an everyday treat into something special. Just taking the time to blowtorch or flash broil the bananas makes this the kind of dessert I love. I really appreciate attention to detail. Rare to see that in desserts, which made me love it more.   We enjoyed service that was friendly, professional, unrushed. I was really happy. The seating isn't comfy, but when you are in good company - that matters little.   After our leisurely dinner we walked to Washington Square across the street. Ok - I held on to Mike for dear life trying not to break my neck navigating the uneven terrain in my heels.   Hey, if I fell, I would have looked undeniably faabulous. You can bet money on that!   Go to Park Tavern. Valet Park your car. Enjoy dinner and dessert (skip the over hyped appetizers). Take a short walk across the street, sit on a bench, and chat at Washington Square while your food digests ... because life is meant to be savored.  Park Tavern is a great place for that experience.

qHmLQQZF1GKrU6HFZqZqGA.review_text: Love love ............loved it here!!  Started with the brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs, and the burger to share. YUM! The brussel sprout chips were so light, airy, and addicting! The deviled eggs were impeccable. Bacon and jalapeno complimented it very well! The burger did not disappoint and I can definitely see why Marlowe is so successful!  For entrees we got the mussels, chicken, pork chop, and scallops. Mussels were delish, the fennel sausage cream sauce on the bottom was even better!! My dad sopped up all the goodness from my plate. Haha. The pork chop was hefty, juicy, and delish. The star of the show though was the chicken. SO GOOD! Moist and juicy and oh so flavorful. Such a neat take on beer can chicken. This is a mustttttttttttt try if you are here.  For dessert we shared the cheesecake parfait with smoked salt. Wow- it was a crowd pleaser!! The smoked salt atop was a great compliment to the creamy parfait.   Overall, a wonderful experience. Service was excellent and they even comped my mom's soup because it didn't come out at the same time as the rest of our dishes. Talk about customer service!!!! :)

4aKBkk7rclaZgNWm4p-PoA.review_text: Took my boyfriend here for his birthday and WOW! The service was great from the beginning. Great wine recommendations from our server. The appetizers (we had cheddar cheese and then fried sunchokes) were incredible!!!! So much flavor and great portions for apps. Then I had the bar steak which was so much food and so yummy and the boyfriend had the NY steak which was also SOOOO yummy!!!!  The only thing was the bone marrow we got was actually just bone and not any marrow (oh well- the rest was DELICIOUS). They comped us 2 desserts for his birthday which was so nice! The restaurant was clean and management was always around from what I could tell. The two hostesses were very pleasant. Will be back soon.

Qza0EVW1J_k0u8BIqMRbHQ.review_text: Excellent brunch food. They have some very simple dishes. Good drink selection. Make a reservation for brunch or dinner, otherwise you will be sitting at the bar.

oHgFEYuxCs9KDmYZ55qHOA.review_text: Spacious restaurant that evokes old-school SF with its dark wood and intricate floor tiling.  The crowd is an eclectic bunch including families, old-timers, hipsters ... basically, foodies of all ages.  The common thread is everyone seemed to be having a great time.  First thing you notice is how loud the place is.  Definitely raised voices needed for conversation.  As for cuisine, it's standard American but with unique twists on classics.  The appetizers sounded more exciting so we ended up ordering a bunch of those rather than any entrees. A couple of standouts:  - Deviled eggs with bacon, pickled jalapeno and chives: I don't think I've ever met a deviled egg I didn't enjoy ... but some are better than others and the ones here are some of the best.   - Lemon chips with dill pollen, burrata & Shelley's pea tendrils: this is probably a dish you won't find anywhere.  Literally thinly-sliced lemons that are fried ... extremelyl delicate and not overly sour as I had anticipated.  Very nice.  - PT fries with shaved black truffle and parmesan, served with a soft-boiled egg topped with caviar.   At  over $17, probably the most expensive fries I've ever tried but they were decadent and delicious.    - Demons on horseback (lardo-wrapped shrimp) - you can never go wrong with this combo.  - Brussels sprout chips - a must-order side.  The only so-so dish was the foie gras terrine were just ok (definitely have had better) and the crab dip (which, honestly speaking, may have been good but it was somewhat forgettable compared to other standouts).  The Country Lawyer cocktail (bourbon, vermouth, benedictine and chocolate bitters was outstanding (so good that I went and bought the bitters the following day just so I could make the drink at home).

KwUH31GEXnUlLfiYym5xcQ.review_text: Delicious deviled eggs and a damn good old fashioned.

fcb0YevJ1VlvIpvvOTZcPw.review_text: Great place for happy hour or to take visitors if you're in North Beach. Gotta get there early to grab a spot at the community table or bar. Definitely gets busy and people start eyeballing your seat in the evening. Nice wine list and cocktail menu. The truffle fries, brussels sprout chips, and the deviled eggs are memorable! Will be back for brunch!

H0kbUxaj45magcOXjHNi8w.review_text: Crowded. Noisy. Found the last two stools at the communal table. Service was excellent.  Food was superb.  Deviled eggs were creamy and delicious.  Layered with flavors.  Even the snipped chives on the plate were yummy with the bread. Green goddess salad with pickled peaches.  Crisp, flavorful and a generous portion.  Scallops were magnificent. Accompanied with an unusual mix of tempura mushrooms, grilled bell pepper and a black flecked dressing that surprised with every bite.  Beautifully split plate so we could share.  Its been a while since I have enjoyed every dish in a meal so much.

Z0gMLV4znN6eiAIky5ZPrw.review_text: Really fantastic food and service in a cool restaurant with modern twist on classic San Francisco decor.    We had: Deviled eggs - Highly recommend.  Get 2! Maclaren cocktail - refreshing like green river Lobster Bisque - very rich and decadent Filet Mignon - fantastic Birthday cake for dessert - soft and moist, among the best slices of cake I've had.

dm2G-7KcJ_RYjcZMquJ-SA.review_text: Bring back the Poulet Rouge! Bring back the Poulet Rouge!

dvtkMbQa13VynL5TWLbiLA.review_text: Nice place.  Probably the best pork chop I have ever had.  Brussels sprout chips were very interesting.  Very flavorful!  Upscale, gastro pub with a great view of the park.

rFyLI0yKTGnHIET9hre7XQ.review_text: I had dinner with a girlfriend at Park Tavern earlier this week and everything was incredible. Upon arriving, I was greeted by two very friendly hostess and took a seat at the bar while I waited for my friend to arrive. Ordered the McLaren at the bar -- right up my alley! It was super refreshing and tasty. Our server was amazing, attentive, and friendly and offered really great food recommendations. We ended up sharing the brussel sprout chips, the scallops, and the twiced baked potatoes. All the dishes arrived quickly, which was awesome since we were both so hungry! I highly recommend Park Tavern and will be back.

MZ7tWNct5Qld5y9IyVFh9g.review_text: The smoke flavor on everything including on their salad and devil eggs was overwhelming!!! I usually have a great experience here but last night it was just awful......even their scallop dish was poorly prepared. I mean what happened to the simplicity they used to offer! Maybe it's just their new chef.  I'm glad Marlowe keeps it original!

q54w9MajPsmGZ3vCq-jK1w.review_text: I wanted to write a review for a couple of reasons:  1) to warn all future possible Valentine's patrons that there is an $80 set menu for the big day, 2) because we had fantastic service, and 3) the food was delicious!  1) Menu:  We made the reservation months ago so we didn't know that there would be a pre fix menu.  It was only weird b/c I didn't find out until the night before.  Do not fret though!  The menu was great and delicious.  It was a 3 course meal and they had some additions on the side (i.e. their famous deviled eggs from the 7x7 Big Eat List.  2)  I have always shyed away from going out on Valentine's Day b/c I figured it would be overcrowded and hard to get taxis, etc.  I used to work at a restaurant, and on Vday it was a zoo.  This was not the case at Park Tavern.  They all worked effortlessly.  The food was quick and great (more below) and our service was awesome.  We sat outside because it was a gorgeous night and our waitress was awesome.  I wish I remembered her name so I could give her the kudoos she deserves but I don't remember.  But thank you waitress outside.    3)  The only reason they didn't get 5 stars is because of the food.  Don't get me wrong it was great, but there was some over seasoning on our app and my boyfriends main meal (the steak) was just okay.  My chicken was fantastic.  The deviled eggs were awesome.  My tuna carpaccio was heavy handed with the salt (weird, right?).    Alright that''s all I have.  I just wanted to make sure I warned future Vday patrons of the pre fix menu!  Enjoy.....

ou9Wi3eDQ2Ec_Rg8VHsk2A.review_text: This is officially my new favorite restaurant in SF! Their steak is TO DIE for, and I've brought a few friends from out of town here and they claim it was the best meal they'd had in SF! Great service, very attentive waitstaff. Pretty expensive food, but you're really getting what you pay for!

nAzwe18IMoo9RKU294waJg.review_text: If I could give a 3.5, I would. And it might be a 4 if it hadn't been so hyped. We had a very nice meal at Park Tavern, in lovely surroundings, with above average service. But it wasn't all that I was hoping for. The brussels sprouts were excellent, but everything else was just fine. Well cooked and presented, but the flavors just weren't that exciting to me, and my dining partner was even less impressed than I was. I would eat here again, but probably won't seek it out, which is unfortunate as it's in my neighborhood.  And on a side note: when dining out, get off your smart phones and live a little! It creates a really different atmosphere to have everyone staring at their phones, the blue from the screens illuminating individual faces, rather than  people chatting with each other in convivial conversation. I love my phone, but sometimes I think they are the scourge of society.

lxDAk-O-bvt9fk143V-gnQ.review_text: Pretty good apps.  Brussel sprout chips with sea salt and zest were great. Too much truffle on some items. Pork cheeks were very good. Scallops cooked perfectly.

zu2zzbYdbULdOcaGqEG5BA.review_text: I've been here for dinner and liked it so we made a reservation for Father's Day brunch to celebrate my mom's birthday.  To say the least, the brunch offerings were disappointing.  Here's the recap:  We ordered 4 dishes - Veal schnitzel, Line cook lunch, Ham steak & eggs, and Marlowe Burger.  The good: Marlowe burger - they can't mess up their signature dish  The bad: Ham steak  & eggs - nothing beyond what I can whip up at home and that's not saying much at all.  The ugly: Line cook lunch - Pieces of bacon were not cooked through and the cheese was still cold inside the bread.  Feel bad for the line cooks if they eat this for lunch.  Veal schnitzel was soggy (bad frying) and the inside was rubbery - can it get worse than that combination?     Giving them an additional star only because the dinner was a good one.  Otherwise, this would be a rare 1 star review.

5giWc1ER-utoHSv66OPw3Q.review_text: Another must visit brunch spot in San Francisco. The avocado toast is a must for appetizers, you can also order refreshing pitchers of John Daly's! When I ate here there was a group of young women behind me celebrating an engagement, two old women seated to my right catching up, and a group of guys enjoying bloody's and burgers to my left - the ambience and menu is perfect for gatherings of all kind.

S8uj-qMVr0yvARTH4IsGFA.review_text: One of my favorite things about living in SF is the great food and service at restaurants. That all changed with my experience at Park Tavern. Ordered a Moscow Mule- it was like drinking straight lime juice!!! Yuck. My friend ordered a McLaren that tasted like club soda- WTF?!? The wait staff was terrible...a waiter dropped a whole plate of fries on my back. Our waitress was not very friendly. The food was just ok..the apps and dessert were good (Brussel sprout chips, gnocchi, February birthday cake, and chocolate creme brûlée)...entrees were terrible (pan seared sole was overcooked and the clams were missing a lot of seafood and was all broth. The best part was sitting near the kitchen and watching a dude taste test all the dishes before servers took them to the tables with his bare hands after wiping sweat off his face and double dipping his spoon on a few occasions....puke....I can't believe this is a 4 star on yelp....why did I give 2 stars after such a terrible experience? I went there for brunch and had great food and drink- maybe only a good brunch spot? Suffice to say...I will not be going back.

-aDcxcwfS_RQPdthn4sVPw.review_text: Came here for lunch.  Food was good but too expensive.  Service slow.  Valet parking was a plus.  I won't be back.

Jl7wukjs3Y0WSQOQQ1vkgw.review_text: You must get the Venison Carpaccio. I don't even remember how the entrees tasted nor do I care, because they were completely overshadowed by how good the carpaccio was. The beef tartare was prepared really well. It had a very good balance of citrusy acid with the sweetness of the onions and beef.   All of that doesn't matter once you eat the crispy bone marrow. Each crunchy cube of deep fried bone marrow exploded with rich, savory, beefy goodness. I could keep eating those scrumptious pieces of heaven until they'd have to wheelbarrow me out. Although they're amazing on their own, they also enhanced the rest of the dish. Not only do they provide a crunchy contrast to the soft tartare and tender carpaccio, they also lend a rich fatty undertone to the otherwise raw and fresh nature of the other ingredients. The ingenious use of flavors and textural contrasts combined with the perfect balance of this dish make it a must have appetizer. Actually, forget what I said; skip it. I just want it all for myself!

xlUJfjrkIzljZaEK5MMGTw.review_text: Love coming here. The staff is amazing, the food is delicious especially if you love European-style food  (with an ever changing menu), and the setting is perfect next to Washington square park. Park Tavern has added so much to North Beach.   I've been here so many times and my favorite dishes are the meaty ones - especially the beef tartare.

vH4ac_IkrPtVyBP-i0GTBw.review_text: Park Tavern is a welcome addition to North Beach dining.  Finally, a new place with some style, good food and drinks and a lively, non-touristy set of clientele!  I've enjoyed it every time I've visited, and it's one of the few restaurants in North Beach I would recommend.  The brussels sprout chips are very tasty and one of my fave items from sister restaurant Marlowe.  I really enjoyed my scallops with cauliflower, and my friend raved about the burger.  The cheese plate featured some very good cheeses paired with flavorful jams and nuts.  The only item I tried here that I found disappointing was the fried oysters dish.  Service is great, especially considering how busy it often is (and particularly in the bar area).  I will definitely return :)

76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg.review_text: Deviled Eggs- #95 on the 2013 7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die list. Park Tavern is one of the better new restaurants I've tried in a while. I've been procrastinating on this review, and they've already changed a couple of the dishes on the menu since my visit a couple of months ago, so I had to take a guess for some of the descriptions. I made reservations for an early dinner for a party of 5, and it was easy to do a couple weeks in advance for a Saturday night. We arrived and were seated quickly. We ordered: -Complimentary Bread and Butter (yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): The bread and butter were really good- it's hard to go wrong with epi bread! -"Marlowe Burger" (Caramelized Onion, Cheddar, Bacon, Horseradish Aïoli & Fries, $14, yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): Just as delicious as I remember it being at Marlowe. Highly recommended. -Herb-Crusted Halibut (English Peas & Pea Tendrils, Crispy Shallots, Prosciutto, White Wine Velouté, $28, yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): My friend actually ordered this dish, and it was amazing! I rarely order fish at restaurants since I've had so many bad experiences with it being overcooked, but this halibut was cooked perfectly. The herb crust also added a nice crunchy texture, and all the components in this dish worked really well together. Highly recommended! -Heirloom Beet Salad (yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): Just ok. I liked the different varieties of beets, but overall the dish wasn't anything special. Skip. -Crispy Lemon Chips (Burrata, Nigella Seed, $14, yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): Very interesting, and something I've never seen before or tried, and probably for good reason. The burrata was creamy and delicious, but I didn't get the lemon chips idea. Skip on the lemon chips but the burrata is recommended. -PT Fries (Truffle, Soft-Cooked Egg & Caviar, $14, yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): Yum! The truffle fries were crispy and super aromatic, which added to the delicious flavor. I loved the soft cooked egg that you dipped the fries in, and the caviar on top of the egg. Highly recommended! -Smoked Deviled Eggs (Bacon, Pickled Jalapeño, Chive, $2/ea, yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): A-MAZING! A must order.! I'm not a huge fan of deviled eggs, but this version is the best I've had, ever, and this was an excellent addition to the 2013 Big Eat list. Make sure you order yourself more than one! -Brown Butter Brussels Sprouts (Parmesan & Chili Flakes, $8, yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): Disappointing! I love brussels sprouts, and these were just ok. They were a little underseasoned and not quite crispy enough. Skip. -Strawberry Cake (yelp.com/biz_photos/park…): Yum! This cake was delicious, and not too sweet. I loved how fluffy the cake was, and that you could taste the fresh strawberry in the frosting. Recommended. Overall, I loved my dining experience at Park Tavern although there were some misses. Service was on par, and the kitchen was efficient. I also loved the decor and ambience here, and will definitely be back for another meal (and more deviled eggs) in the future! The biggest negative about dining here is the parking- it can take a while since this area gets so busy!

_UMTGara5YnzRIey3Mva0Q.review_text: Fantastic place for brunch.  A bit heavy for me but they do so many things well here.  I had some fantastic poached eggs on toast, lux with a bearnaise sauce, and some terrific no frills toast.  All of the little details were tended to, including the complexity of flavors, variety of textures, and the warm with the cold.    Really quite terrific - as was the service.  My only "greivance" was that things were a bit on the heavy side, but that is a matter of personal preference I think.  Best of all, go take a stroll in the park across the street afterwards.

tivjnYkzwESsyRkYQ_R2LQ.review_text: Brunch is great! I love the location and interior. The boozy smoothie is dangerously tasty.

-8ZM-jzJEGkKCxYEJnFrqQ.review_text: Office Holiday party at PT tonight-divine. We had "The Cafe", i.e.the front part of the main dining room up against the windows overlooking Washington Square Park. SO fun- you're still in the mix w/ the rest of the restaurant, but it feels like a private space.  Alicja helped me set everything up, and Brian and crew ruled as servers, keeping the wine/cocktails flowing and being super attentive w/out bugging.  The food!!! Standouts were burrata on lemon chips w/pea tendrils, (duh) Brussels sprout chips, (duh again) deviled eggs, poulet rouge and sliced filet in red wine jus. They even did a couple of vegan/gluten free platters for the "special" people in my crew which were delicious and much appreciated.  A total success- Thank You PT!!!!!!

WF1o6AyXm6-NovD5dFnMOg.review_text: It has always been, and will always be, what's inside that counts.  While the space remains relatively the same, the heart and soul of this Washington Square location has been masterfully rewritten by Jennifer Puccio and the leadership of one of SF's best, Anna Weinberg.  Park Tavern is a sweeping space, with a penchant for details hidden under the history of a storied block.   There is a caffeine like energy which adds springs to conversations, and a charming glow that sets the very diners visiting at the core of it's design. Genuine, heart felt and hungry.   Our group began with a special unlike anything I've ever experienced. While fries may not seem extraordinary, the imagination of Puccio delivered.   Truffle fries nested on a plate, accompanied by a 3/4 eggshell which contained a creamy yolk crème topped off with caviar. The rich gravy coated each fry with a decadent cloak, which was only elevated by the delicate black ornaments of caviar.  Ketchup just lost the rose ceremony...  The house made charcurterie plate was a brilliant display of craft, and the duck liver crostini was a marvel. If you didn't feel guilty, you weren't enjoying it.  The grilled pork chop with dinosaur kale and toasted garlic served as the entree.  Fork to protein brittle, and matched with timed seasoning, the pork is a hit. Every note was selected with purpose, and the dish proved itself a phenomenal keeper.  Park Tavern is a mature adoption of another of my Weinberg favorites, Marlowe, and if this type of re-imagining continues, Anna might just have to run for Mayor.  Bravo.

lO6oTv2L6ULONmYXZ4JFyg.review_text: Absolutely delicious brunch. I had the crispy polenta and poached egg, although I have to say the banana fritters the table ordered were the standout. WHAT is in that chocolate/coffee/amazingness sauce? Bloody Mary as good but Very smoky in flavor. The only reason the review is not 5 stars is that the burger my bestie ordered, while highly praised, was maybe too much so? Didn't find it to be one of the best burgers I've tried.  Great service, we lingered over our food and drinks for quite a while!

raCKh2I0F-41J5U0OBZz3Q.review_text: Love, love, love!  I have never been so full in my life!  I think we ordered one of everything and I ate it all!  Deviled eggs, beef jerky, brussel sprout chips, steak crudo, Demons on horseback, Chicken entree...a minute on my lips, a lifetime on my hips.  It was worth it!   Until next time Park Tavern!  Anna Weinberg and her team nailed it!

Z3VnjFiTyR1bhBZaG61M7w.review_text: The place was loud and busy in a good way.  I had a couple deviled eggs, an awesome blue cheese salad and the best poultry dish I have ever had.  The stuffing that was part of the roasted hen was the best I have had in my life.  No more stuffing just for Thanksgiving.  Also- how cool to be right in the middle of North Beach looking at a stunning church and park.  My wife and I stayed in the Financial District and it was a great walk to Park Tavern.

6pQx_QRn6gaKelu3ZRGg9g.review_text: PARK TAVERN on Washington Square in North Beach is *phenomenal*. I treated 2 of my Real Estate home-buyer clients to dinner there last night & WOW! We sat at the bar & totally enjoyed their cocktails, the ambiance, the vibe, their service; their fun, smart & generous bartenders; and THE FOOD!   Between the 3 of us, we probably tried about 6 different cocktails, which were all incredible (with fresh ingredients & all). Their wine list was awesome as well & they serve ACME bread to boot!   We shared the following: Fried oysters w/lettuce wraps; prawns wrapped in lardo w/buttermilk & cucumbers; salmon appetizer w/beets (that was too dainty & the beets were over powering, IMHO! That's the only thing I would skip next time!); cornish game hen with spinach & the smoked deviled eggs.   WOWZA! It was an epic meal. If you go there, ENJOY IT! It is a fine establishment :o)

sahf-f3NKrgWCL9NbpURSg.review_text: Simply delicious! The place has great ambiance and the food was outstanding! The brussel sprout chips are a must !!!!

yA7t1I5Z7-GcJX7NgkgwoA.review_text: Ed and Mary Etta Moose made Washington Square Park the cradle of civilization in North Beach starting in the early 1970's when they brought us The Washington Square Bar & Grill on Powell at Union and later at Moose's across the Park.  Each was a landmark destination that became the hub or portal that unified San Franciscans in dialogue and spirited collaboration that enriched and never eroded the quality of life and spirit in 'The City That Knows How".  I loved Park Tavern before I nibbled a single bite for the tribute table honoring Mary Etta Moose, the artist, gourmand, philanthropist and spirited voice of beautiful North Beach, the community.  I haven't tried the much of the menu yet, but I can attest to the quality and scrumptiousness of their burger, my heart's true calling.  I first tried Marlowe's after it first opened and loved it, especially the burger and fries.  Kinship to Marlowe's becomes harder to see the deeper you explore the eclectic, electric and exciting menu, and the more you take in the design that marry's so many warm and comfortable elements, remembered and wanted, that simply aren't in evidence elsewhere in the city.  The place is crowded like Moose's was, and the crowd is a melting pot like Moose's so it's got the feel of a place you want to be a regular at and be known by name and your unique peculiarities by the staff and your fellow regulars.  Former Mayor Brown has dubbed the place a success and a must stop on his weekly rounds, so maybe it arrived before the delivery.  The exposed kitchen that Ed and Mary Etta created is spiffed up and is the anchoring element of the well executed restaurant.  It's amazing how good the 'bones' of Moose's remain, because I still feel Ed's warmth and big personality greeting one and all in the space he so lovingly created.  I said the menu is exciting and that may be an understatement because although the focus appears to be on small plates and the unusual, the food is stylish and uber sophisticated.  It's also a little on the pricy side, but that isn't hindering anyone from making their way here and back so I'd say they're doing a lot of things right and their customers think so too.  The bar is wonderful and drinks are inspired and delicious, the staff are well trained and well chosen.  Beer and Wine lists are well thought out, and the whole place is clean and inviting, masculine and powerful, a real testament to North Beach and Ed Moose, this place is a compelling winner.

VjUuaL2A0QwrRZ8hDdFf7Q.review_text: for dinner get: -any of their special cocktails -deviled eggs -waldorf salad (made with housemade pickle juice) -chicken (comes out standing up, so not for the fowl queasy)  for brunch get: pancakes (amazing and fluffy, with syrup already in the batter) any of the special toasts (they are small, so not a meal portion) latte (comes in a cozy le creuset mug)  can't wait to go back.  everything i've tried there is delicious.

gurcmVDESVQ8X20xpw4btw.review_text: Good spot.   I had brunch, which was pretty good. They have a seasonal menu, and I got CAST IRON-BAKED FARM EGGS* | sautéed baby spinach, jamón serrano & Gruyère cheese. It was pretty good, but I was pretty surprise how little ham there was, given it was $15.    I like the atmosphere - very new york. The service was good.

5y__2IeIv48Wu5ZhjkFEnw.review_text: The food is delicious, the room has a wonderful ambience and the staff are warm & friendly. I love this place!

rxjfzltPpEETvgkMfbnmmQ.review_text: Excellent drinks, food, and service for brunch. If you are looking for a stylish place that is worth the money, look no further than Park Tavern!

4BzhqM510yAB_DoEth3i6w.review_text: It's always in the girls' bathroom where you get good intel on a place.  I was supposed to come here with my brother and some guy pitching to sell something.  The guy pitching bailed (hey, he's selling) and my bro and I went on to have dinner here anyway, then drinks.  The place is cavernous.  It's not an intimate sotto voce place either for dinner or drinks.  The seating is neither family style or intimate. Even in the bar area.  There's diners and drinkers but no one feels cared for.   Essentially, you feel uncomfortable in either space.    It could be the seating, it could be the service or even the meh food.  Like the other Yelpers, and the lady in the loo, she said service is uneven, food is ok, head to cocktails.  haha she's pretty on.  What's cool about this place?  It's really big, there's an outdoor part so if the weather's nice can do a sidewalk al fresco.    Would I come back, sure, but it's not a place I would say hey babe rock my boat bring me to Park Tavern.

2tBSP7pVfKkaEPkGiyx7Nw.review_text: 2nd time here on Friday night. Cannot go wrong with this place. Absolutely love their brussel sprout chips, I always order them.   Probably the best deviled egg I've ever had... will be thinking about that one for a while.  This time I got their Country Line Harvest salad (LOVED the dressing) and leek and broccoli soup. The soup was wonderfully flavored and had depth, but I wish there was more texture - it was almost like water, although it tasted amazing (the lardons did add a nice touch, but you only get 1 every few bites b/c of the quantity... which is enough, but that leaves the rest of the spoonfuls too liquid-y)!

dsLcIPxIow1TTayuHag0Qg.review_text: I have always had a great time, solid service and tasty food at Park Tavern. I went recently for brunch an really enjoyed our selections and lively vibe. Because it's a bigger spot, it's relatively easy to get a rezo or walk-in, which has made it my go-to spot for entertaining parents and out of town guests.

-d7rr26QfWx__n_963G55w.review_text: I am still full from my meal at Park Tavern yesterday night. This is slightly uncomfortable, but I will chalk it up to the fact that I couldn't stop eating despite that my body was definitely telling me that my stomach was already too full to go on.  What's to love about Park Tavern: - Lovely decor and great location central to North Beach and across from Washington Square Park - Hostess was super friendly, which is so important as they make the first impression. I mixed up the dates for my reservation and came in on the wrong date (seriously, this is the only time this has ever happened to me!) and the hostess was able to accommodate us on a friday night. THANK YOU!  - Since we were sharing the two entrees that we ordered, the server offered to split them up for us, which honestly never happens as an offer from other restaurants.  - We had been waiting for a while on the Marlowe burger and our server came over to us to tell us he had checked on it and it was being plated. Thanks for taking the initiative.  - Grilled pork chop was absolutely amazing! Wish it had more yellow peaches though.  - They have cocktails named for SF landmarks. Love love love.   Now the not so great things: - WOW parking is so terrible around here. They do have valet ($11), so use it if you are terrible at finding parking or just take MUNI.   - Had high expectations for the Marlowe burger and only thought it was OK. Not a burger to write home about  I would highly recommend this restaurant. Next time, I'll have to try more of the items from the smoked/cured/fried sections. I can't believe I didn't order the deviled eggs!

I9wjC0MrCfMbnXYwYvXCDw.review_text: Outstanding!  My first visit was a big disappointed, but the second time around, everything was great.  In fact, we went back because the management responded so positively after reading my review of the first time.  This time couldn't have been more different.  The corn soup was really special, the scallops were excellent and the July birthday cake was delicious.  Having said that, the real difference was the service, Andrew was an outstanding server, really knows his stuff.  We'll definitely go back time-and-time again.

wN4gFGx3srNtWU-DXvZG7Q.review_text: This review is just for the EDEN LOUNGE upstairs. What a cool find this was! We walked in without a dinner reservation & of course, couldnt get seated right away. But we were directed to the lounge upstairs, which was really cozy, had a swanky feel & you could order some of the appetizers & the burger (which is really what we came for) while having your cocktail. The room is really cool, with plump, velvet tufted or leather seats and a vintage feel. I felt bad for the ONE bartender who was trying to mix drinks AND serve them at the seats, as they were short staffed. But if you are in the area, stop by. Its cool way to start or end your night, and you will feel like you know a secret bar in town.

CE3mnynRwFdaVAARGZYFhA.review_text: What a great addition to the neighborhood!  I was excited to try this place and was not disappointed.    We arrived on time for our reservation on Friday night and were seated immediately.  Plus one!  I was starting to think the idea of being seated on time at a popular restaurant was a thing of the past.  The restaurant was nicely decorated for Christmas with white lights and a nice Christmas tree.  We were seated in the window area, a very pleasant section with views both outside to the park and into the restaurant. The tables were a little close together but with enough aisle space that it didn't feel crowded.  With a full house of large and small tables happy pre-holiday diners, the noise level was a bit high at first, but the overall atmosphere was so nice, we wouldn't let this keep us from returning.  Service was warm, efficient and knowledgeable.  The menu is varied and interesting. We enjoyed everything we ordered:  duck liver crostini arugula salad with mushrooms - unusual and very tasty pork chop with kale and butter beans scallops with cauliflower puree and braised fennel twice-baked potato  - so yummy with a lovely scallion flavor  There's a very nice selection of wines by the glass and the servings are very generous.  As a non-meat eater, I'd like to see a few more seafood and vegetable options on the menu.  Without even a vegetarian dinner option, a vegetarian would have a hard time ordering a meal here.  EDIT: I'm bumping my rating from 4 to 5 stars in response to the restaurant's decision to remove the "healthy SF" surcharge. This bugs me EVERY TIME I see it on a bill. It's as if the owners are saying, "I'll give my employees health care...but I really don't want to."  Owner Anna Weinberg said  "The way I saw it is that it's just become a cost of doing business, so you adjust your prices just like you do if your rent goes up."   EXACTLY.

eyQBhTuI-Tu5mMI0Jl3mpg.review_text: AMAZING. The 3 variations of duck dish is HIGHLY reccomended. I really, really like duck. This rich dish is served with duck liver pate, duck confit, crispy duck skin pieces and duck breast. There are fava beans and mushrooms as the vegetable, which complimented the richness of the duck very well.  Each type of duck was cooked perfectly and so full of flavor. I will definitely go back. We also had the fried baby artichokes as appetizer, which was great, too. Not overly heavy and served with a tasty aoli. Very good food, highly reccomend.

0R1_kP_d8CfS4JX6uyMNsw.review_text: I think we've eating at a ton of top SF restaurants including Gary Danko and the like. This restaurant rates one of the best of SF in my opinion. We had the deviled eggs, smoked crab dip, truffle fries, lobster bisque and the pork chop between my husband and I. Every bite was quite orgasmic in its own sense. The eggs were the perfect balance between creamy with a pickled pepper and a cilantro sauce. (better than Wayfarer Tavern). The smoked crab dip was plentiful and had a great smokiness top with Ikura. The truffles fried were seriously amazing. Shaved truffle, white truffle aioli, then a soft boiled egg with osetra caviar... Can it be any better? Then the lobster bisque was explosive with flavor not with too much cream. It came with a perfect bread pastry stick that made it almost too rich, but really it was perfect.then we had the pork chop which was brined then grilled. This was 3 stars in my book bc it leaned on the salty side and the polenta was overly creamy. I needed something to cut the richness.  The birthday cake was probably the least exciting. But it was birthday cake. Overall we loved our experience here an would come back!

_HmVfjZizikfli0zzBd2vg.review_text: Great take on a spot that was always so busy.  The new food and the folks running this new up and comer, got it going on.   Fried pork belly was phenomenal.  Fried Caesar oysters were also phenomenal.  Raw meat with capers and Hawaiin pink salt was THE best carpaccio style dish my palate has ever had.  I had more but let me not bore you with my yelping, just go and be adventurous!

-qzaZXvbYU_EkAIdJyFZCg.review_text: Maybe I built up the how amazing the food was going to be, but found the whole dining experience to be a bust. Our waiter flat out stunk...ignored our table for the first 20 plus minutes and then for the rest of the evening seemed to be rushing us out of there. I was so excited for the deviled eggs but what a disappointment, I've had better store- bought deviled eggs. The lemon chips and burrata were decent, but not the most tasty burrata I've had. My pork chop was pretty yummy, but again not something I'd rave or crave to go back for.  My friends who had the Poulet chicken were disappointed as well.  One of them claimed the rotisserie chicken you can buy from Costco is moister and tastier (ouch).  The warm bread was delicious (redeeming quality??) but overall a very disappointing experience.  Perhaps it was just an off night, but definitely won't be clamoring to return anytime soon.  Oh, and don't even get me started on the fact a man had his little dog crawling all over the booth the next table over....really?

_kzBE3008uec0PZJsXr1vA.review_text: Love!  Love!  Love!  A bit of a similar feel but soooo much better food (and pricepoint!) than 25 Lusk.   Great place to hang at the bar and eat at the bar community table.   Also, a dining are, but that wouldn't be my "go to" at this locale.  Food was off the hook.  Fried brussell sprout chips (not healthy, but super tasty).  amazing burrata cheese on some crispy crunchy fried lemon rinds with basil, good mussels, and the best part of the meal?  Heirloom carrots....for real!  Ridiculous combination of pickled, heirloom carrots, some pesto and pine nuts.  Seriously, the carrots were over the top.  Staff?  Super helpful, friendly, yet professional.  Great suggestions.  Great service, even at the community table in the bar.  My new go to.  GFs.  Couples.  Date Search.  Awesome food and drink.  Please do well and STAY PT!

SpZKwS5w3ZxiuB1s58DYSA.review_text: The saying goes that the way to a man's heart is through his stomach. What about the women? Being from a foodie town, not just any food in my stomach will do to reach my heart. The secret is to mention french fries; there's just something about potatoes fried to a golden crisp.   Park Tavern had me at PT fries, more specifically fries with truffle oil, soft-cooked egg, and caviar. I chose this restaurant for my friend's birthday celebration based solely upon that description for fries. I was pleasantly surprised that everything else we ordered was just as good, albeit nothing can take the place of the french fries.   (1) Lemon chips: Burrata has never done me wrong and did not this evening. (2) PT fries: Can you say food-gasm? (3) Marlowe burger: The burger is melt in your mouth good. The only thing that can make it better is bacon and low and behold, bacon is part of the burger. My tip is that you ask for the sauce that goes with the PT fries for the fries that come with the burger. You can thank me later. (4) Ribeye: Delicious meaty goodness with some veggies to "balance" out the gluttony thus far. (5) Chocolate creme brûlée: The only item we ordered that was average. It tasted more like a pot de creme but I can't knock the restaurant for one item. (6) June "birthday" cake: Sizable portion that we devoured despite being full. This only helps to prove the theory that people have a second stomach for dessert.   Reservations recommended and try to book earlier rather than later. We were famished as we waited for 9:45 pm to roll around because that was the only time slot I could reserve.  Parking is a pain but I'm willing to sacrifice the money to pay for lot parking in order to get the fries.

OHcjD-t24-PDz9B2jO8dGg.review_text: Great brunch spot. Great ambience (we sat at the bar) and decor inside.  Friendly and courteous staff. Food was great along with drink options. The avocado toast is really tasty as an app. The brioche French toast was awesome. Good brunch options wish there was one or two more vegetarian ones but fellow vegetarians can get along just fine going here.  For drinks the unique cocktails are definitely great to have.  It's a little more of an expensive place but I'd say worth it for out of towers or once in awhile (unless you're rolling on $$)
