Venison Carpaccio with angus beef tartar and crispy bone marrow-I wasn't sure about eating raw venison, but it was very fresh and good flavors. The beef tartar was excellent. Very well seasoned. They give you little bite size fried bone marrow. That just hit the spot!  Scallops w/ tempura mushrooms-delish. They give you about 6 to 8 pieces. Perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Steak-now this is what a steak is suppose to look like. Not no cold chewy messed up meat (See Radius review). N.Y steak that was prefectly cooked. 2 square pieces that had so much flavor and it melts in your mouth. Came with kobe beef stuffed bone marrow. That was amazing. It was like beef jerky! There was a big crispy potato and even mash potatos. The broccolini was a good touch to all that meat. DROOL!!!

oS1JQuHxiT4YZWsBGm5l7g.review_text: Pros: Excellent food & great service! The PT fries are a MUST! Cons: Gets crowded fast & is loud! Be prepared to spend some cash because this place isn't cheap. Two drinks + two appetizers = $75 eek! Still worth it for the overall experience!

DHzlTXnRLSk__MrWbwKJ6Q.review_text: You probably can't go wrong with anything that you order at this place. Everything on their brunch menu is delicious, but I particularly recommend their avocado toast and buttermilk pancakes. Good food, good ambience, good service, what more is there to ask for?   However, one thing that I would recommend is to not get their drip coffee, which is mediocre compared to the rest of their food. Other than that, best brunch in the SF Bay Area, for sure.

RaSq7WPbxH7Dm5yfVBAgYw.review_text: I'm so happy my friend moved into the neighborhood and introduced us to this place. They couldn't fit us in for an earlier dinner, but we did get seats at the common table. We first started with the devil eggs and the reviews are right. They're just so simple, but so delicious and fluffy! Oh, did I tell you there is a little present on top.. a crispy bacon. Yea, now you want to run there and grab some too right?!?!  My seared black cod was super delicious, cooked just right where the meat stayed together but was fork tender. It was pretty funny how the restaurant had 2 sets of customers. The older crowd seated in the dining area and the younger crowd hanging around the common table and bar. This place is enjoyed by all ages.

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: Nothing brings a smile to my face more than good food, fabulous cocktails and friendly bartenders.  Walking home the other day from work on a bright and sunny day I realized as I passed Park Tavern I had yet to be in to the highly acclaimed "new" spot in the hood. I felt like a disgraced North Beacher thinking that I hadn't made my rounds to one of the newest editions in the hood. So I stopped, turned around and walked inside.   The bar is well lit but not overly bright, with just enough mood lighting to make any drink look sexy. Though small in size, I was able to navigate the area and find a stool right up front in the heat of the action (just the way I like it) and upon touchdown met two of the nicest bartenders I've ever encountered. Upon their recommendations I started with the Brussel Sprout Chips (to die for!), the deviled eggs (even better!) and ended with the beef tartar (holy cow, blew my mind away fantastic). Washed all down with the Country Lawyer and I do believe you've made me a loyal fan.  Thanks gentlemen for the lovely evening...

45DhrSxqQRUDdnxlECPDYQ.review_text: Contrary to most of the reviews here, the service here was impeccable.  Everyone from the maitre'd to the waiter to the busboy to the water guy were 100% awesome.  They made me and my pregnant wife feel welcome and happy.  I honestly could not have asked for a more pleasant service experience at a restaurant.  The waiter even knew what my wife could and could not eat being pregnant.  Wow!  Also the ambiance is beautiful with big wood beams stretching across the main dining area, and big windows overlooking Washington Square Park.  Admittedly it doesn't get much better than that.  The food, on the other hand, was fair..about the same as sister restaurant Marlowe..overrated, and just on the border of being reasonably priced for the neighborhood... but at least the menu was more diverse.  I would say maybe we ordered the wrong things, but given that one of us at the table was pregnant, we basically ordered everything.    The brussel sprout chips a la Marlowe are the same, crispy at the top, oily on the bottom.  The clam fritters were more fritter than clam, though the corn salad, fresh corn hushpuppies and grilled avocados that came with the clams were AWESOME.  The sardine toast was ok...good portion and a good balance of salty, sweet, and umami flavors.  A little sweet for my taste, but my wife thought they were the bee's knees! The squash blossom salad was ok, though the ricotta stuffed squash blossoms were fried to the point that i didn't actually recognize or taste the squash.    As for the main course, I had the seafood soup which was really disappointing.  All the seafood in it (literally everything) was overdone and a bit rubbery.  The soup itself was overly vinegary.  My wife loved the corn soup.    As for dessert, we got the coconut birthday cake and the almond pear crumble with cinnamon ice cream.  Nothing worth noting aside from the cinnamon ice cream being so cinnamon-y it blew out my taste buds for everything else.    I would try it again, if only for the great service...and hope that maybe it was an off night....

Te18TxvzfLomGE56N7s3Dw.review_text: It's been a couple years since I been to Park Tavern and this time we decided to take our mom here for her birthday.  Atmosphere was excellent especially on the night we came which was a warm, bright summer night where Washington Square was bustling.  We ordered a variety of appetizers ranging from gnocchi, carrot salad, corn soup, PT fries, fruit de mers, and demons on horseback.  Overall the appetizers were good and probably worthy of coming back for.  For entree, fish, poulet noir, pork chop, burger and duck.  The portion on the duck was small and my brother said it was on the salty side.  My dad's pork chop wasn't good, he left half of it on the plate.  The fish, I forgot what kind of fish, was decent but on the salty side.  The burger which is supposedly the best burger in town is not the best burger in town.  What was most disappointing were the fries that came on the side.  There were probably twelve pieces of fries, as if half the order was missing.  The poulet noir, had a good truffle aroma but that's about it.  It's a small piece of chicken, the greens on the bottom were swimming in oil which isn't exactly enticing.  We ordered the birthday cake since it was my mom's birthday and let's just say we were glad that wasn't our actual birthday cake.  When the bill came, we noticed a bottle of wine for $42 which we didn't order.  The waiter apologized and said he gave us the wrong bill but you know what, everything that was on bill was ours except for the bottle of wine.  I don't know if he was trying to pull a fast one or made a mistake but that was definitely our bill unless another table had exactly the same things we had which seems unlikely.    I would say it was somewhat of an average experience.  I want our mom's birthday dinner to be great but it was well short of that.  We asked for more bread plates since they took ours away and they never came back with it.  It seemed the dishes came out quickly, maybe a bit too quickly.  I may come back for the PT fries but that's about it.

apX-FaMlzeBDx38Tba2nUw.review_text: Very elegant and relaxing. Great brunch. Great coffee. Great company (well, you need to bring your own). Go on Sunday. This Sunday!

rBRuie_HNzxCkMDF-ooRog.review_text: Last night I was a bit disappointed. Overall I still love the ambiance & decor as well as the fabulous service... But everything was so salty. I had the arugula salad and their special: grilled seafood- scallops & calamari... Both dishes were super salty. I was too lazy or too hungry to complain since it was getting late...  So unfortunately I doubt I will come back here to eat... perhaps if I do, it would only be to meet friends for drinks.

SosdikqVEAr_6daB2AXTHg.review_text: Ok we went for Sunday dinner, took our 7 and 9 year old (they eat at places like this a lot-but would not necessarily say kid friendly). Usually the only problem with taking our kids is not the kids but the restaurants assumption about kids- some places stick us at cruddy tables, ignore us (assuming low check) that kind if thing! Park Tavern was absolutely 1st class from the minute we walked in! The hosts were kind and accommodating  from the get-go. Out waiter Hudson was awesome, friendly-attentive and patient with the kids (we like them to ask questions and order for themselves). The manager, Steven...checked on us throughout the night...and was also very friendly, accommodating and seemed pleased we were there!  We will be back many many times-oh and the food!!! OMG OMG! Brussel sprout chips, mussels, burger, pork chop, deviled eggs, wagu jerky, And prawns....everything was better than GOOD, and the wine was superb! Can't thank Hudson, Steven and all of the staff for making ALL if us feel welcome, comfortable and appreciated!

bipt_HtYaR1AakTp1pooDQ.review_text: Pros: Creative dishes Delicious Healthy Options Excellent service (friendly and fast)  Cons: Bring a large wallet  +1 for chef creativity. There are lots of delicious new dishes that you absolutely have to try.   Brussel sprout chips?!?! aaaaamazing!, who makes chips out of brussel sprouts  Lemon chips, burrata, & Shelley's fennel - This could turn a caveman into a vegetarian. Soft fennel on a crispy lemon chip with a creamy sauce to top it all off.  Steamed muscles we're good.... I dig I guess

vk8HtsKI1QP9XjobjMZq8Q.review_text: Nice setting, tough acoustics for conversation and surprisingly tiny portions.  Been to Park Tavern about ten times and I've noticed a slight downward regression in both the service and food quality.  It's disappointing too because the setting is really nice and the vibe usually quite good.  I hosted a business dinner there last night for six people and for 700 bucks we ended up all sharing two pizzas a few hours later.  The lamb and steak entrees are inexcusably small for their 38 and 40 price tags.  Maybe the lamb portion was four ounces, maybe.  There's really no excuse for this other than the restaurant trying to goose its margin.  I think the only item we all really enjoyed was the deviled eggs which are a treat.  The sardines were mediocre, as was the shrimp appetizer.   The service was also average -- not bad, but not great either.  The staff generally seems disinterested since they take for granted that they'll be busy every night.  Nothing to overtly complain about but the service definitely wouldn't fly in a xl parable restaurant in NYC.  That's for sure.  All in all, I think I am moving on from Park Tavern.

-ZFmimD5lEp2UU2RMFhf-w.review_text: We live in the neighborhood and have been to Park Tavern several times. In fact, the prior meal was quite good. Today, we took a friend, who happens to be gluten-intolerant , for brunch. He asked the waitress for a vegetable -  a stalk of celery or a couple of slices of cucumber - on which to spread the $8 jam course, which we ordered in addition to 4 small courses and 4 large ones, as well as to a round of drinks. She complied, but then without stating that there would be an extra charge for a few slices of cucumber, placed a $3 charge on the tab. We did not mind the charge as much as the absurdity of it, and the fact that it was not communicated. The manager came over to check on things after the meal, and after we calmly explained all - including the fact that we are locals - she stated that it was policy and that we had to understand that the restaurant had "very high food costs". Not the right answer, and clearly a missed opportunity to buy us a cup of coffee.

LDWu5Z2QUdTT9mCux41Cxw.review_text: Best restaurant in town!  Favorite dish was the Brussels sprouts, but really everything was amazing.  Very good wine list.  Incredibly attentive staff, the chef even came out to make sure everyone was enjoying the food.

RlkPyMrAnKZNiH6-h2CYIQ.review_text: Great brunch spot! Loved the detailing in their decor and the overall ambience. The food was excellent - we tried the avocado toast, the chorizo and eggs, the corned hash, and the grapefruit mimosas. Everything was excellent. The chorizo was flavorful but not too spicy. The hash was so tasty and cooked to perfection. The mimosas were unique and very good. The avocado toast was simple and light, absolutely delicious. We would definitely return and recommend to anyone. A little pricey ($150 for 4 people, but this included multiple rounds of drinks).

li0Hwxz08hpK81Z7eH1YvA.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
li0Hwxz08hpK81Z7eH1YvA.review_text: The appetizers were great! The entrees were so-so. We got the crispy brussels sprouts, the demons on horseback, and a deviled egg each. yum. All 3 entrees were just so-so after those amazing appetizers. The dessert was also... eh. We shared a peach cobbler thing.   I would go back! I have a feeling they're usually better than that! (and I live two blocks away)

VZk50D-KG4_R_4765VMYZQ.review_text: I love to sit at the bar, just get there early. Cocktails are a little pricey but they are done well. I have had most items on the menu throughout the seasons. I have never been let down. The staff is always helpful and no matter who comes to your table they are pleasant and kind. From appetizers to entrees the portions are good size. The food is prepared to your liking and quite delicious. Great for all times of year.

Vp11x2FIQxGyI7tW8-M2mQ.review_text: Food was good, nice ambiance and the service was good. Comparable to a lot of the better brunch places in the city.

cbehkbJXi_sauQbjco9iaw.review_text: I have only been here for brunch twice but both times were great. The Cast Iron egg dish is really tasty; so is the avocado toast and crispy polenta cakes. The drinks are also pretty good...a great bloody mary to go with the delicious food!  I want to try it for dinner soon as well based on all the other high rated dishes.

RlpHzq3cHW6M_Y6VB4S0GQ.review_text: Great restaurant! It's consistently good and I always leave happy. I've had brunch and dinner here and love both.   The brunch polenta cakes are divine. Talk a out yum. For dinner, I've tried a bit of almost everything at this point and really enjoy it all. Even the burger is awesome. One thing I really love are the mussels! It comes with garlicky bread to sop up the glorious broth. I'm getting hungry just writing this...

KZqTYmDjqEk1J7dfHPQ3wA.review_text: AMAZING! Really that about sums it up. The food is just fabulous! The service was phenominal as well. Its quite busy on the weekends so may not be the best spot for a quiet, intimate lunch but as far as quality and a fantastic experience....this is the spot.

kM_KaASXXyohy5fNbqJmvg.review_text: This place is happening! All smiles, fun vibe, happy staff, and just GREAT eats! The newly opened Eden Lounge upstairs is perfect. Have dined here several times now, and it's always been great. They have also hosted a couple of charity events, which speaks volumes to me...and not just because they served their tasty morsels.  Oh, and along with Boulette, one of my favorite brunches in SF.  Best bloody Mary in town.

-l-TorsR28LHE40duDEGKg.review_text: I'm gonna go with 4 stars because overall, our meal and experience were positive and I think its a solid restaurant.  But I'm going to spend the rest of my review with nit-picky criticisms because I thought this place could be a 5 star.  Overall, my husband and I left saying that we would have rather eaten at Absinthe.  I think the comparison came from the fact that they're both "California-French bistros" in both look and menu.  But PT, because of its size (not terribly cozy) and a couple of flaws, came in second place for us.  Let's eat, shall we?  Deviled eggs:  Yep, these are pretty f*cking delicious.  Zero complaints here except that our dinner kind of peaked too early.  Lemon chips with burrata:  I defended this dish not because it blew my socks off flavorwise but because I've never had anything like it.  Its very light and perhaps not the best pairing with the deviled egg-flavor bombs.  Brussel sprout chips:  Solid.    Crab and lobster bisque:  The first 3 bites of this soup were orgasmic.  The remainder was more of a struggle-- its a VERY rich, flavorful soup.  I literally don't think I could finish this bowl on my own.    Rabbit and lardo terrine:  At first too simple, but actually when you mix all the components on the dish (er, slab of slate)-- mustard and spicy arugula-- it elevated it.  I could have used some kind of a cracker type thing to go with.  "Marlowe" burger:  This is where you really lost us, PT.  THE BUN WAS NOT GOOD.  Like, really, I'm not even being picky.  Its just a bad bun.  Crumbly and dry with no give, it really ruined the burger.  My husband has had the Marlowe at Marlowe and he says their bun was 100x better.  The burger was good but I couldn't tell because I was so angered by the bun.  The fries on the other hand, made me very happy.  May birthday cake (cappuccino): Tasted like refrigerator.  Kind of like, supermarket cake with half the sugar and better frosting.  Love the idea though!  Next time, if there is one, I want to eat 4 deviled eggs and those $20 french fries.

yGgkt0WGJ3P1MDn0eZSTWA.review_text: A bigger better version of its sister (parent really) restaurant in SoMa. Wider variety of fare and an excellent staff. Also, they seemed to have solved the Marlowe salinity crisis. If you're looking for something more casual than Spruce it's a great option.

B5qFPcKFftO0gONPfjZsZQ.review_text: Ok, I'll just jump right in with the 3 reasons this place is 3-stars in my book.  1) I understand that saturday nights are busy but if you can't provide excellent service to each person you seat, I strongly suggest you put a cap of the number of people allowed in the restaurant. The only reason I remember our waiter is because he kind of looked like Mark Zuckerberg, but I don't remember his name because he never introduced himself and only came back to take our order and ask us if we wanted more booze, in passing like he couldn't even make a full stop. For real?  2) Can you say pretentious? I did about 12 times while seated on the patio watching the other patrons arrive in their maserati's wearing micro mini skirts and bandeau tops grasping the shoulders of the people they were meeting and pulling them in for air kisses saying "bisoux bisoux!" I kid you not. This ain't Beverly Hills, lady, take a pill.  3) The food was honestly nothing to write home about. I don't know if it had to do with the rush the kitchen was in, but my pan-seared sole looked great and the fish itself was cooked well, but the flavor was just not hitting the mark for me. The veggies that came on the plate were good, but the sauce tasted like whipped mustardy hollandaise and mayo and I ended up avoiding it a little. The BFs roasted halibut was much better, but made me realize that maybe we're very gifted chefs, as it wasn't in any way better than what we make at home. I think it would have been more enjoyable served on top of a warm salad, and once again, the sauce was a little mustardy or tart, why? The PT fries were very good, the caviar in a soft boiled egg is an idea that we will be using but the horseradish mayo, while cost effective for the kitchen I'm sure, was unoriginal and not particularly enjoyable. My etta's bubbles cocktail was delicious, and paired pretty well with my meal, good job bartender person.  While the flame of my love for this place's brunch menu burns on, I will avoid dinner hour here because it turns into a "see and be seen" reality tv sideshow, instead of the upscale but laid back place to get a good meal and take in little Italy, that I described to the BF to get him to give park tavern a try. Overall I think the service and food suffered from a focus on quantity over quality and crowd was too "chic" to notice, or maybe didn't care. But we found ourselves disillusioned by the experience :/ Oh well...

WDC4TpjyH_HYQpy85R6OpQ.review_text: To begin with  food at PT is OK: some dishes can be a total blah, smoked bacon flavor gets boring after a while but overall food is decent. This review, however, is about service, attitude and integrity of those who served us. We intentionally came in about 45 minutes before our reservations and set in the bar area relaxing, waiting for our table, having drinks. We ordered specifically Ketel One Vodka martini. When the martini arrived it was not Kettle One. We did not make a big deal about it but for the next round we insisted on Ketel One. Waitress assured us she will get that drink right and that she placed the order for Kettle One. She went to the bar, talked to the bartender, he took a bottle of Gray Goose made two drinks in a shaker and served us one of the two. WFT? We saw the whole thing and at this point returned the drink back. Did we get a cheerful apology from the bartender? No way! Instead we got a really watered down Ketel One martini with attitude.  Our table was ready only 30 minutes after the time of reservations. When we got to the table our new waitress told us that to comp for the wait she liked to offer us free Brussels sprouts appetizer ($9). We then went to order two more appetizers and a whole chicken ($15+9+28 + 3 martinis +$20 wine). We never tip less than 20% and you would think we spent enough money so that there would not be a need to scheme us for $9 bucks?  But when the bill arrived the Brussels sprouts app was included. We pointed that out to the waitress and in ONE second she produced a copy of the correct bill. Wow! So this was actually planned? I had many dinners at PT but mainly in the bar area. Never had I experienced this shameless petty scheming and F+++U attitude. Bar scene is fun and sharing a dish in the bar area is OK, but a sit down dinner here again: I'd be worried.

wPfO0bhqtn-20K79nUICTA.review_text: I have had dinner here once and brunch twice. I have tried just about everything from the avocado toast to the burger and so far I have yet to be disappointed. The cocktails and desserts are equally as good.   A couple things you need to know before you go. Parking is nearly impossible but they do have valet. I really recommend just paying the $12 and valeting your car instead of circling for an hour. You also really need a reservation or you will easily be waiting an hour for a table because this place does get packed.

colu1Mxbfl7YGRpUbezQ9g.review_text: The evening began with running late - spent 30 minutes looking for parking in the area. Called to let them know and they were gracious and had a table waiting. Oaxaca cocktail was good...a little smokey. Appetizer demons on horseback [shrimp] arrived cool not at temperature, which killed the flavor. Scallops good, not great. Too much going on with the plate to experience the true flavor of the East Coast Diver Scallops. Broccolini, good but smoke dominated the flavor. Stopped there, not enticed by the desert menu. Check came to over $100 pp.  Overall, the hospitality was warm, but just another expensive, unmemorable meal prepared in volume by line cooks... Absolutely nothing memorable except the check.

fu7D4vwFko-pyMVI1W-Ycw.review_text: Went here for brunch with friends -- love the attention to detail, the decor, and the service. It's "fancy" without being too formal, and the menu is great. The challah is delicious (just don't think about how guilty you feel for eating it:) and I also got the cod cake which was really good! Overall great experience! Also loved that their water jugs don't spill all over the place when they refill your cup.

W1-SqDkbW6Cs_BYrGqxh9Q.review_text: Ehh. Salty and overpriced.  Service was okay, wasn't very attentive and didn't seem too knowledgeable.  Glad I tried, probably won't go back for dinner.  Might go back to check out the bar if around the area.

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: Really enjoyed the restaurant. Great location, the place is amazing inside, very chic and sophisticated at the same time.    The food was tasty for the most part, however there were a few misses:  The good: The warm bread rolls, the fried green tomatoes, the brussel sprout chips, the defiled eggs,  the pork chop (probably one of the best around), and of course the burger. The chicken looked good and tasted good, it was just a project unto itself to eat the thing, and the coconut cake was amazing   The not so good:  The pork belly bites, usually anything with pork belly is a hit, however all we got was deep fried fat, it was pretty gross. The salads, they tasted ok however they are tiny portions, a few bites and it's all gone.  The table service was fantastic. the front of the house service was fine, just be warned that if you and your dinner party arrive on time and prior to a celebrity (in this case Tyler Florence) you'll only be sat after said celebrity is taken care of...a bit rude, but the food made up for it. Can't wait to go back.

UvRUygcyvpJuHh1BiZrrbQ.review_text: Came Saturday night with the boy and we got seated by the window near the front which was nice. It seemed much more nosier everywhere else.   We started with the truffle fries with an egg yolk and caviar. Omg this was Delicious. The soft egg with caviar was nice added touch that I've never seen. Now next I come I want to try the lemon with burrata and the deviled eggs.  Entrees we both got the pork chop. It was nice an tender and cooked perfectly. They give you a big sized chunk of meat too!  For dessert we got the banana spilt. It was a fun dessert to each together. It comes with peanut butter ice cream, raspberry and chocolet. OH SO GOOD!

Ip-QVKDEjjjg5xQUwdE4rQ.review_text: Great location gets revived: the Poulet is sublime...

LwqpH0H8v0KUzczxo3fkqQ.review_text: Had a wonderful anniversary dinner here.  Porcini mushroom, truffle salsa verde & parmesan was my highlight.    The only gripe was it literally took them 35 minutes to bring desert after we ordered so we ended up having a 2.5 hour dinner.  Not a bad place to spend a long dinner though.

2GuU7LALkfqtkq9eD5ZuUg.review_text: Brunch review.    This place is delicious for brunch.  Came here last Saturday morning and sat outside.  Great view of Washington Square.  Drinks - the bloody marys are perfect - very spicy.  The espresso drink with fernet is pretty good as well, but I barely caught a buzz from two of them...maybe the pancakes soaked it all up...  Pancakes - I love good pancakes and these hit the spot.  Fluffy and the perfect size.  The butter and syrup are already on the 'cakes when they come out FYI.    Cast-Iron Baked Farm Eggs - amazing.  The cooked spinach and eggs are great together.  Comes in a small cast-iron skillet.  Crispy Polenta Cakes - girlfriend got these.  Had a bite and they were amazing.    Toast - order one of the sides of toast!  Had the Avocado toast - I'd never had avocado on toast before, but it was perfect.  I'll be back.

b3fyMswqU5-_UXk2Gmze0Q.review_text: Tasty cocktails and awesome brunch. Conveniently located by Washington square park.

KEE5x6yfH_5eC-aWn_J9AA.review_text: Although it's tough to get a table at times...and the loud, drunk women at the bar can be a bit annoying, Park Tavern is a total delight!  We were there with friends after having a wonderful experience at PT months before.  The wait staff were very attentive without being overbearing.  The beautiful Aileen (General Manager) greeted us and even had delicious deviled eggs brought to our table.  The soups were delicious and the entrees were delightful.  Atmosphere transports you to brasseries in NYC without the pretension.  Definitely recommend this spot on Washington Square!

reeiSIY3-h-fb8ye4Y7gDQ.review_text: The last time I was at this location was when the place was called Moose, I think that was the name. So basically, years ago. North Beach is a funny one for me because I love the neighborhood and have never had a bad meal there. But the parking is horrendous.  Park Tavern solved that, valet! Love it because I think valet helps raise the expectation a bit and lets you really make your dining choice feel like an occasion.   The decor was lovely but I'm wondering if just a few more noise canceling pieces might help. However, that's really nit-picking because the food was pretty notable that I honestly did not care if the conversation was interesting or not, I just wanted 'one-more-bite'.   Favorite bites were: The Polenta. Hot diggity was it good. Small portion but a good bite doesn't have to be a trough of food. Perfectly crispy on the outside, delicious soft center with very clear flavors.  The Hash. Wow, this is not your average interpretation of hash and 100% better for it. My poached egg was lovely and the corned beef devine. It was a little salty but nothing the acidic greens didn't correct if combined in the bite.   Yum yum yum guys. Yum!

NP7UsgS323DsfcRuzXHGpA.review_text: We tried Park Tavern after seeing a glowing review of it on KQED. The restaurant is charming and the staff is really excellent. But the three of us felt the food really fell short. My husband and I each ordered the standing game hen perched on spinach. The hen was moist, but was devoid of flavor, just no wow factor to the dish. Another person in our group had the strip steak, a big disappoinment as the meat was thin and flavorless. The deviled eggs were tasty as were the brussels sprouts chips even tho they were awfully salty. We ordered two desserst,the fig/toffee/cheese plate and the "almond joy." Nowhere had I ever seen such tiny desserts, really just miniscule to the point that we just had to laugh. For the price, the food was mediocre (although well conceived) and the dessert presentation just has to be a joke. With so many restaurant choices in SF, this one will not be on our list again.

VYmQiuDZTOLgv_al7yTQTA.review_text: Truffle fries... I cannot get you off my mind!!  We came here with a huge party and started off with drinks and apps. The waiter was super friendly giving personal suggestions and letting us take our time to chat, sip our wine, and review the menu.  Some of the dishes were a hit or a miss, but the apps were all very superb. We had the brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs, and cheese fondue. But the star app was definitely the truffle fries. The fries were accompanied by a soft-cooked egg with caviar as well as an aioli. Yummy gooey delish!  For the main courses, we tried almost everything but the star of the table was the "poulet noir" which was a poulet in command on a cast iron pan with onion stuffing below to soak in all the goodness. All that goodness was accompanied by a brown truffle sauce which the waiter poured over the chicken upon service. Yum! If you are a Californian eater, I suggest you split this since it was huge!  The braised beef short ribs came in as the 2nd most favorite on the table.   For dessert, the buttermilk panna cotta with mandarin wedges, oats, and toasted oats was perfect - not too sweet, deliciously creamy, and very clean and light.   This would be the perfect place for a date or to grab a glass of wine with snacks (highly recommend the truffle fries!) after a long day at work. The ambiance, service, and food were all excellent!

wZUQyVNuWgu-o6tADnTlJw.review_text: Very tasty brunch.  The deviled eggs are a must get.

F0AAhDFX1D0OmjHsaNk1-A.review_text: I try not to repeat restaurants in order to try out all the amazing places SF has to offer, but I find myself back at Park Tavern over and over again.  The ambiance, drinks & food makes it a big hit time after time.  Highly recommended: poulet rouge (whole chicken), pork chop, drinks, and deviled eggs  Foolproof catch-up or date spot!

D7nMJ5XGDmtBFKq5eKjfvA.review_text: So good.  Perfect brunch.  Loved the crab toast appetizer.  My main course was a smoked cod cake with a perfectly poached egg on top.  Great service, great meal.

cD2y-iMdLDIPkhYnNNN-wQ.review_text: We showed up here on Tues nt, we no reservations w/ my buddy from NJ. Their friendly hostess said an hr wait for a table But we could sit at the 'chefs table' in the back if we didn't need a table. We said Yes and this began our dinning adventure. Our waitress helped suggest dishes and everything we had from their bread to their desert was simply amazing. The best part might of been their starters- brussel sprout chips were a first and good. The entree , Game Hen, baked for 1/2hr was the best ever , it had stuffing and sauce in the pan which was the best fowl dish i've ever had. The service, staff, and cooks were all friendly/helpful even though this place was packed. My buddy from NJ said this was his best meal in SF he can recall . Thanks to PT for a wonderful dinning experience. A Also, they have Valet parking which was very helpul since its really hard to find a spot in north beach on any nt.

9Yw-6DMGO1KsVj4KkpcwTg.review_text: Great brunch spot! I love the atmosphere and sometimes I have dreams about their avocado toast.

YklfpGFHiC8EdLZhdBHlPA.review_text: 5 stars for:  Best deviled eggs in town.  Next time I might just sit at the bar and eat 8 of these.  Brussels sprouts chips are guilt-free munchies.  Lemon chips with fava hummus were different and delicious.  Watermelon with feta - refreshing and tasty.  Service was good.  4 stars for smoked burrata with heirloom tomatoes.  The burrata was excellent but the tomatoes were underripe.  2 stars for the cheese plate.  The accompanying items were interesting and good, but the cheeses themselves were dull.  They should at least have the option of a robust, flavorful cheese, but all of these were for beginners.

J-W8lby5Ly_dlW06VbuAuQ.review_text: I had a great experience at Park Tavern last night for dinner. The service was excellent and everyone was super friendly.  We didn't order any entrees, but the mixture of small plates and appetizers were all wonderful.  The highlights include:  Deviled eggs, with a perfect amount of kick  Demons on horseback - How can you go wrong with shrimp and bacon?! Brussel sprout chips - I was surprised with the large amount.  They were very tasty and the right amount of crispy. Almond Joy ice cream dessert - a nice small portion for a few bites of sweet at the end of the night  I wanted the seasonal burrata dish to have a little more flavor, as well as the sunchokes, but they were both above average dishes.  I will definitely be going back and having another one of their Mary Etta's Bubbles cocktails.

XuseBG1gQ4hT0Qbzykq08Q.review_text: Perfect Sunday scenario: Outdoor seating overlooking Washington Square, sipping on delicious cocktails and to-die-for deviled eggs while people watching. I could die a happy girl.  Solid restaurant with a solid menu and even better cocktail menu.  Maybe it was the company I was with, but I've genuinely enjoyed every visit I've had at PT. It's super packed here, but kick back, grab a few cocktails, share some laughs with friends, and before you know it, seating will magically open up for you. Service is always friendly, which is definitely a plus.

ghOQ3yUgAc6v2_ZhAqL5Ag.review_text: Great atmosphere and location. Food was good and service was friendly and attentive. Good for a date, but probably not for a business dinner (maybe lunch?)

r_Qkw4jAlamo7QEqCrMsYg.review_text: We loved aura! Not only was she exceptional with her service, she was on top with all of what we wanted to order. We wanted to come here for a while, but we were very skeptical because we never went here before. Thanks to Aura, we had EXCEPTIONAL service! We had an amazing diner which we loved! We wish to come back here every time we come to the Bay Area which is very frequent for us. Thank you aura! We appreciated your business!

hSD2Lu8Z_62klnMDND5sSg.review_text: Fantastic food and drinks.  I've been for brunch and dinner and stopped in for cocktails only.  Each time I have enjoyed myself and so have the people I have been with.  Love the space (thought watch yourself on those slippery floors).  The upstairs bar is really cute too and very laid back.  P.S.  Great brunch cocktails.

Wu4pMr0hMYFmu59r03exTA.review_text: Met up with some friends here for a weekend brunch. Scoffed at the line at Mama's and were immediately seated in Park Tavern (we had made reservations). We all ordered rounds of coffee (which was tasty) then ordered entrees.  The vibe is contemporary and comfortable with tiled floors and rustic textures. It felt refined, welcoming and relaxing. Prime people-watching with Washington Square across the street.  I got the polenta with eggs asparagus and an arugula salad. The polenta was incredibly light and crispy. The egg on top was perfectly poached. I thoroughly enjoyed the salad. All in all, I very tasty and satisfying dish.  My dining companions ordered the Corned Beef Hash, Duck Egg sandwich and  Cast-iron Farm egg. Lots of enthusiasm for the food around the table. It might not be the best deal in town but a meal here is certainly worth its asking price. I'll be back!

k7FG2EYHGiOlYF5fMS7X8w.review_text: Wow.  What a busy place.   But very friendly staff.  And, I guess friendliness rubs into patrons too.    It is like a big happy family at the bar and communal tables  Avocado sandwich is AMAZING

MFfABBIpFNuxRJIgMEs8cw.review_text: This place is upscale but casual, with a really warm vibe. The staff here is great; our waiter was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.   The food was good but not anything I'd get super excited about. The pork chop dish was good; honestly, the best part of that dish was what came with the pork chop. I had the salmon, which was good but a little salty for my tastes. My brother had the burger and said it was quite tasty.  The July's birthday cake was a really interesting dessert, but it wasn't as good as I'd wanted it to be. Oh, and skip the banana split; there's really nothing good about except the chocolate mousse/ice cream at the bottom.

oAs_LyLRVYyscqg8PCHEhg.review_text: Had heard good things about this restaurant.  Ate there and wondered why.  Was served a raw pork chop.  Gnocchi was fried ????  Noise level ridiculous.  The only reason I gave it one star was the server was very pleasant.  Do yourself a favor - eat at one of the 2000+ better resaurants in the city.

8y6ZqEh6M1AFoyeGw-3Pyw.review_text: Usually great place for lunch and brunch however last experience was not that good.  Poor service (lazy waiter) and ok fish dish.  Sat at table for extended period of time and had to ask for server.  When server appeared treated us as if he did not care to take our order.   Regarding the food (fish) server did not describe dish and if he had it may have changed my choice to something else on the menu.    Generally a good restaurant option in North Beach but management needs to  work with wait staff on customer service.

UWAp17zCniC1B0Rpw0BAYA.review_text: This place has a vibe that reminds me a lot of uptown Manhattan - at least the ambiance.  I have been here for drinks a few times, dinner and brunch.  All of which were excellent.  Great for large or small parties.  Usually my bf and I share dishes, but these dishes are on the smaller side, so you can order your own.  I had the smoked salmon Benedict for brunch and it was outstanding!    The menu is unique, but very good.  AND you can make brunch reso's which is perfect as I hate waiting.

rO2YKN1PqAJjd6YgP0PM0A.review_text: I just like this place...just like I like Marlowe. It can get a bit pricey, but service has always been good, food is consistent and drinks are strong. Can't ask for much else.  I am still craving the deviled eggs and Marlowe burger. Scallops are also really good.

XYfT8BNHMVmCOjr_hJ474A.review_text: Good location. Like the ambiance. The food is good as well although I found the dishes to be little on the heavier side. But other than that this is a solid 4 star place in my opinion.

9rSJj9IAQpEA6ky0qZ6ICw.review_text: This place was really, really great. Keep in mind that it is packed full, even in the bar area. You will definitely need to make a reservation. Thankfully we did, and we were seated right away.   I had the famous brussels sprouts chips, and even though as a rule I hate brussels sprouts, they were amazing. They are served in a bowl as individual leaves and perfectly seasoned with oil and salt. If only my mother made them this way when I was a kid, I would have eaten them constantly!   For an entree I had the Angus filet mignon, which is served over spinach and potatoes, which are baked and sliced but have a crispy skin. The steak was perfectly cooked, tender and full of flavor. Absolutely delicious!  My only note was that the waitress could have kept a closer eye on our table, as I emptied my first glass of wine and had to hunt her down to order another one. Our water glasses were always full.   Overall, a great experience and I will definitely go back.

CLsH7RuscV41T2qpROI9QA.review_text: I think this is such a great restaurant. The ambiance and location is fantastic. The staff is very professional and they always do their best to find a table for guests. The food is great (especially brunch). I'd highly recommend.

5dFGbZDinrXMVN8xek_bRQ.review_text: Love this place.  Great ambiance and really great food.    I seem to always order a steak when I come and have never been disappointed.  The brussel sprout chips and the truffle oil fries are amazing.  They are famous for the whole rotisserie chicken here.  Very juicy and great seasoning as well.  Will continue to go back to Park Tavern and always recommend it to friends.

enR42sMb5uu6FmlsFettGQ.review_text: Park Tavern - fucking delicious   I've been here now for both brunch and dinner.  It initially caught my eye because the decor is modern with lots of wood and really nice flower arrangements, plus it's right on the park.   Brunch:  Delicious and got to sit outside with a view of Washington square park.  Had some Stumptown coffee, really interesting 'toast' with sliced avocado on top with sea salt and olive oil (so good!) and some perfectly done poached eggs on some (baked?) polenta.  Honestly, I was pretty tired, so don't remember too many details besides how yummy it was.  Also, the dudes next to us ordered lots of cocktails that looked pretty good.   Dinner:  Went with my family for this one, started with a couple of salads (good - not too memorable), but my God was my steak frites (Bar steak?) amazing! Sometimes you just want a good cut of meat and this is the place my friend - steak and fries, no frills, just delicious.  Be warned though, medium is not that pink. Definitely glad I ordered mine medium rare.    We ordered the brussel sprouts on the side for veggies, and these were really good and complemented our steaks perfectly! And for dessert, we were totally caught off guard by how amazing the 'strawberry rhubarb shortcake' was.  It came in a cast iron pan (small), and was basically strawberry rhubarb pie filling (yum!) with short cake and cream in the corner, and strawberry icecream on the side.  2 weeks later I still dream of this dessert!   Scene:  Valet parking! woot Also - the Bar at night was POPPIN OFF, had to yell across the dinner table to keep the convo going! I also saw these long tables which have full food service (I think) so you can just come by if you're in the area. Definitely will have to come back for an evening out on the town.  Highly recommend this spot, and if you don't find a rez on open table, just try calling!

zQvBRYbPrRA4WWcIDMocUg.review_text: Came here for after work drinks and light bites.  Definitely has the most fancy pants of fries that's a must try -  think truffle fries and replace your ketchup with an egg and caviar   The service was super nice and it's a bit on the "upscale" but would make for a nice spot for a date. It's right across Washington square park and close enough to other bar.

9yPITTB_nUpXkau8IqfPqQ.review_text: birthday dinner #1  haven't been here in 6 months and was thinking about their chicken..  ordered: -smoked deviled eggs:bacon, pickled jalapeno, chive.. loved this and wanted more  -parisienne gnocchi:wild mushrooms, truffle, sugar snap peas.. good but i wasn't able to eat a lot of this  -pt fries:truffle, soft cooked egg, caviar.. same as last time..saltier after every bite  -marlowe burger: caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon w fries and horseradish aioli.. nice burger. i liked the bun.   -poulet noir: black truffle, butter braised spinach, roasted peewee potatoes.. so tender and juicy just as i remembered my first time here  -herb crusted petrale sole: heirloom squash, pea tendrils, mint, prosciutto, white wine veloute..i really wanted to like this but it failed terribly. after the first bite, the crust tasted familiar but i couldn't quite figure it out; about halfway through i finally came to the conclusion that the herbed crust tasted like a mashed falafel on top of the sole. their were way too many flavors that just didn't go together   -tcho chocolate creme brulee: chili, lemon zest, sea salt and chocolate biscotti.. same as last visit  -afternoon delight: captain crunch ice cream, cereal milk creme anglaise, captain crunch dust.. i liked this and the creme reminded me of the cereal milk ice cream at extraordinary desserts in sd  im not really sure if i go back again anytime soon.. if i do it'd be for the poulet noir

-6KYwjbTX4hu9pxrFxnTFw.review_text: Great staff, wonderful ambiance, unique dishes and great drinks.  What else can I say, Park Tavern is just 'solid'!  Wonderful outdoor people watching with a great view of the park.  Great to just stop in and hit the bar and the bar staff is friendly and quick.

bBIyAqPhsXrJ8KT9wYUXIQ.review_text: I love coming at the location and there was no cheat with payment for foods. Foods with food was awesome and enjoyable for me. Had to wait 20 minutes and got my order.

dnGIi-OjEui4OSsmLQ2lPw.review_text: I made a reservation here on *someone's birthday, but then had a little too much fun that day and we ended up missing the reservation.  So I made another reservation for a Sunday evening to make up for my indiscretions (with an emphasis on the "s" at the end of indiscretions).  And so it goes.    We arrived right on time for our reservation at 7:15 p.m. and were promptly seated.  My companion didn't like the table, however, and we were promptly re-seated with no questions asked.  In the interest of brevity, I will only note the highlights, as follows.    We settled in and got down to business.  We started with two cocktails - the McLaren and the Aquatic Park.  We also ordered two appetizers: (1) the deviled eggs; and (2) the Demon on Horseback (shrimp).  Both were scrumptious, but boy, those deviled eggs were something to write home about -- do you hear me?  Those flavors were WORKING: Pickled jalapeno, bacon and chive?  YES, YES and YES.    I also want to note right out of the gates that the bread and butter were yummy.  I love when all of the small details are attended to.    For dinner, I ordered the Marlowe Burger, medium.  The burger was served with caramelized onion, cheddar, bacon and horseradish aioli (plus fries).  So, let's discuss the bacon. I don't care how trendy it is or is not, I frakking LOVE bacon.  But this bacon was pretty special because it was cooked so perfectly--crisp, but not crumbly.  When you took a bite of the sandwich, the bacon remained in tact on the rest of the sandwich, which I frequently find to be the hallmark of finely cooked fare (I am insane about this with onion rings as well - if I take a bite out of an onion ring and the onion comes out of the ring on that bite, it was not cooked properly, in my humble opinion).    For dessert, we had a piece of "September's Birthday Cake," which is champagne chiffon cake, pears and mascarpone cheese.  Oh heavens, I could be very satisfied with a piece of that cake every evening. I didn't get any cake on my birthday - so I feel entitled to go back and have another piece. The whole reason for birthdays is cake, after all.    Our server was lovely, attentive and pleasant. I think the evening was pretty successful overall.  Now, I'm going to need to come back to PT for brunch, obviously.  And I believe I'm owed a piece of cake.  Loved it.

PvBmRN4suldo06Kcz2-vcw.review_text: probably most classic place to hangout in the sunset.  grew up in SF and went to high school down the street, never been to this place.  once I walked in, I was like wow very nice and clean.  awesome bar.  reminded me of the harry's bar on fillmore.

jFZ7xAhnT5tteHgqL-zw2g.review_text: The service here is really considerate. They turned on the heater and brought us thick lap blankets when we wanted to sit outside since it was slightly chilly. What sweethearts :)  For an appetizer I got the venison carpaccio, which I highly recommend. It was zesty, bold, and not gamey at all. Bone marrow is incorporated into the dish as crispy little nuggets, which I think is more approachable to the average diner than its usual presentation.   As entrees, my friend ordered the duck egg sandwich and I got the fried chicken one. Both were good and I usually don't eat sandwiches since I have a slight aversion to eating bread. I will definitely be back to try their brunch, which has been listed as one of the best the city has to offer.   Outdoor seating was nice, but the inside is exceptionally beautiful - rustic with a modern twist. The lighting is dimly romantic and the place is classy, but extremely welcoming and comfortable as well.

p7CWesCdgT2KIdcHfBuscQ.review_text: Had an awesome brunch here and the star was actually their boozy smoothie....bourbon, bananas.....I only wish it were bigger. Check out photos of what we ate at eatsporkjew.com/restaura…

1yeS87Cj8DhbLXSLYxzIzw.review_text: Couldn't resist the Marlowe burger served here at her sister restaurant. Didn't disappoint. Hate Brussels sprouts? Me, too- until today. Our friends/dinner companions introduced us to an appetizer item that amounted to chips made from deep-fried slices of sprouts. I'll never come here again without ordering them.

0PNnsmKlm8Rp6QaDbzh8nw.review_text: Such a classic San Francisco restaurant and location. Seated promptly and service was excellent, not too pushy. Started with the brussel sprout chips and burrata, both of which will leave you wanting more. For an entree, I was deciding between the pork chop and sole but after heavy apps decided on the fish. I could not have been more pleased with the flavors and textures that this dish represented. Excellent food, ambiance and location make Park Tavern an experience you won't forget.

o6LNtkMDPEHQTlbVcKVmYA.review_text: Came here with a friend after SFGate alerted me to absolutely nothing going on in the City. It was a Monday after all. I heard Park Tavern was popular, and thought if anything was going on at Washington Square, it would center around the tavern. I had 9pm reservations, but we showed up early and found a spot at the bar. Jake, our bartender, greeted us like we were regulars... his charm and skillful mixology was enough that I abandoned my reservation of an outdoor table in favor on eating on the old Moose's bartop. I thought Gary Danko made a great blood and sand, but this one - served neat with an aromatic orange peel kiss to the sides of the glass - was tops. We had the obligatory deviled eggs and brussels sprout chips (YUM!), and while I ordered the only beef entree on the menu (NY Kobe Steak) my friend ordered the Poulette Noir. One note: it's best to sit at the bar when you order the Poulette Noir, it really does take 30 minutes, and you'll need at least one drink refill before it arrives.  The food was outstanding, but what made the night was Jake. He was soft spoken and cheerful, joining in on jokes and telling us stories about the bar and his travels. We were having so much fun, we actually closed the bar after an impromptu grappa tasting and a particularly tasty bit of cheddar.   For my experience, Park tavern is a place to go alone or with a good friend. Belly up to the bar and find Jake or one of the other skilled bartenders to guide your night.

pv7yUP2F4vN0WanV_kWWnw.review_text: 3.5 stars....this review is for the brunch only.  We popped in on a Saturday around 11:30 with no reservation.  We were easily able to get a table for two, the restaurant was quite busy but there were open tables scattered here and there.    We really enjoyed the food, I tried a dish with spinach, cream, gruyere and farm eggs and it was quite ice.  We also tried the poached eggs with polenta cakes.  Both dishes could have used a little salt and pepper as they were a touch on the bland side (the tables do not have salt and pepper shakers).  Though we did enjoy the food, the service was very much on the slow, yet very polite side.  We will try Park Tavern again, the atmosphere is fun, the clientele as well.  This is a cool spot, hoping the service is a little more attentive when we return and I can bump up the review to 4 stars.

kFn0DDoHCe31LjdP63CGqQ.review_text: Started with drinks at the bar - a generous space that was hopping, which I imagine it does most nights.  The makeover from Moose's is awesome and the restaurant feels good.  Hamachi crudo with sea salt and grapefruit juice was delicious and served on a cool, dark slate dish.  Heirloom carrots were nicely displayed, but I thought the accompanying drizzle was too sweet, overshadowing the natural goodness of the veg.  The polenta could have been the best I've ever tasted.  The deviled eggs were also very good - nothing crazy or game changing here.  Tombo tuna main was perfectly seared raw and was excellent.  We chose a 2001 Rioja Reserva that just got better and better through the meal.  Nice pick whomever built the list - and a decent price, $70.  Our server was a bit frazzled, but bought us dessert and made the experience a great one.

S1UfaWG22oLVqVxZJkTLxg.review_text: amazing brunch. great open front restaurant, sunny, airy, great park across the street. crab toast was amaazing. fruit plate apps were amazing. salmon benedict was very average, only one egg. french toast was good, nothing special.  great service, very roomy with awesome decor.

ETTwZr_5D8QVtdMCVUHHVA.review_text: Great atmosphere, decent food, fabulous wine list. I say the food was "decent" because it was a little too salty for my taste. However, the kale appetizer they brought us was divine.

_dKFcQEIOkJNzk74BPKBhA.review_text: Love this place! Park Tavern is easily one of the best restaurants in the neighborhood. It has a really cool, classy vibe with a really big bar area and great drinks. Great date night spot that feels a lot nicer than anything else in the area. The food is really good too - get the brussel sprout chips! Definitely try to make a reservation here, the wait can be really long (or try to find a spot to eat at the bar).

vehJ0jsr0qI_WSUnYn_2ow.review_text: we have been going here since it opened in 2011..  unfortunately, we have been noticing a steady decline over the past few months.. inconsistent quality with regards to the cuisine, and disjointed service...   we have always enjoyed the atmosphere and cocktails offered, and the menu LOOKS great, however the actual dishes have become disappointing..  PLEASE get your act together and get back on track..

ccfVsl7SZeK-2Ixc2-anuQ.review_text: Sometimes I feel like I just can't go wrong in North Beach :) Another win for Washington Square! I was surprised to secure a same day Saturday night prime-time reservation.  We arrived a bit early and worked our way to the busy(!) bar for some pre-dinner libations. Although it was packed, the bartenders were attentive and quick to take our order. I particularly love that attention to detail.  We were seated on time a few minutes later.   We weren't starving, so opted for the lemon chip/burrata dish, deviled eggs appetizers, and split the burger. The lemon chips were interesting, just as you would expect them to taste, but didn't find that they went particularly well with the burrata.  The eggs on the other hand were excellent - can't go wrong with a crisp bacon lardon sitting on top!  The burger was just as good. Loved that they went ahead and pre-split it along with the fries.  Overall, Park Tavern showcased amazing attention to detail.  The meal and vibe were just what we were in the mood for. Would happily return!

A9AM8NH3ToduRvYDvDSADA.review_text: I'd love to come back for dinner one day!  Do make reservations if they take it because the place does get packed.    We had drinks at the bar on a Saturday at 6 and it was busier than most places during weekday happy hour.  The bartenders were very attentive.  We munched on brussel sprout chips (individual sprout leaves deep fried) and deviled eggs.  The chips were really greasy but retained it's brussel sprout flavor well.  I loved the pickled jalapeno on the eggs but the yolk was a little too smooth and pureed for my liking.

2OUtitBrWlpzMip1EYaIrg.review_text: I came here on a Thursday at 8:00 with reservations and got seated probably 10 minutes later, they were pretty packed as it was a nice day.  i ordered 4 shots of tequila it did the job and made my meal more enjoyable I ordered the hen which was tasty my friend ordered the burger with aioli on the side but when we got it there was some white sauce on top of the burger so i passed it off to my friend. he also got the deviled egg which he liked. our waiter was decent, the guys that provide the water and bread were on top of their game :)  i came here when it was mooses , and then joey and eddies. this place looks extremely nice inside. I would come here again to check out the bar:)

kYnF9m5gnZSppIlMFNevVA.review_text: An exceptional addition to the San Francisco dining scene.  Ambiance: lively, classic yet updated look, everyone looked like they were having a great time  Food: every dish succeeded and exceeded expectations, particularly the deviled eggs, burger and steak  Drink: attentive and skilled bartenders - try the 'Washington Square' cocktail. Perfectly sized and well chosen wine list as well.  Service: everyone was very friendly yet extremely professional and knowledgeable. We were in a group of 8 and they handled our large group with exacting skill and perfect pacing.  Bottom Line: An instant classic. Suitable for a date, fun business dinner or a group celebration.  Can't wait for weekend brunch to start!

yM-5A65O0EULHfKyyN58Vw.review_text: A very poor value for the money. While the food was tasty and well prepared, the portions were meager and not particularly inspired (steak with chips, not exactly groundbreaking).  For the price, this place should do a lot more to impress, and currently it's just another overpriced tourist trap in North Beach.

WD0pchQWVY5tBbPqRq4zjQ.review_text: What a nice place to sit at the bar on a lazy Sunday! My friend and I wandered over here after brunch at Bottle Cap across the way. We couldn't have been treated better! We took two bar stools, ordered drinks, and just relaxed. The bartender was awesome! Really nice guy who was fun to talk to. We had an excellent time. When my friend kept talking me into staying longer, I asked the bartender for some bread and he brought  me a beautiful basket of fresh rolls with butter. I can't wait to have a dinner here. Already made my Open Table reservation!

WzgTJg1cWYsFMCZKLHd8-w.review_text: NOW OPEN!   We landed reservations for opening night at Park Tavern and to my surprise, we had one of the best seats in the house.  One would argue that they were not the greatest seats in the house, because we were by the kitchen and in the back - but from the angle I was sitting at, you could see all of the food being served and people watch from a distance. Simply excellent.   Park Tavern is a sharing kind of a place.  You order and share to maximize your experience.  Here's everything we shared - beware, it's a long list for 2: - deviled eggs: so amazing. bite size heavenly, deliciousness  - raw halibut: TASTY!  - beef carpaccio: perfect seasoning with a hint of mustard!  - burrata: not my favorite, the lime salt (similar to Marlowe's brussel sprout chips but on deep friend lemons) was too salty for my palate - pork belly bites: you get a TON... so be prepared - seared scallops: a trio of perfectly plated scallops - seasoned creamy greens: just the right size of creamy greens - fig and apple dessert: the crust, fabulous. if you're an apple/fig fan - a must get. i'm a fan of neither... should have stuck with the cake  Casey, one of the managers, complimented the bottle of wine we had ordered. I think it was the Muscadet on the list - but now it slips my mind.  Crisp and light - just how I like my whites.   Opening night = packed house.  Looking forward to seeing how the restaurant does in the upcoming months!

RhUQ1Vz3-bDMLbIGlcyzfA.review_text: From the team behind Marlowe, proprietress Anna Weinberg and chef Jennifer Puccio, Park Tavern is a great addition to the restaurant scene around Washington Square Park.  Located in the space the formerly housed Moose's and Joey & Eddie's, Park Tavern is the perfect antidote for these uncertain economic times.  Rather than frou-frou, Park Tavern is solid and simple; it is American food:  reasonably priced meat and potatoes, not tarted up frisée salad with poached organic, free range quail eggs sprinkled with some esoteric salt harvested by blind one-armed nuns on a remote island in Java.  With white tiled floors, dark wood paneling, and nicely dim lighting, the frill-free, the dining room is cozy without detracting from the main event:  the food.  Park Tavern is not a place for vegetarians.  It is a meat-eater's restaurant--the kind of place that makes you want to order steak medium-rare.  The Brussels sprout chips ($6) are so good they will make you forget you are eating a vegetable.  The "Marlowe" burger ($13) served with caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli, and fries was tender, juicy, and delicious.  Moist and tender, the Park Tavern "poulet rouge", (AKA Cornish game hen, $22) was served on a upright spit with spinach & Peewee potatoes on the side.   While the food is good, the bar is not far behind.  High-end, "mixologist" cocktails are available, at least six craft brews are on tap, and at least 25 well priced wine selections can be had by the glass or carafe.    Service was spot-on.  Water glasses never went unfilled, dishes arrive with good pacing, and used plates and utensils were quickly removed.  Servers were knowledgeable about the menu, easily answering questions about ingredients and how dishes were prepared.  With Park Tavern, Weinberg and Puccio have a hit on their hands.  Grab your reservations before everyone else finds out and you cannot get in.

ymHDG6M5hMlrABVtYqS3rQ.review_text: have eaten here 4, 5, or 6 times, can't keep track, but never have a bad meal or poor service, whether at the bar by myself eating or with a few friends at a table!  Definitely make a reservation, and KEEP IT, you can never beat this wonderful menu, anything you have will please the palette, smokey devilled eggs and definitely pork chop!!!!!!!!

_PukF-NFTrJnhXbrPG0DKg.review_text: We were invited to the friends and family pre opening and were so impressed with the decor and food, even though this restaurant has only been open a few days I am sure it will be one of the top restaurants in the city. There have been a few other restauurants in this space since Ed Moose that have not done well but these folks are pro's and it shows.Better make your reservations soon the opening is on the 1st.

4fBtk9ff4P-gdWBiS0r6MA.review_text: Made a reservation for a large group. Food was overall good and so was the service. I ordered the brussel sprout chips, corn soup, and the rosted cornish hen with black truffles. I was worried that I had ordered poultry, but it ended up being really good. I thought it was funny that they gave me option of having it cut for me or if I wanted to carve it. I'm going to carve it myself. Duh. Cornish hen was moist and falvorful and yo could taste the truffle. This was rather large for me though. All I probably ate was one breast. I was not that hungry to begin with. My friend's pork I thought could be better. It would have been better if it was marinated in a citrus or vinergette, rather than just the chili rub that it came it. The fattier parts were better though. The corn soup was good, I would recommend it. I liked the oil that was drizzled on top of it. Also, order the gnocchi. It's the best gnocchi I've had.

lD_iIjLUhrItVF7wk6e8Gg.review_text: We had our first but certainly not our last dinner at Park Tavern last night, and it was near perfect! The deviled eggs, fried green tomatoes, pork chops (not actually listed on the menu), polenta, and both desserts could not have been any better.  Prices are reasonable for what you get. Noise level was very high -- a carpet would help that.  I like the interior better when it was Moose's, but all else was wonderful!

iZdcEwzZge5m4WMriYGBOw.review_text: I came here when my friend lived on Polk Street and the brunch was fantastic.  I ordered the corned beef hash, which was super unique.  I would definitely recommend this dish!  You could literally see the corned beef hash and potato, whereas other restaurants the corned beef hash normally looks like cat food (which I think still tastes great).  All of my friends ordered a Bloody Mary, which was super strong.  Surprisingly, they didn't have extra stalks of celery or veggies to put in the drinks.  I ordered some citrus whiskey-like drink which was refreshing.  Overall, a great brunch spot in a great location.  I would highly recommend this restaurant for brunch, and still have yet to try it for dinner.

wqR09datevQgOGSekoL9ag.review_text: I recently went to Park Tavern to try both the lunch with is only on Fridays' and for dinner.    Both times I had the deviled eggs and they are as the tout fabulous.  The presentation is boring on the plate but I think that's on purpose since the egg itself is garnished very well.    For lunch I shared the crab cakes and the salmon entry.  The service delivered the entry split even though we didn't ask for it. That was nice.  I was very happy with my lunch overall.  The restaurant was decorated very respectably for the holiday.  It wasn't too much or too little. Classy.  As for dinner, I had the game hen, which takes 30 minutes to cook.  It was worth the wait because we occupied ourselves with the wedge salad and the brussel sprouts.  What I liked about the wedge salad was that it was not made with ice berg lettuce but butter lettuce.  It was very nice.    The hen comes with stuffing and even though my friend and I split, I had enough for a light lunch the next day.  I suggest 2 eggs per person as 1 just leaves you wanting.   I have already suggested this place to friends.  The restaurants starts to get a bit loud at the peek of dinner, but other than that, I have absolutely no complaints.

0AlnetQ_-a4f7kY0Sker2w.review_text: Deviled Eggs.  Really that's all you need to know.  The fact that everything else about this restaurant is nearly perfect to me can be summed up by other people's reviews.  So class, what is the take home message about Park Tavern?   "D-E-V-I-L-E-D E-G-G-S, Deviled Eggs."

KXmQhXI89cJUtlEPtTv4qA.review_text: I was lucky enough to be invited to the Zagat Survey's Launch Party here.  I remembered the space as Frankie and Johnny's (yes, I stand corrected, at least I got the "two male names" concept right) recently and as Moose's when I was a kid.      The surroundings are beautiful - dark, masculine, sexy - MR. Park Tavern.  The bathroom was pretty and I love the mosaic design on the walls.  The heavy use of wood evoked warmth and the lighting added to the overall impact of the place.   Some specialty cocktails were available for the event and I had one in particular that was lovely and packed a punch - the Washington Square, which was anything but!  The bartenders were friendly and watching their mixology was like watching mad scientists in a lab.   They had bar bites which included smoked almonds, house made jerky, and brussels sprout chips (divine).  We also had pork rinds (4505 still wins, but these were pretty darn good) and deviled eggs that may give another "Tavern" a run for its money.  Burrata served on lemon "chips" with basil was refreshing and yummy.  Fried oysters served atop a lettuce leaf were also good.  The winner...pork belly bites!  Little bites of heaven and triple bypass rolled into one.  I'd like to come back and have a proper meal.  I admit that the food may have played second fiddle that evening -- being part of the intimate affair with some of the industry's bigwigs had me kind of awestruck.  Next time, I'll pay more attention to the food, the service (which was friendly enough as dishes were passed by servers), and the people making the food-magic happen (they have an open kitchen).  Till we meet again, Mr. Tavern...

TCXHYNo1LWLszdGwrFhvJg.review_text: We came here last year and we loved the peaches glazed French toast and the farm eggs. We are actually on our way right now to get some. Hope the second experience is as good as the last. It is pretty difficult to get a table here but I feel it's worth the wait. There is a place across the street called MAMA's and it took us an 1 1/2 to get in. The food was good but basic, you could have gotten the same thing at IHOP but Park Tavern is definitely a twist on many comfort foods :)

DXEk34ZJiLBFTIVv1e90YA.review_text: Came for a friends birthday party with about 8 people. I always expect slow service with a larger group, but this restaurant actually was very quick with taking orders, making the food, fillings waters, etc.   The food was good; I recommend the PT fries - truffle fries with boiled egg (yolk is still runny, great to dip fries in) and the "poulet noir" which is a hen cooked and served on a skillet (very juicy, very generous portion)!  Valet parking is convenient since parking around Washington square park is close to impossible.

sImoVbJmmdz1fPm46qM12g.review_text: Grabbed a late night dinner reservation on a Friday night. We had the brussel sprout chips (great) the demons on horseback (great) and the fondue which had a lot of bread and not a lot of actual fondue unfortunately. Then we split the braised beef short ribs which were amazingly tender and delicious. The meal was very good overall.

nb53ZK2Q1lZ0iI5GKL0xNA.review_text: I was torn between three and four stars here. My concierge had arranged a reservation at a different restaurant, but my friend's husband was intrigued by the gnocchi here and asked if I could switched the reservation. The restaurant said they were booked for reservations (we were a party of four) until 9 p.m., but that we were welcome to come in and try to snag seats at the communal tables.     We were quoted a 45 minute wait time, which is standard for any decent restaurant at prime dinner time. They have a fantastic cocktail selection and very friendly bartenders. The wine list had a nice list of options as well.     After waiting for an hour, my friend asked the host how much longer it would be. She was told the reservations were running a little behind and it would be another 20 minutes. I understand it's hard to predict when tables will get up but it was getting ridiculous. After two hours, we were sat with no apology. While we certainly could have chosen to leave and go to another restaurant, it was ridiculous.     On to the food. The deviled eggs and gnocchi were well received at the table. Two people got the burger, one got the steak and I had the sole. The sole was very good, the steak got rave reviews, and the burger had lukewarm reactions. Desserts looked delicious.     All in all, the food was very enjoyable, but absolutely not worth a two hour wait. While I would eat here again, I would never try without a reservation or with a large group.

nyXNNLKjSWtDQka5PrFoew.review_text: Stopped in on a whim without reservations and snagged 2 seats at the bar. Decor was amazing - rustic but contemporary. Having been to and loved Marlowe, we ordered the burger for comparison. Starters we had the much raved about deviled eggs and brussel sprout chips along with some cocktails.  Hands down best deviled eggs of my life!!! However, the price prevented me from ordering half a dozen for myself. Cocktails and the rest of our food were delicious as well, but seemed pricier than Marlowe. Parking is a pain in the you know what, but luckily they valet here.

EnRHwSuPGkELuyiuACgZtg.review_text: Went there for dinner on Friday night.  Fun crowd but very noisy, to the point that the conversation was impossible.  Hip surroundings and people.  There were 6 of us and all three of those that ordered hamburgers, said they were over-cooked and dry.  What good restaurant that has a hamburger on the menu, wouldn't know how to cook it properly? Waitress offered to redo them but since we had already waited an extra 30 minutes to order, they declined.  As compensation, they provided free desserts......TWICE!  They had forgotten they already served it!  Four out of 6 would not return, 1 would and 1 was unsure......

PHYrHrAmHIzVp4VY8qeTcA.review_text: Park Tavern is definitely at the top or near the top of our favorite restaurants. Everything from the food, service, ambiance, and location are spot on.  Foods: Brussels Sprout Chips - Love this stuff. Great starter to order and munch on while you wait for the rest of the delicious food to arrive.  Smoked Deviled Eggs - So addicting! You'll definitely want to order more than one!  PT Fries - The perfect crisp-on-the-outside, soft-on-the-inside fries! Nicely seasoned and a hint of truffle oil? The dipping sauce they serve with it is just fine...but the best part is definitely the soft-boiled egg with caviar. Whoever thought of egg and fries...genius!  Poulet Noir - We've gotten the Poulet Rouge here before which was amazing, and this dish was no different. Don't think we've ever had a chicken that's been cooked so perfectly or so tasty before (other than the Poulet Rouge, of course)!  C.A.B NY Steak - The steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare. Incredibly juicy and well seasoned. The pole beans were delicious as well, but what tied everything together was the red wine jus! The only part of the dish that I was hoping more from was the braised Kobe and bone marrow. The braised Kobe was a tad overdone and a little on the dry side. But...what could've saved it was if there was more bone marrow! It was really tough to identify the buttery, fatty, taste of heaven that we crave in bone marrow.  Desserts: Wood-Fired Roasted Strawberry & Rhubarb Shortcake - Oh my goodness, this was so yummy. The strawberry and rhubarb was cooked down and oh so tasty with the wonderful shortcake and vanilla ice cream!  Afternoon Delight - When a restaurant offers Captain Crunch ice cream, you have to just get it! It was as you would expect, Captain Crunch-y and rich ice cream with a dust of cereal. This was served with a delicious shot of cereal milk crème. (Also eating this with the strawberry and rhubarb shortcake was awesome.)  The service here is always top notch. We love coming here, and we'll definitely be back the next time we're in the city.

VXtCzuzs_XlZVa1cU_kt0A.review_text: The service here was fantastic. I made a reservation for my boyfriend and I for his birthday and they made it really special. The staff was very attentive and they organized a special birthday cocktail and dessert.  The brussel sprout fries are pretty tasty as well!

SKBXvUGuHrbYnDRbZAWM-g.review_text: Overhyped. Overpriced.   *Note: This review is for brunch, not dinner.*   I freakin love brunch. It's kind of a problem. I think about it during the week, planning for my next brunch fix. There are few breakfast establishments that miss my scavenging eye. So, when I discovered that Park Tavern had recently begun to serve brunch, I was giddy with excitement. I mean, they serve cocktails in PITCHERS for god's sakes! What could go wrong?  Do not be lured in by their pitchers (although their menu insinuates otherwise, only 2 of their cocktails are offered in this form) or the flawless, if sterile, Restoration Hardware decor. This was a highly average brunch experience. Here's a breakdown:  To Start:  -Sourdough, Dungeness crab & green goddess toast:  This could have been fabulous! But what was the deal with the toast? Instead of the crunchy, flavorful Tartine-style slices we were hoping for, we received small doughy triangles, already getting soggy from the crab and green goddess on top - kind of like old lady cucumber sandwich bread. Plus the dungeness crab topping was only so-so. You know it's a fail when you think to yourself, "I could have made this better at home."  To Drink:  -PT Bloody Mary:   I'm really glad they got this right, otherwise I might have cried. However, these bloody maries are made with a beef broth, which was a sad discovery for my vegetarian sister, who loves bloody maries and couldn't get one here. The "veggie alternative" (see below) was such a sad excuse for a cocktail - it should really be taken off the drink menu.  -Bloody Maria:   This is usually made with tequila, but my sister asked for hers with vodka to make it more like a classic bloody mary. Unfortunately, nothing could help this drink. "Grass" is the first thing that comes to mind when drinking this, and not in a good way. It's essentially like drinking watered-down salsa with alcohol. Not good.  -Boozy Smoothie:  Another radical drink. Coffee, banana and bourbon. Amazing. Only sad thing was the tiny glass it came in.  Main Courses:  -Cornmeal Pancakes: These were dry and uninteresting. The lemon curd was good, but they were not even close to Mission Beach Cafe's pancakes with bourbon syrup and vanilla cream.  -Country ham steak & poached farm egg: This dish was an odd combo of cold potatoes, mustard and cabbage with the eggs and ham done in the style of a benedict without the english muffins. It just felt off.  All of the egg dishes at Zazie blow this out of the water.  -"Marlowe" burger: My brother in law is a burger eater. He gets them pretty much everywhere we go. His rating for this one - good, but not on his top 5. (If you're wondering, NOPA's burger is #1 on his list.)  -Crispy polenta cakes: This dish was the best of the batch. The polenta was crunchy on the outside and creamy on the inside, the eggs were perfectly poached. However, even this dish was lacking something. A spice? Another ingredient? Not sure, but it didn't make up for the rest.  If you're going to charge as much as Park Tavern does, your food should be exceptional. Sadly, PT's brunch was really a let down. The hardest thing for these guys will be living up to all of the delicious and reasonably priced competition in this city. So far, I would tell anyone considering this place to keep walking a little further to Mama's at Stockton and Filbert. There may be a line, but it's definitely one of the best brunches you'll get in in San Francisco.

G_bLSTFN6XPBCcTYR9wXLg.review_text: This place has delicious food, but more importantly, great service. Such amazing service, in fact, I decided to right my first Yelp view to recommend them.   I had made a reservation for 4 but 3 of us arrived originally. We were seated at a table, given menus, and ordered drinks.
