My friend asked out server's opinion of one of the wines, and rather than speak about a wine he hadn't tried, he brought her out a sample of the wine she requested, plus one the bartender said she might prefer. She loved both and ended up opting for the bartenders recommendation.   Our 4th arrived with an unexpected 5th in tow. Park tavern was able to move us to a new table, and even brought our drinks to follow us. Basically, we felt incredibly cared for, despite realizing the in convince we posed.   In summary of the food:  the Brussels sprout chips were delicious, simple, and tasted like lemon. The demons on horseback was the least kosher thing one could imagine, but savory and delicious. I had the salmon which was surprisingly filling, given how fresh it was. I would recommend everything I ate.

k6zYbMle3LI9jhMuY4Tc4w.review_text: My favorite place to eat in San Francisco. Their food is creative, flavorful, and difficult to make at home--my kind of restaurant! I've been here 20+ times (I live 2 blocks away), and I have never been disappointed with a single dish or cocktail. Things you must try at dinner: deviled eggs (GET THEM!), poulet noir (and I don't usually order chicken at restaurants), PT fries, brussel sprout chips,  bar steak, and cheddar apple crisp. Things you must try at brunch: avocado toast, cod cakes, and polenta cakes with mushrooms. The only downsides to PT are the prices and crowds. It's easy to rack up a hefty bill when you're ordering multiple dishes to share and $13 cocktails. Plan to make a reservation well in advance, or go early to grab space at the communal bar and table. IMO, the best way to experience PT is to make a reservation for brunch, sit outside on a nice sunny day, and watch all the tourists wait in line at Mama's while you dine on far superior food. :)

uDVjr3NG7neV8OyqstRLsg.review_text: Nice location, nice atmosphere.  Sat at the bar and got great service. Cocktails were solid.  Apps: Brussels Sprout chips - solid, not amazing Demons on Horseback - ok. They sound better than they are  Entrees: Marlowe burger - a solid burger. Not quite up to NOPA or Spruce Bar Steak - A little small (8 oz) for the price. Perfectly cooked but a bit bland  Dessert: Bread pudding - delicious Creme brulee - very good  All in all a solid meal, but I suppose my expectations were too high. I don't feel any particular need to return.

LaCr6FqS0H8NlsK0hfhENw.review_text: I have only been for drinks, so I'll have to remember to update when I go back to eat.  We did try to make a reservation but couldn't get in, we tried to make it on Saturday afternoon for Saturday night, so next time we'll try earlier! I went with a couple of friends on a Saturday night.  We were lucky enough to get some barstools at the bar.  The bartenders were awesome, a lot of fun!  They were joking around with us and having a good time while getting the drinks out quickly and well made!   The setup is cool.  The bar is on one side with a long bar to sit at, a long communal type table behind it and a couple little tables.  No TV.   The dining room is next door but visible through the bar.  The kitchen is also open in the back of the dining room.   I will definitely be back to eat, the menu looked very good, and all of the food going by us looked yummy!

YnHf1BPFjfj3kK_i1AC4rQ.review_text: Came here last saturday 4 a quick bite~ I was very excited to try this place for its burger! Boy was I disappointed!! We came in ordered and had a couple of drinks our order took 1 hour because they lost our ticket. This made me upset because we were late to our comedy show down the block~ to top it off the burger tasted like it was left out for an hour and then someone realized it and reheated it. I Will not recommend this place 4 its service or burgers!

HyEzkIrCiYvd_97ZR79W7A.review_text: I love this place. Ambiance is great, staff is warm and friendly, and the cocktails and food are pretty tasty. Check it out. One of the classier joints in North Beach.

NB3P04f2cyoYZC9iUfcpNQ.review_text: Dinner was great! Had the deviled eggs, Brussel sprout chips, homemade beef jerky, mussels, twice cooked potatoes, and crab and lobster bisque. Carafe of wines are a great deal and permit sampling of wines. Lively atmosphere and they were super nice to our picky 13 year old. Will definitely go back.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: Pretty decent brunch - but there was a couple of breakdowns in communication with our server. We ordered two types of toasts and only got the avocado toast.   My friends all ordered the Marlowe burger which was solid. I ordered the cod cake which was okay. I requested a fried egg on top and ended up getting an overdone poached egg. I requested again to have a fried egg and it finally came towards the end of the meal.  Overall the food was good and service friendly. I'd love to come by and try the dinner menu.

mYZBDDWikrnSexphG9YMvg.review_text: This happening restaurant will make any long time San Franciscan forget Moose's even existed. The patrons are a diverse mix of young & old that have a passion for wining and dining in the big city. It's cozy with a hip & trendy vibe. Definitely a "see-and-be-seen" crowd on the weekends, but not pretentious. It definitely has an NYC restaurant feel. Most importantly the food is the center of the attraction and will have me returning more than once.   A must is the smoked deviled eggs and the brussels sprouts chips to start of your meal on the right track. The highlight, of course, was the rotisserie chicken from their wood oven. My first bite was a food orgasm in my mouth. SMH, chicken is usually the most boring item to order from most restaurants unless you get it from Costco (Joke).  Park Tavern had me at first bite.

C-2rmPpqDp-KBHMuWPa5Yg.review_text: Really looked forward to my night here, loved the food, delish! Had the pork belly bites, brussel sprout chips, and fried oyster caesar for apps, the scallops, mussels and a side of polenta for entree. Like I said delish!   Why not 5 stars than you ask....Got here a couple minutes early for my reservation. Told out table was not quite ready...no problem, I will have a drink. Person who was community table server was at the other end of the table but never bothered "looking" down his station to be aware of the whole picture (major pet peeve of mine) After trying to get his attention several times my friend and I went to the bar at which time our other friend finally waved him down. So we got our drinks and were sipping them and he comes over and asks us what time our reservation was for 8p he says, and I say no it was for 7:45p (it was a bit after 8p) and proceeds to give us a check and asked us to get up as there were several people hovering around for our seats...OMG, are you joking??? especially since the drinks were close to $40. I was very turned off by that and did something I never do at a restaurant, I went to the manager and asked if it was OK if we sat there till out table was ready (especially since we were on time and it was going on 30 min at this point)...she said absolutely and asked who said it wasn't...I had to tattle on this guy as it was some of the worst customer service I have encountered in a restaurant in a LONG time. About 10 minutes later they sat us at a nice table by the line ( I love watching the action, I have been in the business for my whole working life). Thank you manager/head hostess (gal with blond hair, wearing a gray sweater, sorry I forgot to ask your name) as you changed the sour taste in my mouth that your ridiculous acting server put in it...then also the food helped.

SrR2QuFU04EuYgsoKKh8Ww.review_text: Excellent service. We waited a bit longer than expected and they gave us complementary appetizers.  The food was very good. The group had the burger, poached eggs + polenta, french toast.  All were good to excellent although the french toast wasn't anything particularly special.  Overall, a really nice brunch experience and great atmosphere.

B-nMZAVydQK45uPCFKS-4w.review_text: Been a fan of The Cavalier and Marlowe so Park Tavern had been on my list of a next great meal.  Went there for my BDay dinner.  Everything was amazing -  food, decor, ambiance & service.  The place was hopping on a Mon nite, pretty incredible in the restaurant biz.  We had lemon chips w burrata and PT fries w truffle, soft-cooked eggs and caviar to start. Somehow I'm still missing Cavalier's chicken fat fries.  Duck was slightly over cooked and on the chewy side but still decent.  Petrale sole was perfectly cooked.  Gnocchi w wild mushrooms & thyme was lightly browned on the outside and delivers plenty of flavor.  Side dishes: butter-braised spinach and broccolini were over cooked, but brown butter brussel sprouts were great.  Had Dave's classic carrot BDay cake w cream cheese frosting which could go down as the best carrot cake in history!  Both the olive oil polenta cake w almond ice cream and the carrot cake were incredibly light yet delicious which are hard to do.    Will go back to explore the rest of the menus for sure!

JoBmWW62xDOkXr2anyxfag.review_text: I came for brunch with a few friends last weekend. Reservations are a must. It looked like they had a bar area for walk-ins, but it was completely full. We were all very hungry, but luckily our table was ready when we arrived.   Atmosphere: classy, trendy, modern. Perfect for impressing a hot date. Not especially intimate and can get somewhat noisy when crowded.  We ordered a few starters to share: Toast with avocado - eh, I could have made this at home Almond croissant - yum! Ginger scone - good  Service was a little lacking, but we didn't need much and our waitress looked frantic trying to deal with all of her tables, so I'll let that slide.   For my brunch meal I ordered the butter lettuce and lobster salad. It was...small. In fact, all of the dishes at our table were small. The french toast came with 3 measly little pieces. The baked farm eggs seemed to imply that there would be multiple eggs, but it looked like just one.   On the plus side, plating was beautiful and the food was tasty. The salad was fresh and had a nice citrus/dill dressing that was not too overwhelming.   As a brunch restaurant, I thought it was pretty pricey for the quantity/quality. But it's a beautiful restaurant and their dinner menu looks amazing so I will give them another try at a different meal time.

lWo6aN2oGlfDM63QlWA2tA.review_text: Delicious and creative appetizers. Best pork chop I think I've ever had.

OkKhe06jHEuTcc2tRnKOmA.review_text: One of my favorite places in SF! You can't order anything that isn't delicious!!

KW6RvGFFoLfsYWJm1R5Ztg.review_text: Super chic, modern atmosphere with many young business professionals around.  I ate here a few weeks ago, and I can't stop thinking about the Herb Crusted Petrale Sole.   A good wine and drink menu, this is a great date and business spot.   I was told they have a great brunch as well.

pweUyY48ofg9NvZQkX1TAA.review_text: We called Park Tavern last night at 8pm to see if they could fit us in and luckily enough, they could take our party of four at 9pm.  We got there about 8:30 to enjoy a drink at the bar while we waited.  The bar staff was friendly and helpful even though the place was packed.    We were seated and our waitress quickly introduced herself, got our drink order and answered questions about the menu.  We started with the deviled eggs, brussels sprouts, and saikou salmon.  All were delicious, the deviled eggs were some of the best I have had.  I asked our waitress to suggest her favorite main course- she said either the pork chop or the ahi.  My husband got the ahi, I got the pork chop and we split them.  The ahi was well prepared but not really my think, the pork was out of this world.  A friend got the clams, which were the best I have ever had.    The atmosphere was lively and fun, the decor was beautiful and the food delicious.  We will definitely be back again soon.

g9izi6iE-z9rmkqQiqEcuA.review_text: great food and vibe. right outside from the park, nice place to eat and drink on a Sunday morning

h49RXxqFgb6YO4dlhJ5J6A.review_text: Really three-and-a-half stars.  The best thing about this place were the appetizers. We had the truffle fries, gnocchi (a favorite), brussels sprout chips, and deviled eggs. All were phenomenal.  But I only have one word to describe the entrees: SALTY. I had the scallops, which were served with cooked vegetables and  some other meat pieces that tasted like bacon. It was good, but too salty. I had to ask for bread mid-way to make more headway with my dish.  One of my friends had the Poulet Noir (a whole cornish hen, I think). Huge and good, but too salty. Another friend had the clams and mussels. Too salty.  In sum, our Park Tavern culinary experience began spectacularly, but failed to deliver at the end.

-hjrwl_RfUihPhJLGk_HVw.review_text: Amazing food and considering it's on the fancy side.. The servers were all very sweet and accommodating when it came to my daughter. Will definitely be back again!

MzGWr2vMWYjHto0RUpBwFA.review_text: Love this place- great ambiance, great cocktails, and delicious menu options. Always recommend to friends who are visiting SF.  Space is a little dark, but very warm and inviting.

T6ZD-41BIo86-MuYPHzPUA.review_text: This is the happenin' restaurant in North Beach currently. Been here twice for drinks before booking for dinner. The food was very good. We only had one disappointing dish: the Cabernet Steak. It was dry, not tasty and small---$38.  Also they stuck us in the far corner of the restaurant, when it was quite empty. This was a bummer since I wanted to sit where I could experience more of the restaurant.   Some highlights: 1. Service - It was like a choreographed dance. Our server was Patrick. He was awesome. 2. Deviled Eggs 3. Poulet Noir - The hen. Get it, it's great. 4. The bar and lounge. There is a loungey area upstairs and a lively bar downstairs. Very cool.  Next time I come here I think I am going to opt out of the entrees and order a bunch of apps and sides since they were so great. Also I hear the cocktails are amazing, I only had beer and wine. Oh yea... I said and.

BdRMVROS1MXOHxr-bdZv0g.review_text: Solid and substantial brunch.  Wouldn't mind returning, but wouldn't be top of my list.  We ordered the avocado toast (more flavorful than you'd expect), marlowe burger, smoked salmon benedict, and deviled eggs open sandwich.  We finished everything (though partially out of hunger?) and thought they were delicious.  Best brunch #EVER? no. but great option in a great neighborhood without lines.

ffNHO9S7BZKgRBsM8nlENQ.review_text: Picks: Mojito ($12) - was strong and perfectly balanced, they know how to make drinks here. Excellent, complimentary warm Acme epi bread. Brussels Sprout Chips ($6) are a classic dish moved over from Marlowe, light, greasy, perfect. Lemon & basil leaf, burrata ($12) featured homemade mozzarella cheese that was slightly runny along with deep fried lemon wheels that made an interesting but workable combination. Manila clam chowder, shaved bottarga & chives ($12) was creamy and full of flavor, all in all very good. Deviled Eggs, bacon, pickled jalepeño & chives ($1.50 ea) are a must order. We were not fans of deviled eggs, but with one bite we were believers. Petit "Poulet Rouge" Bloomsdale spinach & Peewee potatoes ($24) was a Cornish game hen presented at the table facing upright with a tableside sauce pour. This chicken was very tender and juicy and a must order. The Bloomsdale spinach and kiwi potatoes were also excellent. This dish gives Zuni Cafe a run for their money. Grilled pork chop, Italian butter bean piston, dinosaur kale, toasted garlic & chili flakes ($24) was cut in two and perfectly cooked to a juicy medium rare. A must get for pork fans like us. Creekstone NY Steak, red wine jus, Mangalitsa butter & french fries ($29) featured two triangles of medium (slightly pink in the middle) tender meat with angular charcoal grilling embedded on the surface. Excellent french fries and a very robust sauce. Special of the Day: Brussel Sprout Hearts ($7) were sauteed with lemon and cheese, a very nice side dish. Dessert: Fig & apple crisp ($7) Whole lemon gelato took about 15 minutes to arrive, hot out of the oven, but worth the wait due to the very fresh fruit and tasty crumble. The gelato was first class. Birthday Cake - November ($7) Casey's carrot cake was the cake of the month and a great version of the classic. Better than most people expect. Pans: Mendocino uni, butter lettuce, chili & avocado oil ($11) - Simply did not work. They need to perform some surgery on this dish. Full blog post: foodnut.com/844/park-tav…

notPJ9iEf1aw_wuu_4fsdg.review_text: *3.5 stars*  Park Tavern is designed to be perfect for any occasion -- birthdays, business meetings, catchups with friends, anything. It has a great atmosphere, thanks to the excellent design of the place.   The service was absolutely incredible. From the hostess to the bar server to our wonderful dining server, Emily, everything was on-point. We had to add 2 people last-minute to our table, and Emily graciously and happily helped us move to another table halfway through our meal. It really made our experience that much more enjoyable.  The food was a hit or miss for us. I'm a fan of Marlowe, so I was expecting the same level of excellence here, but it was just lacking a bit when compared to Marlowe.  ---------------------------- FOOD:  Deviled Eggs = Delicious. Everything goes together perfectly.  Brussels Sprouts Chips = Addictive as always. Can't go wrong here.  PT Fries = Good, but nothing spectacular. The caviar wasn't salty enough to bring the flavors together between the egg yolk and the aioli. Half of the fries were overfried.  Grilled Pork Chop = Tender for the most part and had a pure flavor to it. It wasn't exciting, but it was definitely a well-cooked pork chop.  Mussels and Clams = This was good, but again, nothing exciting.  3 Variations of Duck = I had high hopes for this one, but again, it fell short. The duck breast was a bit dry, the duck confit was a bit overcooked, the duck skin wasn't crispy enough, and the duck liver mousse was too watery. The flavors were all there, it just could've been so much better. Plus, the beans didn't really add anything beneficial to the dish.  Venison Tartare = This dish was a great attempt, but was definitely lacking in execution. The beef tartare was good, but it was missing something with a bit more umami (for instance, it could've used some sesame oil or quail egg). The deep-fried bone marrow is an interesting idea, but was completely lackluster in execution. The bits of bone marrow was easily overpowered by the breading and it just tasted like fried oil.  Hamachi Crudo w/ Gin & Tonic = This dish wasn't good at all. There was no depth or excitement whatsoever -- it needed a couple of extra layers of flavor (something salty, something tangy) to really make the hamachi pop. Unfortunately, it ended up being just a bland, strange mixture of flavors between the overpowering cucumber, the bland gin & tonic ice, and the nonexistent flavor of the hamachi.  ----------------------------  All in all, Park Tavern is a good space with a great bar and phenomenal service. I'd definitely come back for some drinks and small bites. The food, however, just doesn't match up to everything else.

ceowV9LSKZEb397yVDqdgA.review_text: Probably closer to 3.5 stars, but since I have to choose, 4 versus 3. We were excited to try this place after hearing a lot about it so my group of 6 girls friends met for dinner. Cocktails are good and we were seated on time. We had a nice table and service was overall good and in general, the space is pretty cool.  Food is where this place is lacking. The bread they served was rock solid, several of us commented on it. They brought us another basket which was fine. The fried pork belly sounded divine but was the most disappointing thing we tried. Even with a group of 6, no one liked it enough to have another one. What was delicious was my basil, burrata and lemon appetizer. Very innovative and clean.   I made the mistake of ordering the mussels which after reading Anthony Bourdains book, you should never order mussels unless you know the chef. They were fine, but for the price, it wasn't much food and it wasn't anything exciting.  Talking to some of the girls after, everyone thought the same thing, the food was fine, but nothing great and not a place that we'd go out of our way to go back to.

xwhDvpei1SrwUJjawvfgkQ.review_text: I love places like this. The vibes are awesome here. We had dinner here but sat outside since we had our frenchie with us and it was great. The beers on tap can satisfy any beer lover. The entrees were solid. But what was most memorable was the bacon deviled eggs!!

DeP-XBTwL8pRYjfr83RWCA.review_text: Came here without a reservation around 12pm on Sunday.  We were able to sit right away at the communal table behind the bar area, which wasn't overcrowded at the time.  I had their polenta cakes with poached eggs, truffled salsa verde, sauteed mushrooms and parmesan... one word: amazing.  I will be dreaming about this brunch.  This is definitely a must try in SF, and I will be back.  My boyfriend really enjoyed their seasonal french toast dish, although I'm pretty sure my polenta cakes stole the show :)

1nWwwKZ3dBKdyH0V2weWOw.review_text: Just went here for Sunday brunch and had a nice time. Between 3 of us, we split 4 dishes so we could try different things:  Avocado Toast: simple and delicious Crispy Polenta Cakes: MUST HAVE, this has an amazing crispy outside and creamy inside; if I came back, I'd just get this Open-Faced Deviled Eggs Sandwich: the flavors didn't work all that well together for me, BUT the fries that came with it are delicious Braised Lamb Tongue: I was hoping for more marinated and broken down tongue; the texture still looked like tongue and didn't taste all that great; plus we hardly touched the potatoes that came with it since they were pretty plain  The atmosphere is nice but would recommend getting there at opening if you don't have a reservation to snag an outside table or sit in the communal area.   The reason I gave 3 stars instead of 4 is that the service was spotty. Seemed like the waitstaff was spread really thin and we had a hard time flagging down our server since she was all over the restaurant. Plus some of the dishes were great, but not all.

1WtwGYGC4rE-Cy3LMAro3A.review_text: Second impression:  Great atmosphere, great crowd, good drinks, but food pretty bad.  I soooo want this to be my go-to nice place in the neighborhood, and maybe we ordered wrong but almost everything we ate was over-seasoned.  And we love salt/spice!!   Positives:  deviled eggs were great, as was my "Old Cuban" run drink.  But then..... sole was a paltry cut and indistinguishable in taste from the artichokes,etc. on the plate.  Spinach side dish was garlicky to the extreme; basically inedible.  Fries over-truffled and the egg that accompanied it would have been salty enough with the caviar, so why did they crack sea salt on it too?  Brussel sprouts side dish was drowning in butter.  Left a lot of food on our plates even though we weren't particularly full.  Service was fine, and I do love the atmosphere, so I'll try it one more time and try to find a favorite dish so I can enjoy the positives of Park Tavern and ALSO enjoy my meal.

7Aam_c0xRw0VZbc0zhS3VQ.review_text: Great service and understanding staff.   The location is very convenient to Beach Blanket Babylon.  Here are some recommendations:  Appetizers - Truffle fries were heavenly.  My husband loved the soft boiled egg and caviar.  The deviled eggs are small but tasty.  Main Course - Chicken with truffle stuffing was absolutely delicious - best roast chicken ever.   My husband described his skate as delightful  Dessert - We were very full by this time but we had to order the coconut bread pudding.  That was sooo good.   It was buttery and not over sweet.   I would have licked the plate if I were out in public as the sauce was yummy.  Drinks -  We liked the McClarin and the PT Old Fashioned best.

qS7Yq15oqMY5oIl1OI1vDQ.review_text: I have such mixed opinion about my visit tonight that I wasn't sure that I should a review as it may be incoherent.  I think the experience started out on the wrong foot. We arrived 15 min before our reservation and the hostess had just left her station to seat another party.  Someone else asked us if we had been helped to which we said no and that we had reservations. He asked if we'd like to sit at the bar and wait for a few minutes or if we'd like to be seated right away.  We said we'd like to be seated.  He left and the hostess came back. I don't think there was time for the guy and the hostess to talk so she naturally asked us about our reservation. She then asked us to the bar area until our table was ready. Strange. Well, we did.  We barely ordered and got our drinks (5 min maybe?) when she came up to us to tell us our table was ready. Really? Why did you bother to tell us to go to bar? We asked if our bar tab could be transferred to the table and she said it was preferable that we take care of the bar tab first.  So, I had my husband go get seated white I paid the bar tab.  When I got to our table, I saw that most all the tables around us (about 6?) were all empty.  So, why did they make us go to the bar first only to come get us 5 min later?  Mind you, everyone (including the bartenders) was super friendly and nice.  They just created a slight inconvenience right up front.  Our server at the table started off a bit odd too. Just as she started to explain the special to us, she abruptly excused herself to help serve the food to the next table.  She then came back to finish explaining the special.  Really odd.  After that experience, service was almost flawless (almost because we asked for more bread but had to ask again before we got some).  If it weren't for the experience right up front, we would have rated the service at Park Tavern 5 stars (I'll explain later).  Deviled eggs, PT fries, and steak tartar (special of the night) were had for appetizers.  We really had come prepared to eat!  All were all great as we had expected and hoped.  We finished off the drinks from the bar and had the 2000 Caymus Cabernet that we brought with us decanted during appetizers.  (Corkage is $20, by the way.)  Dinner was seafood plate and filet mignon.  Both were completely forgettable and were a bit on the salty side (and I tend to eat a bit salty usually!). Filet wasn't what I expected (to melt in my mouth).  The twice cooked potatoes with the filet were too salty and creamed greens a  bit too mushy.  The real disappointment was the dessert.  Hubby had birthday cake because it was his birthday.  I ordered raspberry blueberry crisp and I couldn't take more than 2 bites (hubby took 2 bites too).  It was so salty and that flavor mixed with meyer lemon curd just made it inedible. The server offered to take it back and see if they could bring me another one without the sea salt (I asked no lemon curd either).  A different person (maitre d maybe?) came  by to tell me that the breading on top (the crisp par of the crisp) had salt in it already so he didn't think I would like it without any topping either.. He asked if I wanted another so I got the panna cotta.  (He was so nice and gracious!)  It was plain and a bit... yes, salty.  When the guy came by to ask how my dessert was, I didn't have the heart to tell him I didn't like it (hubby ate it b/c he hates to leave leftovers).  He was so genuinely nice!  When the check was brought, the server let us know that they didn't charge for either desserts.  Again superb service.   How to rate?

yb2erMSDuAAl7-KRnPX_RA.review_text: I normally don't brunch in North Beach but on Saturday my friends and I checked out this place before trying wedding dresses near by. Amaze me the number of great reviews this restaurant has, I would have to come again and see if it amaze me as well, it definitely didn't this time around.  Things you need to know, for brunch this restaurant is in the pricey side and portions are not too big. I loved my dish and everything else looked delicious, but was a bit meh that some of us left hungry after eating here. Figured we should have ordered more than one dish. I ordered the beef hash and was very delicious, a bit salty for me but I enjoyed it very much. We also had a pitcher of a vodka lemon drink, was just ok.  I was not a fan of the service, super slow! It took a long time to get our food, to get the check, to get receipts back. Lots of smiles but there's opportunity for improvement on the service part. Service is a big part of a good restaurant, I was upset the Whole time because was too slow for me.  I would love to check it for dinner. The presentation of dishes was great, but again for brunch I personally would like bigger portions.

rocDFDgw5uO594m9J_Ztpg.review_text: Park Tavern is the best place to celebrate. Great cocktails, the deviled eggs truly are delicious and the chicken is amazing. The first time I came here the stuffing with the chicken was amazing (crispy but juicy), but the next time I came there were just some vegetables which was a bummer. Hopefully it's seasonal and the stuffing will be back soon!

NRQ7RN_opFn_q3aB80vJMg.review_text: I have such mixed feelings about this place...  I live in the neighborhood, so I badly want to love it, but it's just too inconsistent.  I've had a decent dinner, a great dinner, a pretty terrible brunch, great snacks + drinks, and awful service.   Today in particular was a low point: I brought my parents here for a late lunch & cocktails. I requested a table outside and was told it would be about a 30 - 45 minute wait. Ok, cool. So we strolled around the park and Goorin Brothers as we waited for our table. Upon our return, we were told our table indoors was being set up. I reminded the hostess that I had requested an outdoor table. She shrugged her shoulders and told us they didn't have one. If we wanted an outdoor table, we could be put on the list and it would be about 30-45 minutes. I, then, reminded her that I had been on that list and waited 45 minutes. Our hostess than flatly said that there weren't any notes on our reservation and that there must have been a communication error. I told her that if there had been a communication issue, it would have been between us, since it was she I had spoken to 45 minutes prior. She again shrugged. Ridiculous! In the end, they didn't really seem to care that they'd made a mistake nor did they try in any way to make it right. So, we decided not to, again, wait 45 minutes for the outdoor table... instead we walked down the street and into Original Joe's.  I also happen to work by their new sister restaurant The Cavalier, which I actually like much better. Better interior (funnily enough - it used to be Million Dollar Thai), better cocktails, and better service.  I agree with most of the reviews;  Come here for the smoked deviled eggs, marlowe burger, cocktails, the pt fries.  Better dinner spots in the neighborhood: Capo's, The Square, Don Pisto's or Ferry Plaza Seafood.

psmhldmFmJpFR4ySWUG-8Q.review_text: Park Tavern is my favorite restaurant in the city.   From the owners to the janitors, this place is world-class. It was built right, it is staffed right, and the food is f--king phenomenal. I eat there maybe once a month and they treat me like I'm family. My friends ask me why I'm so obsessed; "There are way nicer restaurants than Park" is often what I hear- that's not what I care about. Quality and class have nothing to do with price or exclusivity.  The host/ess is always in full control of the restaurant; they take a drink order if we arrive early. The bartenders are professionals. The servers are informed and discreet about any special requests, and not once in the many times I've eaten there have they made a mistake.  The food- I show up, order two deviled eggs, a McClaren, a glass of water, and the pork, and I'm good. It's priced right and the reviews here speak for it.   Anna Weinberg is doing things right, customer for life right here. I have plenty of places I love in the city but there is nowhere that makes more of an understated, flawless effort to simply get ev-er-y-thing right from the reservation to helping you into your jacket on the way out the door.

CnsIqu8Hu2UqJICNFW7SYA.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and eat at the bar quit often.  Last night I came in and there is a new menu which I absolutely it's easier to read and I wanted to try everything.  There is a classic selection from the Chef with stuff like beef jerky and deviled eggs which were delicious.  For my mains I wasn't super hungry so I went for the crab salad :-) which was light and fresh and delicious... My BFF went for the poulet noir which comes with stuffing and black truffle, WOW -:)  We sat at the Bar and Brian was just amazing.  Keep up the good work Park Tavern.

2fN8mN7uUjOw-QqtcgYqXQ.review_text: Food: 4 Decor: 4 Service: 3  Came here for a work brunch on a Saturday around 12:30pm.  1. Oregon Bay Shrimp, 12 Creamy harissa, chives & lemon ~Pretty good.
